Classes.Name: AfterMapObjDrawAir
Classes.Notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. Unlike other Air objects, this gets executed and rendered after most other objects.

Obj_arg0.Name: Range
Obj_arg0.Description: Active distance from player's position.

Obj_arg1.Name: Hide during Intro?
Obj_arg1.Description: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

Obj_arg2.Name: Always Active?
Obj_arg2.Description: Always active if enabled.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_B.Description: Disappears if activated, reappears if deactivated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Appears if 消滅 action gets triggered.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: AncientCage
Classes.Notes: A stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera. It also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Activated after the cage has disappeared.

SW_B.Description: Opens the cage if activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the cage gets opened.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchMove
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchMoveEndKill
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Once the Move.bck animation has ended, the object will kill itself. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. AnmModelKill specifies the sound effect used when it kills itself. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once the object kills itself.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchMoveEndKillAnyAnim
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Once any of the Move animations has ended, the object will kill itself. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. AnmModelKill specifies the sound effect used when it kills itself. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchMoveInvalidateCollision
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Additionally, the collision will be disabled once it has moved once. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchMoveValidateCollision
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. Additionally, the collision will be disabled until it has moved. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchSwapVisibility
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model, collision and a Move.bva visibility animation that will play its Move animations once certain conditions are met. The Move.bva animation's initial frame will be used until the conditions are met. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AnmModelSwitchSyncBrk
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model, collision and a Reverse.brk animation that will play its Move and Reverse.brk animations once certain conditions are met. The Reverse.brk animation's last frame will be used until the conditions are met. It uses several sound effects. AnmModelMoveStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts moving. AnmModelMoveLoop specifies the looping sound effect that is played while it moves. AnmModelStop specifies the sound effect used when it stops moving. AnmModelReverse specifies the sound effect used when the Reverse.brk animations starts playing. Furthermore, it can use several particle effects as well. Start specifies the particles used when it starts moving. EndLoop specifies the particles used after it stopped moving. It can also shake the screen and rumble the player's Wiimote if a proper PadAndCameraCtrl file is provided. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object starts moving when this switch is activated. This switch will be ignored if it registered a cutscene nerve action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it start moving.

Classes.Name: AreaMoveSphere
Classes.Notes: Moves compatible objects inside this area if they are bound to a floor triangle with the collision type AreaMove. Compatible objects are the player itself, BombBird and its bombs, Kuribo, Karon and CocoNut.

Obj_arg0.Name: Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ArrowSwitch
Classes.Notes: A rotating switch object that can be activated using Spin Attacks.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Direction
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the rotation when hit.

Obj_arg1.Name: Activation Mode
Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, it cannot be hit again until the SW_A event deactivates again.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated when hit, deactivated when hit again.

Classes.Name: AssemblyBlock
Classes.Notes: Remains at a resting position above the object's actual position. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur".

Obj_arg0.Name: Activation Range
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the activation range to the player's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

Obj_arg1.Name: Activation Time
Obj_arg1.Description: If Obj_arg7 is set, this specifies the timer until the block disappears again.

Obj_arg7.Name: Is Timed?
Obj_arg7.Description: If enabled, the block will be activated for a set amount of time only.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen to prevent it from disappearing by player 2.

Classes.Name: AttackRock
Classes.Notes: Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves.

Obj_arg0.Name: Bowser Encounter Number
Obj_arg0.Description: If greater than 1, the rock will emit a purple quake wave once it lands.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: AttackRockFinal
Classes.Notes: These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser.

Obj_arg0.Name: First Appearance Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: AttackRockTutorial
Classes.Notes: A rock that appears from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb which can be smashed into KoopaSeals.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the player stands on the rock.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: AudioEffectArea
Classes.Notes: Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

Obj_arg0.Name: Effect Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies which effect configuration to use.

Obj_arg1.Name: Priority
Obj_arg1.Description: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: AutoMakeMapObj
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: BakuBaku
Classes.Notes: A skull that moves around freely or on a set path. It "eats" away parts of objects that are compatible with ClipDrawArea. This enemy cannot be defeated at all.

Path_arg0.Name: Speed
Path_arg0.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Registered but never triggered since this enemy cannot be defeated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BallBeamer
Classes.Notes: A variant of a Ring Beamer which periodically emits "spherical" rings that scale along with gravity. The rings will shock the player upon contact. It cannot be destroyed through normal means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Ring Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the individual rings grow. Default is 12.

Obj_arg1.Name: Ring Duration
Obj_arg1.Description: The lifetime of an individual ring before it disappears. Default is 530.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether to use a special model for the shadow or not.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only be able to emit rings while this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, this object will be killed once this switch gets activated.

Classes.Name: Balloonfish
Classes.Notes: A blow fish enemy that inflates once the player gets in its range. It will then home onto the player and explode after a certain amount of time.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BalloonFruit
Classes.Notes: A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

SW_A.Description: If used, the fruit can only be eaten when this switch is active.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and swung by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: BallOpener
Classes.Notes: If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be cracked open.

SW_A.Description: Activated after a Star Ball gets cracked open.

Classes.Name: BallRail
Classes.Notes: An invisible rail for the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning.

Obj_arg0.Name: Acceleration
Obj_arg0.Description: Acceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 1500.

Obj_arg1.Name: Deceleration
Obj_arg1.Description: Deceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 995.

Rail.Description: The path that the Star Ball will move on.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: Banekiti
Classes.Notes: A strange enemy whose bouncy springs repel the player when they are using the Boo power-up. It cannot be defeated through any means.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BasaBasa
Classes.Notes: A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. If the player comes within its range, it will fly towards them to attack. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze the player if touched, provided that they are not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player has the Ice power-up.

Obj_arg0.Name: Detection Range
Obj_arg0.Description: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range
Obj_arg1.Description: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Specifies the flying path that it will move on.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: Battan
Classes.Notes: A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees the player, it will move towards them to fall down on them. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. It spawns 7 Star Bits when defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.

Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range
Obj_arg1.Description: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting the player.

Obj_arg2.Name: Spawn no Star Bits?
Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Defines the path that it moves on passively.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BattanKing
Classes.Notes: A large stone block boss. He can summon Whimps that will try to attack the player like Whomps do. The boss himself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like his smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto the player to attack them. He can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, the player can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage him. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. He always spawns a Power Star.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Starting Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after defeating the boss.

SW_A.Description: Starts the intro cutscene if the switch gets activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Values.Value: バッタンキング基準位置

DemoCast.Description: Registers to the cutscenes with the names バッタンキング登場 and バッタンキングダウン. They are used when the boss appears or disappears, respectively.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Message.Description: BattanKing000 is the dialogue used before the fight. BattanKing001 is the dialogue used after the fight.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: BeeEater
Classes.Notes: A stretchy plant with spikes that will lunge onto the player to damage them. Cannot be defeated, however, they can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at them.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BeeFlowerHover
Classes.Notes: A rotating platform that can be stood on using the Bee power-up. If the player does not have this power-up and touches the platform, it will temporarily disappear.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rotation's speed.

Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Classes.Name: BeeJumpBall
Classes.Notes: A bouncy berry that can be bounced off with the Bee power-up. If touched by the player while they don't have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.

Classes.Name: BeeWallShortDistArea
Classes.Notes: If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: BegomanBaby
Classes.Notes: A small robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. However, it can be defeated using Spin Attacks. If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning
Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BegomanLauncher
Classes.Notes: A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time, but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

Obj_arg2.Name: Activation Delay
Obj_arg2.Description: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

Obj_arg3.Name: Number of Topman
Obj_arg3.Description: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If activated, the spawner will be deactivated. Also kills any Spring and Spike Topman in SMG2.

Classes.Name: BegomanSpike
Classes.Notes: A rotating robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. If the player touches its spiky head, they will take damage. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning
Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will be defeated immediately.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BegomanSpring
Classes.Notes: A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which the player can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until the player gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Returning
Obj_arg0.Description: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after killing this enemy.

SW_A.Description: If not enabled, it will remain stationary.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will be defeated immediately.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when player gets bounced off.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BellyDragon
Classes.Notes: A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star when defeated. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated. Cannot be used if registered to a cutscene.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦）

Camera.Description: Used during the intro, midway cutscene and ending.

DemoCast.Description: Special cutscene used before the actual boss fight begins. The cutscene is expected to be called ベリードラゴンデモ（クッパＪｒ登場）.

Message.Description: DemoOpeningKoopaJrBellyDragon is used during the intro cutscene with Bowser Jr.

Classes.Name: BendSwanpPlanet
Classes.Notes: A special planet that can fold two times. Each state also has a separate collision mesh that gets loaded in. Usually, the planet will be in its unfolded state. SW_A and SW_B are used to fold it.

SW_A.Description: If activated, it will enter the first folding state.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will enter the second folding state.

Classes.Name: BenefitItemInvincible
Classes.Notes: An item that grants the player the Invincibility power-up when collected.

Obj_arg0.Name: SW_APPEAR Behavior
Obj_arg0.Description: How it functions when its SW_APPEAR switch gets triggered.

Values.Notes: Already appeared but SW_APPEAR starts rotation, escaping, etc.

Obj_arg1.Description: How the item behaves after appearing.

Obj_arg2.Description: How it escapes after appearing. Requires Obj_arg1 set to 1,2, 3 or 4.

Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the clipping type. Requires Obj_arg4 set to -1, 1, 2 or 3.

Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies whether it should use the appearance camera or not.

Obj_arg6.Name: Rotation Type

Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length / Clipping Radius
Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Also sets the clipping radius if Obj_arg3 is set to 1.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and collected by player 2.

Classes.Name: BenefitItemOneUp
Classes.Notes: An item that grants the player an extra life when collected.

Values.Notes: Already appeared but SW_APPEAR starts rotation, escaping, etc.

Obj_arg1.Description: How the item behaves after appearing. If 128 is added to the value, it will appear with smoke particles.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 1000 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and collected by player 2.

Classes.Name: BgmChangeArea
Classes.Notes: Changes the background music using the stage's music information in StageBgmInfo. Supports several changing modes.

Obj_arg0.Name: Change Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The music change type.

Obj_arg1.Name: Argument 1
Obj_arg1.Description: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 0. ChangeBgmState index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 2. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 1.

Obj_arg2.Name: Argument 2
Obj_arg2.Description: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 1. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 2.

Obj_arg3.Name: Comet Music Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Sets how music changes are handled during Comet missions.

Values.Notes: Music change is ignored during Comet
Music change is enforced during Comet

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Invalidates this area if this switch gets activated. However, this only works in "TwisterTowerGalaxy".

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: BgmVolumeFadeArea
Classes.Notes: When the player enters this area, the music's volume will be changed. The volume resets if the player leaves the area again.

Obj_arg0.Name: Fade Time
Obj_arg0.Description: The music's fade time in frames. Default is 90.

Obj_arg1.Name: Volume
Obj_arg1.Description: The music's volume multiplied by 100.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: BigFan
Classes.Notes: A fan object that creates a gust of wind that can push Blimp Yoshi and the player if they use the Boo power-up. If this is placed in TeresaMario2DGalaxy, it will use a slightly different sound effect.

Obj_arg0.Name: Wind Length
Obj_arg0.Description: Defines the wind gust's length. Default is 4000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: The player's movement speed, multiplied by 100. Default is 100.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The fan will spin and the wind stream appears once this switch gets activated.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: BigFanCloud
Classes.Notes: A generic, rotating fan. It does not create a wind gust unlike BigFan.

SW_B.Description: If used, the fan will not rotate if the switch is not activated.

Classes.Name: BigRepeatWarpLift
Classes.Notes: A platform that moves on a path and teleports back to the beginning after it has reached the end. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: Makes the object move while the switch is active.

SW_B.Description: Makes the object stop while the switch is not active.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: BindEndArea
Classes.Notes: A useless area that has no actual effect in-game.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Birikyu
Classes.Notes: A large electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow type.

Point_arg0.Name: Waiting Time
Point_arg0.Description: Defines the time in frames before the object will move again.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Group.Description: If any of the group members gets frozen by player 2, all of them will stop moving.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BirikyuWithFace
Classes.Notes: A small electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the movement speed.

Obj_arg1.Name: Side Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the side direction.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow type.

Obj_arg3.Name: Gravity Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the gravity calculation type.

Values.Notes: Negated gravity is up. Always calculate gravity
Negated gravity is up. Calculate gravity once

Point_arg0.Name: Waiting Time
Point_arg0.Description: Defines the time in frames before the object will move again.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Group.Description: If any of the group members gets frozen by player 2, all of them will stop moving.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BlackHole
Classes.Notes: A black hole that sucks in the player and some compatible objects if they enter its range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0.

Obj_arg0.Name: Model Scale
Obj_arg0.Description: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If triggered, it disappears immediately.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the player gets sucked in by it.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Disappears if the action is activated.

Classes.Name: BloomArea
Classes.Notes: An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively.

Obj_arg0.Name: Intensity
Obj_arg0.Description: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.

Obj_arg1.Name: Threshold
Obj_arg1.Description: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.

Obj_arg2.Name: Intensity 1
Obj_arg2.Description: Primary intensity argument.

Obj_arg3.Name: Intensity 2
Obj_arg3.Description: Secondary intensity argument.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: BloomFlower
Classes.Notes: An unused class that does not work properly due to a programming error. Normally, it is meant to grow if it's in Bulb Yoshi's light range. This would make a Star Bit appear as well. However, the developers messed up a nerve check, so this effect is never triggered. If it's outside Bulb Yoshi's light, however, it will wither again.

Classes.Name: BlueChip
Classes.Notes: A collectable blue chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a BlueChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn another object, for example a Pull Star. It's usually stationary, but it can move on a path as well.

Obj_arg0.Name: Blue Chip Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object, the other Blue Star Chips and their controller.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the shadow's drop direction will use the object's gravity vector instead of calculating the shadow direction once.

Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg3.Description: If true, the chip will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg5.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies the shadow model type.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: Specifies the optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: BlueChipGroup
Classes.Notes: Controls a group of Blue Chips (BlueChip) and activates SW_A once all of them have been collected. It is recommended to have five Blue Star Chips per group. The group for this object and the individual Blue Star Chips has to be specified using Obj_arg0. This controller is also responsible for displaying the counter layout at the top of the screen.

Obj_arg0.Name: Blue Chip Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object and its Blue Star Chips.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Blue Star Chips will disappear after activating its SW_APPEAR. Default is -1, which makes the objects appear indefinitely.

Obj_arg2.Name: Counter Display Range
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the range from this object that the player has to be within for the counter layout to be displayed. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Reactivation Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies what to do with the individual chips after reloading the scene, for example after a death.

Values.Notes: Player has to collect items again after reloading the scene
Destroys chips after reloading the scene, SW_A won't be activated

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when all linked Blue Star Chips have been collected.

Classes.Name: BlueStarCupsulePlanet
Classes.Notes: Planet-like objects that feature a large Pull Star inside them. The player can use the pointer on the Pull Star to make it attract them. UFOBlueStarCupsule is hard-coded to use a lower target radius.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will not rotate or move on its path while this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Appears if the action is activated.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: BlueStarGuidanceArea
Classes.Notes: If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Pull Stars.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: BombBird
Classes.Notes: A bird enemy that flies on a path. If the player gets near it, it will drop a bomb that explodes after some seconds. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit on it. Can be defeated using most of the player's attacks.

Obj_arg0.Name: Flies Higher?
Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, it will fly far above the actual path. Also disables clipping.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will fly away from Mario.

Rail.Description: The path that it flies on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: BombHei
Classes.Notes: A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees the player. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

Obj_arg0.Name: Countdown
Obj_arg0.Description: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.

Obj_arg1.Name: Explosion Range
Obj_arg1.Description: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f

Obj_arg2.Name: Check Explosion Collision?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will only damage potential targets when there's no collision between the target and the explosion.

SW_A.Description: If not activated, it won't pursue Mario and will walk around passively. It will still be able to fuse when touched, though.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BombHeiLauncher
Classes.Notes: A dispenser that releases bombs or Bob-ombs. If the object is named BombLauncher, it creates bombs whereas it creates Bob-ombs when it's called BombHeiLauncher. There can only be one bomb or Bob-omb at once.

Obj_arg2.Name: Check Explosion Collision?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the dispensed object will only damage potential targets when there's no collision between the target and the explosion.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only dispense objects while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: BombHeiRed
Classes.Notes: A friendly Bob-omb NPC that can be talked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is BombHeiRed%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: BombTeresa
Classes.Notes: A Boo variant that can be swung around using its tongue. It can be smashed into several objects to damage or destroy them. If the player swings it around and does not get rid of it after some time, it will blink red and explode.

Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Respawning?
Obj_arg1.Description: Disables respawning after it dies.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BoomerangBros
Classes.Notes: A Koopa Troopa that throws boomerangs to attack the player. These boomerangs can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives the player an advantage to attack it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Starting Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay until it starts jumping around.

Obj_arg1.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how items should be spawned.

Obj_arg2.Name: Pass All Points?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will always cycle through all of its points instead of hopping between the two points closest to the player.

Obj_arg3.Name: Connect to Collision?
Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Remains stationary if the switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path points to jump between.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: It and its boomerangs can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi. Its boomerangs can be targeted, eaten and shot.

Classes.Name: BossBussun
Classes.Notes: A dinosaur-like boss that sleeps until the player Ground Pounds the weak spot on her belly. Excluding the first time, the player has to damage her three times. Starting the second phase, she will shoot fireballs that can temporarily cover manhole grates in lava. During the last phase, she will turn red and move faster. She is supposed to be placed on a disk-like planet as she can freely walk around such planets and change sides. She always spawns a Power Star which needs to be set up in the galaxy's Scenario file.

SW_A.Description: Makes her hittable once activated.

Rail.Description: Specifies the points that she randomly moves to.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Camera.Description: Used when it gets damaged.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its fireballs can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: BossJugem
Classes.Notes: A large variant of a Lakitu who wears glasses and rides on a purple cloud. He throws Spinies at the player and may also use thunderbolts to attack them. When he throws Spinies, he will be moving on a path whereas he moves between two separate points when using the thunderbolt attack. He can be damaged by thrown Shells or Yoshi projectiles. After dealing three hits, he will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register cameras.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: The path it moves on when throwing Spinys.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Notes: First point of the line that he moves on when using the thunderbolt attack
Second point of the line that he moves on when using the thunderbolt attack
Orientation point that the camera will look at most of the time

Values.Value: ボスジュゲムデモ位置
ボスジュゲムダウンデモ位置

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: BossJugemPlanetCloud
Classes.Notes: A set of clouds. If SW_A is triggered, they will turn gray. In this state, they will deal electric damage to the player and compatible enemies. Once the switch is deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the clouds turn to gray. If deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

SW_B.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: BossStinkBug
Classes.Notes: A large bug-like boss that can be damaged by Ground Pounding the weak spot on its back. It needs to be damaged three times. During the first phase, it moves slowly on the ground. After taking the first hit, it starts flying. And in the last phase, its skin turns red, and it will make aggressive turns while it flies. While it flies, it will periodically drop explosive bombs that can hurt the player. After it is defeated, it will spawn a Power Star, which also requires changes to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector and matrix register cameras.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Its main movement path that it flies and walks on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

Camera.Description: Used when falling onto the ground.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its bombs can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: BreakableCage
Classes.Notes: A destroyable obstacle that can be destroyed using Koopa Shells, Yoshi's projectiles or any enemy attack except enemy fire damage. Most of its variants can contain an item. Except for Star Bits and Power Stars, the items are only cosmetic. If the item is set to Power Star, the object also requires a proper setup in the galaxy's Scenario file. When BreakableCageL gets destroyed, it will always play the "riddle solved" jingle.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the cage rotates. Negative values invert the direction.

Obj_arg1.Name: Ignore Gravity?
Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, the rotation will not be affected by gravity.

Obj_arg2.Name: Delay SW_DEAD Activation?
Obj_arg2.Description: When enabled, SW_DEAD will be activated immediately instead of having to wait for the breaking animation to finish.

Obj_arg3.Name: Play Riddle SFX?
Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.

Obj_arg6.Name: Toad/Luma Color
Obj_arg6.Description: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.

Obj_arg7.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg7.Description: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 5 Star Bits and Power Stars can be spawned directly.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after destroying this object.

SW_A.Description: Registered to be set but never used.

SW_B.Description: Gets deactivated after destroying this object.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Used to group several trash piles for use with the Gearmo mini-game.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after destroying it. Requires Obj_arg7 to be set to 7.

Camera.Description: Used when it gets destroyed.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: BrightSun
Classes.Notes: Draws a bright sun-like sphere in the background that moves with the camera's position. If the player is inside a LensFlareArea, the lens flare effect will be rendered around the sun.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: BringEnemy
Classes.Notes: This registers and controls the enemies requested by a CareTakerHunter. This object should be linked to a CareTakerHunter object. Otherwise, it's useless on its own. The requested enemies have to be linked to this object. Supported enemies are Kuribo, TogeBegomanLauncher, BegomanLauncher and BegomanBabyLauncher. If a requested enemy is in this object's sensor range, it will notify the linked CareTakerHunter.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Intended for a check whose result is never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated after the request is fulfilled.

Classes.Name: Bussun
Classes.Notes: A dinosaur enemy that moves around on a path. It can be defeated by stomping on its belly. It damages the player upon contact.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Butterfly
Classes.Notes: A decorative butterfly. It can spawn a Star Bit when touched with the pointer. If the player is sleeping near a butterfly, it will eventually land on their nose.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the BRK color frame.

Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Star Bits?
Obj_arg1.Description: Does not spawn a Star Bit when touched.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: Buzz
Classes.Notes: An enemy that moves on a set path. If no path is specified, it will remain in place.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Defines its movement speed. Default is 3.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Cactus
Classes.Notes: A simple object that damages the player and compatible objects, such as SandBirdParts objects.

Rail.Description: Registered but never used.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: CancelBeeMorphArea
Classes.Notes: An area that removes the Bee power-up from the player if they are inside this area.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Candlestand
Classes.Notes: A torch with a flame that can burn the player upon contact. Usually, the flame can be put out using a Spin Attack to make an item appear, however, the flame of CandlestandIceVolcano cannot be put out. Said variant may also appear without a flame if it uses SW_A. Instead, the player can use fireballs to light the fire and activate the switch. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the item to be spawned after putting out the fire.

Obj_arg1.Name: Attach to Collision?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will be connected to the collision below. This makes it move along moving objects, for example.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the flame won't appear until Mario shoots a Fire Ball at it. Then, this switch will be activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and extinguished by player 2. CandlestandIceVolcano's flame can't be put out, though.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: CapsuleCage
Classes.Notes: A locked cage that can be opened by activating its SW_B switch. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after the cage gets opened.

Obj_arg6.Name: Play Star Chance Music?
Obj_arg6.Description: If set, it will play the STM_STAR_CHANCE_3 music once it gets opened.

Obj_arg7.Name: Use Alternate Model?
Obj_arg7.Description: Tries to load the model CapsuleCageNoKeyHole if enabled. This model does not exist anymore, though.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after the cage disappears.

SW_B.Description: If activated, the cage will be opened.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the cage gets opened.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: Caretaker
Classes.Notes: A robotic NPC that can be talked to. It can also quest the player for some specific task and make a Power Star appear using event flows. In order to spawn the Power Star, a properly configured Scenario entry as well as a dialogue with flow nodes need to be set up.

Obj_arg0.Name: Event Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The special event behavior to be used. Value 2 is broken as he does not carry the actual tool.

Values.Notes: Spawn Power Star with tool animation

Obj_arg1.Name: Mini-game Timer for Mario
Obj_arg1.Description: How much time the player has during a mini-game. Default is 30. In SMG1, this is only used when playing as Mario.

Obj_arg2.Name: Mini-game Timer for Luigi
Obj_arg2.Description: How much time the player has during a mini-game when playing as Luigi. Default is 30.

Obj_arg3.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg4.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg4.Description: How it behaves when talking to it.

Values.Notes: Sad, hands and gear move slowly

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the player wins the mini-game after the timer runs out.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated when the mini-game was failed.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Group.Description: Used to group several trash piles for use with the bomb mini-game.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering a special message flow.

Camera.Description: Registered but never used.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Caretaker%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Replace number variable with Purple Coin count
Replace number variable with high score

AnimeFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for AnimeFunc event flow nodes. This can be used only if Obj_arg0 is set to 0!

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes. If Obj_arg0 is set to 0, only function 0 can be used!

Values.Notes: Has 0 Purple Coins? (Obj_arg0 is not 0) / SW_A activated? (Obj_arg0 is 0)

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: CareTakerHunter
Classes.Notes: A robotic NPC who quests the player to show him a specific enemy. An instance of BringEnemy has to be linked to it. See BringEnemy to see what enemies are supported and how it's set up. After showing him the requested enemy, he will spawn a Power Star.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power Star Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Enables it to spawn a Power Star if set to 0.

Obj_arg3.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used. Default is 0.

Obj_arg4.Name: Talk Animation
Obj_arg4.Description: The talk animation to use. Default is 0.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after showing the requested enemy.

Camera.Description: Uses multiple cameras for different actions. 敵集め開始 is used when he requests the player to show him the enemy, 敵集め終了 is used when he holds the enemy above his head, 敵集めスター登場 is used before he spawns the Power Star. The game also registers a camera action under the name スター登場 but this is never used.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is CareTakerHunter%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Give 1-Up (only if not registered Power Star)

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: CaveInCube
Classes.Notes: Periodically spawns collapsing debris that can damage the player upon contact. For each spawn, a random debris model gets loaded. These models are called CaveInPartsBig, CaveInPartsMiddle and CaveInPartsSmall.

Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: Time between spawns in frames.

Obj_arg1.Name: Debris Count
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of debris to be generated. Stops generation after the requested amount has appeared. If set to -1, it will keep spawning more debris.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: The debris can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: CaveStream
Classes.Notes: An unfinished particles effect that works like EffectObjR500F50. It has a clipping radius of 500 and a far clipping distance of 50. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList. The UniqueName also matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the object will stop functioning if the cutscene action gets triggered.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will emit particles only if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups objects of the same kind, but the group is never used for anything.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: If used, it will start functioning once its cutscene action gets triggered. In SMG2, it will stop functioning if Obj_arg0 is set.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: CelestrialArea
Classes.Notes: If the player attempts to exit this area while using the Flying power-up, they will be restricted to move inside the area only. The flying effect will be cancelled when the player reaches the edge of this area.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ChangeAlphaObj
Classes.Notes:
A generic map object that will turn invisible if the camera passes it. For this, it loads a separate model with the suffix Alpha. The Alpha model uses two animations. Normal.brk, which is used for the visible state, and Alpha.brk, which is used to make the model fade out of existence.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: ChangeRoom
Classes.Notes: The room where the player can change between Mario and Luigi. Before the player defeats Bowser in Bowser's Galaxy Generator, the object will remain in a deactivated state. After this event, it will become usable. In order to open the door, its SW_A needs to be activated. If it is registered to a cutscene called チェンジルームからスタート, it can use a special nerve action which cause the player to jump out.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Opens the door while the switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: ChimneyEntryObj
Classes.Notes: An invisible point that teleports the player to a specified position, just like a Warp Pipe. However, this works in one way only.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: マリオ顔惑星煙突出口

Camera.Description: Used when warping.

Classes.Name: ChooChooTrain
Classes.Notes: A toy train that consists of at least one segment. It moves on a set path, and it randomly creates a whistling sound effect. The individual segments are also affected by gravity, so they will rotate accordingly.

Obj_arg0.Name: Train Segments
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of train parts except the main car that should be created. Default is 3.

Obj_arg1.Name: Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: The rate at which the train moves. Default is 5.

Rail.Description: Defines the path that it moves on.

Classes.Name: Chorobon
Classes.Notes: A black spiky blob-like enemy that remains stationary or moves on a path. It can be defeated by most of the player's attacks. It damages the player upon contact.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the movement speed. Default is 3.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: CircleCoinGroup
Classes.Notes: Creates a group of Coins (CircleCoinGroup) or Purple Coins (CirclePurpleCoinGroup) that are arranged in a circle. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be created. Default is 8.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Coins will disappear again. Default is -1, which makes the Coins appear indefinitely.

Obj_arg2.Name: Radius
Obj_arg2.Description: The distance that specifies how far to spread the Coins from the center. Default is 200.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.

Obj_arg4.Name: Pose Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Defines how to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coins to the collision below in SMG2, although this feature is broken.

Values.Notes: Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity
Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity
Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

Obj_arg7.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg7.Description: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all Coins.
