SW_B.Description: Causes all Coins to appear when activated and causes all Coins to disappear when it gets deactivated again.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the Coins appear.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If its special action functor gets triggered, all Coins will appear.

Classes.Name: ClipAreaMovable
Classes.Notes: An invisible volume that hides parts of compatible objects, for example SimpleClipPartsObj, that are inside the volume. However, this effect requires an instance of FallOutFieldDraw (SMG1) or ClipDrawArea (SMG2) placed in the level in order to function properly.

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: ClipDrawArea
Classes.Notes: An area that creates and enables Matter Splatter effects for compatible objects (SimpleClipPartsObj, etc.) when entered by the player. This also creates an instance of FallOutFieldDraw, which is needed to render the clipped objects. The effect will not work if the player is outside a ClipDrawArea. Furthermore, if StarLightReceiver objects, such as PunchingKinoko or BloomFlower, are placed inside this area, special behavior will be enabled for them. See the respective objects for more information.

Obj_arg0.Name: Display Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the compatible objects are clipped.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ClipFieldFillDraw
Classes.Notes: A controller that renders Matter Splatter surfaces (ClipArea) with a yellow glowing overlay. However, this effect does not work without a code patch as its rendering is disabled by default.

Classes.Name: ClipFieldSwitch
Classes.Notes: A controller that toggles its SW_A and SW_B switches depending on whether the player is inside a ClipArea or not.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated if the player is inside a ClipArea and gets deactivated when the player is outside a ClipArea.

SW_B.Description: Gets deactivated if the player is inside a ClipArea and gets activated when the player is outside a ClipArea.

Classes.Name: CloudSea
Classes.Notes: A simple object with a model and collision. Very limited in its functionality compared to other simple map object classes. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: CloudStep
Classes.Notes: A cloud platform that can be stood on using the Bee or Cloud power-ups. If the player does not have any of these two power-ups and steps on the platform, it will temporarily disappear. When Ground Pounded, it will temporarily disappear as well, no matter what power-up is currently active. The platform remains stationary or moves on a path.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the platform will move on its path while this switch is active.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: CocoNut
Classes.Notes: A coconut that can be flung into various obstacles and enemies. Once the player collects 9999 Star Bits in a save file, all coconuts will turn into watermelons. It will always reappear at its original position if it's destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Name: Use Spherical Shadow?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will use a spherical shadow instead of a cylindrical volume.

Obj_arg1.Name: Continue Rolling?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will continue rolling while it is colliding with other coconuts.

Obj_arg2.Name: Reset When Out of View?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will reappear at its original position once it gets out of view.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and fetched by player 2.

Classes.Name: CoconutTreeLeafGroup
Classes.Notes: Creates a group of animated palm tree leaves with collision. If the player Ground Pounds one of the leaves, it will swing at a faster rate.

Obj_arg0.Name: Use DemoSimpleCast?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it enables DemoSimpleCast functionality.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. However, this requires Obj_arg0 to be set.

Classes.Name: CocoSambo
Classes.Notes: A spiky cactus enemy that damages the player upon contact. It can be stunned using coconuts or the Rainbow power-up. Goombas and Topman enemies can stun it as well. On the other hand, it can stomp Goombas. After stunning it, its vulnerable head remains, which can be destroyed using most of the player's attacks. It can be scaled as well.

Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Range
Obj_arg0.Description: The valid range in which it appears from the ground. Default is 1800.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Coin
Classes.Notes: One of the game's main collectibles. There are two variants: Coins (Coin) and Purple Coins (PurpleCoin). Normal Coins can restore one health point if collected by the player. Purple Coins do not restore health, though. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files. Normal Coins won't appear during Daredevil (Dark) Comets. If they are stored inside a bubble, they will also restore the player's air when underwater. Spins slower when placed underwater.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.

Obj_arg4.Name: Pose Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Defines how to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coin to the collision below in SMG2.

Values.Notes: Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity
Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity
Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

Obj_arg5.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg5.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg6.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies the shadow model type.

Obj_arg7.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg7.Description: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Kills the Coin if this switch gets activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and collected by player 2.

MirrorActor.Description: A mirrored version of this object is created for mirror reflection setups if placed inside a MirrorArea.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: CoinAppearSpot
Classes.Notes: A point in space where the requested number of Coins will be spawned after activating its SW_APPEAR switch.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be spawned. Default is 8.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: CoinLinkGroup
Classes.Notes: Creates a set of Coins that will appear once this object's SW_APPEAR gets triggered. These Coins will only be collectable for the specified period of time or indefinitely (Obj_arg0). If the player collects all linked Coins in time, they will be rewarded with a 1-Up. The actual Coin objects need to be linked to this object; compatible objects are CircleCoinGroup and RailCoin.

Obj_arg1.Name: Timer
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the timer during which the Coins will be visible. Coins will appear indefinitely if set to -1. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated if not all Coins have been collected in time.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all connected Coins.

SW_B.Description: Causes all Coins to disappear immediately once this switch gets activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the Coins appear.

Classes.Name: CollapsePlane
Classes.Notes: A framed platform that will shrink down and disappear after the player stepped on it. Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Shrinking Time
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how long it takes for the tile to disappear after being stepped on. Default is 140 frames.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: CollectTico
Classes.Notes: A controller that registers and keeps track of Silver Stars (StrayTico). If the player has collected all Silver Stars, it will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file. The Silver Stars need to be linked to this object using ParentID (SMG1) / GeneratorID (SMG2).

Obj_arg0.Name: Combine at Controller's Position?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the Silver Stars will combine at this object's position. Otherwise, they will combine above the player.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the Silver Stars combine.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Appears after the Silver Stars combine. If this is part of a cutscene, it will appear when the 集めチコスター出現 part gets executed.

Camera.Description: Used when the individual Silver Stars combine.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Makes the Power Star appear if 集めチコスター出現 action gets triggered.

Classes.Name: CollisionArea
Classes.Notes: An invisible collision polygon that is contained inside the area. Only the player can interact with the collision. If not disabled through any means, the collision can be traversed using the Boo power-up. There are several Obj_args that can be used to define how the player interacts with the collision.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Pushing?
Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, the pushing force will be disabled for all surfaces, so that only the jumpable faces (Obj_arg3) can be interacted with.

Obj_arg1.Name: Prevent Boo Power-Up?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the collision cannot be bypassed using the Boo power-up.

Obj_arg2.Name: Push Radius
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how far the pushing extents reach from every face. Default is 0, which makes it possible to touch the actual collision.

Obj_arg3.Name: Active Faces
Obj_arg3.Description: What faces of the collision can be stood on or jumped off. Default is -1, which enables all.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CometFireDanceArea
Classes.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to run in a straight line. The player will jump as high as the third jump of a Triple Jump.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CometHopperArea
Classes.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Spring power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CometNoSpinArea
Classes.Notes: An area that, when entered, prevents the player from using the Spin Attack. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CometRainbowArea
Classes.Notes: An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Invincibility power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CompleteEndingDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the ending cutscene in the Comet Observatory's library. The individual models that it creates are RosettaReading, RosettaChair, TicoBaby and MarioCap or LuigiCap. The object needs to appear through a cutscene action.

NamePos.Description: コンプリートエンディングデモ基準点 marks the reference point for the objects.

DemoCast.Description: The cutscene that it belongs to. Expected to be called コンプリートエンディング. It has a cutscene nerve action which makes all objects appear.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label formats is DemoEpilog%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

Classes.Name: ConstructionLight
Classes.Notes: A destroyable light post that spawns three Star Bits when destroyed. This can be done by using a Spin Attack, the Spin Drill, the Rock power-up or by shooting a Star Bit at it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn Coin?
Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, it will spawn a single Coin when destroyed.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

Classes.Name: CountFlower
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers plant objects (PlantA, PlantB, PlantC, PlantD) and activates a switch once all the plant objects have appeared. The individual plant objects have to be linked to this object. If the object is called CountFlowerPowerStar, it can also spawn a Power Star once all plants have appeared and its SW_B got activated. This requires edits to the galaxy's Scenario file.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after all plants have appeared.

SW_B.Description: Needs to be activated after collecting all flowers in order to make the Power Star spawn.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: Creeper
Classes.Notes: A large, usually curved, flower that the player can swing along by shaking the Wiimote. Once the player reaches the end of the flower, it will cause them to jump off. The speed and bending are configurable.

Obj_arg0.Name: Normal Bending Factor
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how much the plant bends when grabbed by the player. Default is 100.

Obj_arg1.Name: Horizontal Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the horizontal flinging speed. Default is 25.

Obj_arg2.Name: Vertical Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the vertical flinging speed. Default is 40.

Obj_arg3.Name: Bee Bending Factor
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how much the plant bends when grabbed with the Bee power-up. Default is -1 which causes Obj_arg0 to be used instead.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: Lays out the flower's stem that can be climbed.

Camera.Description: Used when touching or climbing the flower.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: CrescentSeesawPlanet
Classes.Notes: An object with a model and collision that tilts towards the side that the player stands on.

Classes.Name: CrystalCage
Classes.Notes: A destroyable crystal that can contain a variety of different items. Except for Coins, Star Bits and Power Stars (SMG2 only), the items are only cosmetic. If the item is set to Power Star, the object also requires a proper setup in the galaxy's Scenario file. The crystal can be destroyed with most of the player's attacks as well as all enemy attacks. If a crystal object is placed inside a PlaneCollisionCube area, it will always load the CrystalCage2D model instead.

Obj_arg0.Name: Hide Remains?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the crystals that remain after destroying it will be hidden.

Obj_arg1.Name: Play Riddle SFX?
Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.

Obj_arg2.Name: Use Binder?
Obj_arg2.Description: Enables collision binding if set.

Obj_arg3.Name: SW_A Disappear?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, it will simply disappear if SW_A gets activated while it is out of view.

Obj_arg4.Name: Is Falling?
Obj_arg4.Description: Determines if the crystal falls when it spawns via SW_APPEAR.

Obj_arg6.Name: Toad/Luma Color
Obj_arg6.Description: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.

Obj_arg7.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg7.Description: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 1 Coin, 5 Star Bits and Power Stars can be spawned directly. It will play special sound effects if it contains a Toad or a Luma.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once it is destroyed.

SW_A.Description: Forces the Crystal to be destroyed once this switch gets activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Registers crystals of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after destroying it. Requires Obj_arg7 to be set to 7.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

Classes.Name: CrystalCageL
Classes.Notes: A large crystal with a Power Star trapped inside that requires two hits with a Spin Attack to be destroyed. The Power Star spawns once the crystal gets destroyed. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. -1 will look for the first scenario entry.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated once it is destroyed.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Registers crystals of the same object type, but the group is never used for anything.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Appears after it gets destroyed.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: CrystalCageOpa
Classes.Notes: An opaque crystal that can be destroyed with a Spin Attack, Yoshi's projectiles, the Spin Drill, a Koopa Shell as well as any enemy attack. It may reward the player with some items. Loads a separate model for the breaking animation.

Obj_arg0.Name: Play "Move" Animation?
Obj_arg0.Description: Plays an animation called Move if enabled. No actual object of this class has such animations, so it's never used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Useless
Obj_arg1.Description: The game reads this value but never uses it. This is only read if Obj_arg0 is set.

Obj_arg2.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies what kind of item to spawn after destroying it.

Obj_arg3.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg3.Description: The number of Star Bits to spawn after destroying it. Obj_arg2 has to be set to -1. Default is 5.

Obj_arg4.Name: Hide Broken Pieces?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the remaining broken pieces will be hidden.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: CrystalSwitch
Classes.Notes: An unfinished crystal-like switch that can be hit using most of the player's attacks. Once hit, it will start spinning, and it will activate its SW_A switch.

Obj_arg0.Name: Activation Time
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it will rotate and keep the switch activated when hit. Useless in SMG1 due to unfinished coding.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after hitting the switch.

Classes.Name: CubeCameraArea
Classes.Notes: An area that changes the current camera once the player enters this area. The actual camera parameters are specified in the zone's CameraParam.bcam. The corresponding camera ID label is generated using the format string c:%04x. For example, if your camera area has an Obj_arg0 of 15, the corresponding ID label would be c:000f. The camera can be restricted to take effect only under different circumstances (Obj_arg3).

Obj_arg0.Name: Camera ID
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what camera setup to use after entering this area.

Obj_arg2.Name: Priority
Obj_arg2.Description: The camera area with the highest priority and requested categories will take effect.

Obj_arg3.Name: Affected Contexts
Obj_arg3.Description: Contexts that are affected by camera changes through this area. In SMG2, these values can be combined by adding the values together. If set to 0, the game will set this value to 1. In SMG1, this setting is much more complicated: The lower four bits can be used to specify a single category (0 = Normal, 1 = Underwater, ...). These bits will be ignored if bit 4 or higher is set. These upper bits then correspond to bit field values (16 = Normal, 32 = Underwater, ...).

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the camera will be enabled if this switch is enabled. If it's not activated, it won't disable the camera.

SW_B.Description: If used and activated, the camera won't be enabled.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CumulativeTimerSwitchArea
Classes.Notes: An area that activates its SW_A switch if the player has spent the total requested number of time frames inside this area. It only functions if the player is Mario and the selected scenario is not a Green Star.

Obj_arg0.Name: Counter
Obj_arg0.Description: The required number of time frames to spend inside this area.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the required amount of time inside this area has passed.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: CymbalsStep
Classes.Notes: A set of cymbal platforms with separate collision meshes. The top one can be moved like a seesaw platform. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast it rotates. Default is 0. Only used if RotateAxis is 0.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many angles in degrees the platform rotates. Default is 0.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Type
RotateAxis.Description: How the platform moves when stepped on. Default corresponds to 1.

Values.Notes: Rotate around Z axis, returns to original rotation
Rotate XZ plane, returns to original rotation

RotateAccelType.Name: Inertia Factor / Acceleration
RotateAccelType.Description: Affects how long it will remain in motion. If RotateAxis is 0 or 1, it also affects how fast rotation will speed up. Default is 0.

RotateStopTime.Name: Restore Force
RotateStopTime.Description: The force used to restore its original rotation after getting of the platform. Only used if RotateAxis is 0 or 1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after Ground Pounding the top.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: DanceFlower
Classes.Notes: A flower-like enemy that moves around in a twirling motion. They attack by turning into a flower that spins around rapidly. If no path is assigned, it will only spin in place. It can be defeated by all player attacks.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: DarkMatterArea
Classes.Notes: An area that will make compatible objects disintegrate and die immediately when entered. Compatible objects are the player itself, Metbo and Karon.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DarknessRoomDoor
Classes.Notes: A pair of closed doors that can be opened by activating SW_B. Unlike other variants, its collision can be enabled or disabled if desired.

Obj_arg0.Name: Collision Mode?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set and SW_A is active, it will synchronize the collision's validity with the switch's state.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If Obj_arg0 is set and this switch is used, it will keep the collision validated as long as this switch is active.

SW_B.Description: Makes the doors open once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. The doors open if the 扉開く cutscene part gets executed.

Classes.Name: DashChargeArea
Classes.Notes: An area that causes the player to turn yellow and run significantly faster when entered. This effect remains active while the player is inside the area and slowly wears out when leaving the area again. This is very similar to the boost gained at the start of a Cosmic Race.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DashFruit
Classes.Notes: A red pepper that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Dash Yoshi. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and swung by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: DashRing
Classes.Notes: A red ring that causes the player to gain a short speed boost when entered while swimming or flying with the Flying power-up.

Obj_arg0.Name: Boost Time
Obj_arg0.Description: The time in frames for how long the boost will be active. Default is 300.

Obj_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes to reach the maximum boost. Default is 120.

Obj_arg2.Name: Speed Boost
Obj_arg2.Description: Speed boost multiplied by 100. Default is 250.

Obj_arg3.Name: Turn to Player?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the ring will always rotate towards the player.

Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies how shadows are used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DeadLeaves
Classes.Notes: A pile of decorative leaves. If the player uses the Spin Attack on it, it can make some items appear.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The item to be spawned after spinning near it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: DeathArea
Classes.Notes: An area that can kill the player and compatible objects when entered.

Obj_arg0.Name: Death Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what objects this area affects.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DemoCastSubGroup
Classes.Notes: A controller that sets up a separate cast of cutscene objects for use with a superordinate cutscene. This is used to connect a cutscene that is spread across zones. TimeSheetName refers to the set of cutscene config files to be used and DemoName is the proper identifier name for the cutscene. DemoName should match the cutscene's identifier that it belongs to. The actual setup specifications for the individual sheet files will be included on the Luma's Workshop Wiki. Individual objects can be registered by setting their DemoGroupId to this object's l_id.

Classes.Name: DemoEndStartPosCameraSetter
Classes.Notes: This controls and registers several special cutscenes for when the player returns to the Starship Mario. The following cutscenes will be registered: ファイルセレクトからの開始 for starting from the file select, ノーマルエンディング後デモ for the normal ending, スター120個エンディング後デモ for collecting all 120 normal Power Stars, ワールドマップからの開始 for returning from a World Map, スター１個目直後のゲームスタート for collecting the first Power Star in Sky Station Galaxy and ゲームオーバー後のデモ for restarting after a Game Over.

Classes.Name: DemoExecutor
Classes.Notes: A controller that sets up and controls a cutscene. TimeSheetName refers to the set of cutscene config files to be used and DemoName is the proper identifier name for the cutscene. The actual setup specifications for the individual sheet files will be included on the Luma's Workshop Wiki. Most objects can be registered to an individual cutscene by setting their DemoGroupId to the cutscene controller's l_id.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after the cutscene ends.

Classes.Name: DemoPlayerForbidUpdateArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents several player components from updating while a cutscene is active. These components include reacting to Onimasu movement, several collision interactions, getting damaged by Karikari, sliding, AreaMove speed up as well as moving object speed up, warping and many more.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DemoTitleAnim
Classes.Notes: This creates and controls the animated title screen sequence where Mario, Yoshi and the Orange Luma appear on-screen. The different objects and models are defined in a file called EntryActorList. Additional animation cameras (CANM) are used for the actual camera movement. The object itself does nothing when placed in a level and is actually controlled by the FileSelector controller.

Classes.Name: DepthOfFieldArea
Classes.Notes: An area that applies a blurry effect to the screen when entered by the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Synchronize with Player?
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to enable the blurry effect based on special triggers, such as being controlled by bosses.

Obj_arg1.Name: Intensity
Obj_arg1.Description: Valid range is 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg2.Name: Max Blur Distance
Obj_arg2.Description: The maximum blur distance range. Default is 10000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Min Blur Distance
Obj_arg3.Description: The minimum blur distance range. Default is 8200.

Obj_arg4.Name: Gradient Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what parts of the view should be blurred.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DharmaSambo
Classes.Notes: A red cactus enemy that consists of four body parts, including the head. It can be defeated by hitting its head with a Spin Attack or by stomping it. The individual body parts can be destroyed with a Spin Attack. It usually moves away from the player, but it will try to fling its head on the player to damage them. It always drops six Star Bits when defeated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: DinoPackunBaby
Classes.Notes: A Piranha Plant boss that resides inside its small egg before the battle starts. The player has to destroy its eggshell to reveal its large weak point. It can be damaged using Ground Pounds and Spin Attacks. Ground Pounding the shell from above will remove the entire shell at once. When its shell has been removed, it will run around in panic. The player has to repeat this procedure again to defeat it. It always damages the player upon contact. It will always spawn a Power Star when defeated, which requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

SW_B.Description: Activated only while its shell has been fully destroyed. Otherwise, it gets deactivated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: ベビーディノパックンデモ位置
プレイヤーデモ位置（ベビーディノパックン戦）

Camera.Description: Uses the camera with the suffix 戦闘開始のうろつき at the start of the boss fight after it hatched.

Classes.Name: DinoPackunVs1
Classes.Notes: A large Piranha Plant boss. Before the battle, it remains inside its shell. In order to defeat it, the player has to fling its tail ball with a Spin Attack four times. It always damages the player upon contact. However, the large tail ball does not hurt the player. In SMG1, it will always spawn a Power Star when defeated, which requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

Camera.Description: Used when hitting its tail.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: DinoPackunVs2
Classes.Notes: A large flaming Piranha Plant boss. Before the battle, it remains inside its shell. In order to defeat it, the player has to fling its tail ball with a Spin Attack four times. It always damages the player upon contact. However, the large tail ball does not hurt the player unless it's burning. It will sporadically shoot fireballs during the last phase and create fiery trails that burn the player upon contact. It will always spawn a Power Star when defeated, which requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

Camera.Description: Used when hitting its tail.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its trailing fire can be targeted and removed by player 2.

Classes.Name: Dodoryu
Classes.Notes: A large mole boss. In SMG1, he chases a Star Bunny before the actual battle begins. He attacks the player upon contact. The player needs to damage him three times to defeat him. It also creates trails of dirt when it moves around. He is usually underground but can be stunned using a Ground Pound when his head is above the ground. This gives the player a chance to attack him. In SMG1, it always spawns a Power Star and uses text for the Star Bunny it chases.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated when it starts looking for a new position and gets deactivated after it found a new position. Activated by default.

Rail.Description: Specifies the path that it moves on before the battle begins.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Notes: Player's position after the intro cutscene

Message.Description: The rabbit's text dialogue's label format is DodoryuRabbit%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

Classes.Name: DodoryuClosedArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents Major Burrows (Dodoryu) from entering it when he moves around.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Dossun
Classes.Notes: A large stone block enemy that raises up in the air and crushes down again after a set amount of time. This defeats the player and some compatible objects immediately. If used during a Double Time Comet, it will always move at a faster and fixed speed.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: How far it moves up. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Risen Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it remains above its original position before it falls down again. Default is 180.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the shadow volume.

Values.Notes: Use shadow & shake shadow before falling

Obj_arg3.Name: Scene Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies the scene execution order for this object.

Obj_arg4.Name: Ground Wait Time
Obj_arg4.Description: How long it remains on the ground before moving up again. Default is 120.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain in the air. If this switch gets activated, it will fall down.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: Dreamer
Classes.Notes: A green TV that displays the player's screen. It can be used to replay some pre-recorded inputs after talking to it which is usually used to teach the player some gameplay elements. The object will only appear if SW_APPEAR is activated or if the player failed the selected mission a set amount of times. The PAD data used to simulate player input can be found in the pad folder of the Galaxy's Ghost archive.

Obj_arg0.Name: PAD File & Spawn ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The index of the Galaxy's Dreamer%d.pad file to use, where %d is this argument's value. This also specifies the spawn point for the player.

Obj_arg1.Name: Required Deaths
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of deaths required in the currently selected mission for it to appear. Default is -1 which means it requires SW_APPEAR to appear.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label formats are Dreamer%03d and DreamerEnd%03d, where %03d is the text message ID. If set to -1, the dialogue from SceneCommonMessage will be used if present.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: DreamerDeadCountArea
Classes.Notes: Counts the player's deaths that occur inside this area and stores them in the save data for the currently selected galaxy mission. This number is used to control the appearance of a Tip Network (Dreamer) or a Cosmic Spirit (SuperDreamer).

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DrillBullet
Classes.Notes: A drill-like enemy that moves along a set path. It damages the player upon contact. It can be defeated by stomping, drilling or Ground Pounding it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how it moves along the path.

Values.Notes: Always turn to path's front direction

Point_arg0.Name: Wall Drill Type
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies the wall drilling action to perform at this point.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: DrillHoleHiddenArea
Classes.Notes: Usually, the Spin Drill creates decorative holes in the ground when using it. However, this area prevents this from happening.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: DrumTrampoline
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It starts the Bound animation when stomped or Ground Pounded. The actual bouncing needs to be specified using floor collision codes. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: EarthenPipe
Classes.Notes: A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hard-coded clipping range of 1000. DemoSimpleCast will be enabled for the stream model if the object has a proper cutscene setup.

Obj_arg0.Name: Horizontal Exit Force
Obj_arg0.Description: The force to push the player forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

Obj_arg1.Name: Vertical Exit Force
Obj_arg1.Description: The force to push the player upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

Obj_arg2.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg2.Description: The pipe's behavior after being entered.

Values.Notes: Eject without warping and spawns Coins
Eject without warping and spawns Star Bits

Obj_arg3.Name: Connection ID
Obj_arg3.Description: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

Obj_arg4.Name: Music Change
Obj_arg4.Description: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

Obj_arg5.Name: Music State
Obj_arg5.Description: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

Obj_arg6.Name: Ignore Gravity?
Obj_arg6.Description: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

Obj_arg7.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg7.Description: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.

SW_A.Description: If used, the pipe can't be entered while this switch is deactivated. EarthenPipeInWater won't show its water vortex until this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: This switch activates when Mario exits the pipe.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when entering or exiting.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. This only works if the current galaxy is called HeavensDoorGalaxy.

Classes.Name: EffectArea
Classes.Notes: An area in which most of the player's dust cloud particles can be replaced with yellow flower petals.

Obj_arg0.Name: Change Type
Obj_arg0.Description: How the particles are adjusted

Values.Notes: Flower petals (Obj_arg0 has to be set to 0)

Obj_arg1.Name: Particles Type
Obj_arg1.Description: The type of particles to use.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: EffectObj10x10x10SyncClipping
Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 1000 units and a far clipping distance of 50 meters.  Furthermore, its clipping center is at (0, 580, 0). The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList, where UniqueName matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invert Cutscene Function?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the object will stop functioning if the cutscene action gets triggered.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will emit particles only if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups objects of the same kind, but the group is never used for anything.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: If used, it will start functioning once its cutscene action gets triggered. In SMG2, it will stop functioning if Obj_arg0 is set.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: EffectObj20x20x10SyncClipping
Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 1000 units and a far clipping distance of 50 meters. Furthermore, its clipping center is at (0, 200, 0). The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList, where UniqueName matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 1500 units and a far clipping distance of 400 meters. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList, where UniqueName matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Classes.Notes: A generic particles effect with a clipping radius of 500 units and a far clipping distance of 50 meters. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList, where UniqueName matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Classes.Name: ElectricPressure
Classes.Notes: A yellow nozzle that shoots electrical charge balls that home on to the player. Touching those balls will cause electrical damage to the player.

Obj_arg1.Name: Launch Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The delay between shooting individual balls. Default is 90.

Obj_arg7.Name: Fly Higher?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will home on to a higher point on the player's model.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will only be able to shoot balls while this switch is activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: The balls of electricity can be removed by player 2.

Classes.Name: ElectricRail
Classes.Notes: An electric barrier that damages the player and compatible objects when touching the electricity or one of the points. The shape is defined by a path. It cannot be destroyed without special triggers.

Obj_arg0.Name: Stack Height
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of individual fences that make up the height. Default is 1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg1.Description: The shadow drop length. Uses Obj_arg2 if that value is bigger.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: The shadow drop length. Uses Obj_arg1 if this value is smaller.

Obj_arg3.Name: Model Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies what model and color frame to use. Default is 0.

Obj_arg4.Name: Calculate Gravity?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the shadow's drop direction will match the object's gravity vector, and it will recalculate gravity when necessary.

Obj_arg5.Name: Bowser Statue Beam?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, it will use a different sound effect intended to be used with KoopaStatueVomit.

Point_arg0.Name: Don't Create Point?
Point_arg0.Description: If set, no electric point will be created at this path point.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the fence will disappear. The green connector points still remain, though.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Specifies the shape and points. Each path point becomes a green point.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action makes it disappear.

Classes.Name: ElectricRail2Point
Classes.Notes: An electric barrier consisting of only two points that damages the player and compatible objects when touching the electricity or one of the points. Each point has a separate path to move on. The points are connected by the actual electric barrier. There has to be one RailObj instance for each of the two points which have to be linked to this object.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Time
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it takes for each point to reach the end of their path. Default is 60.

RailObj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Move?
RailObj_arg0.Description: If set, the point will not move on the path at all.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: ElectricRailMoving
Classes.Notes: An electric barrier that moves on a path. It damages the player and compatible objects when touching the electricity or one of the points. The path defines its shape, and it can be split into several smaller segments which also creates some gaps. It cannot be destroyed without special triggers.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Segments
Obj_arg0.Description: How many segments the fence will have. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 10.

Obj_arg2.Name: Segment Length
Obj_arg2.Description: The length of an individual fence segment.

Obj_arg3.Name: Stack Height
Obj_arg3.Description: The number of individual fences that make up the height. Default is 1.

Obj_arg4.Name: Model Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what model and color frame to use. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the fence will disappear. The green connector points still remain, though.

Rail.Description: Specifies the shape and points. Each path point becomes a green point.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: EnforceJumpArea
Classes.Notes: Normally, when the player jumps off moving collision, he will gain some extra speed depending on the collision's movement direction. This area restricts the speed at which the player is pushed into the moving direction to a fixed value.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ExterminationCheckerWoodBox
Classes.Notes: A controller that creates and registers several linked wood crates. Individual crates have to be linked to this object. It activates a switch if all crates have been destroyed.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated if all crates have been destroyed during the time limit.

SW_B.Description: If activated, all destroyed crates will reappear and the switches will be deactivated again.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: ExterminationSwitch
Classes.Notes: A controller that activates a switch once all linked and compatible objects have been killed. Individual objects have be linked to this object. ExterminationPowerStar spawns a Power Star after killing all objects. It also uses a counter layout to keep track of killed objects.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The Power Star's ID that should be spawned. If set to -1, it will automatically detect the proper Power Star to be spawned.

Obj_arg1.Name: Activation Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The delay until the switch gets activated. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Hide Counter?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the counter layout will be hidden.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated after killing all linked objects.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Appears after killing all linked objects.

Classes.Name: ExtraWallCheckArea
Classes.Notes: An area which, when entered, casts a soft circular shadow onto the surface perpendicular to the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Range
Obj_arg0.Description: Valid range until the shadow fades out.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: FallDownBridge
Classes.Notes: A bridge that collapses when hit using the Star Ball, the Rolling Rock power-up or the Rainbow power-up.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when knocking over the bridge.

Classes.Name: FallDownWall
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that usually moves on a set path. Once it starts moving, it emits its MoveStart particles. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animations Move and RailMoveSign; the latter would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior. Lastly, it can also use the stage effects Start, Moving, and Stop.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point
Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: FallsArea
Classes.Notes: An area that makes waterfall splash effects appear around the player when entered.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: FileSelector
Classes.Notes: A controller which sets up the entire title logo and file select sequence when placed in a level. In SMG2, it can also create any object linked to it to control their appearance.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the selectable user files appear on the screen.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: FireBar
Classes.Notes: A Used Block that connects several sticks of fireballs that burn the player and other compatible objects upon contact. The fireball sticks rotate around the Used Block at the same rate.

Obj_arg0.Name: Fireballs per Stick
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of fireballs per stick. Default is 5.

Obj_arg1.Name: Rotation Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the individual sticks rotate. Default is -1.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg3.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 100. Overwrites Obj_arg6.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies how to rotate the shadow.

Obj_arg5.Name: Stick Distance
Obj_arg5.Description: The distance from the core at which the sticks will be placed. Default is 140.

Obj_arg6.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg6.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 100.

Obj_arg7.Name: Stick Count
Obj_arg7.Description: The number of Fire Ball sticks to be created. Default is 1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: If any of the Fire Bars in this group gets frozen by the Orange Luma, all of them will stop moving as well.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: The fireballs can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: FireBubble
Classes.Notes: A blue fireball enemy that burns the player upon contact. It can be defeated by shooting a Star Bit at it. It drops a single Coin when defeated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: FirePressure
Classes.Notes: A red cannon that periodically shoots fireballs that damage the player and other compatible objects upon contact. It cannot be destroyed through any means. It is also possible to make the fireballs follow the player. Furthermore, the cannon can be set to rotate towards the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Cannon Rotation
Obj_arg0.Description: The rotation of the cannon in degrees. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames before it starts shooting again. Default is 300.

Obj_arg2.Name: Ball Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: The movement speed of an individual fireball. Default is 30.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shot Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how the object shoots fireballs. Default corresponds to setting it to 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: Disable Collision Destruction?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, the fireball won't be destroyed when it collides with collision.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the cannon will be rotated into its shooting position once this switch gets activated. It will be able to shoot fireballs in this state. Once the switch deactivates again, it enters its resting position again.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will only be able to shoot fireballs while this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups several other FirePressure instances. The one with the longest wait time becomes the "group leader". All instances will start shooting a fireball once the group leader is ready.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: The fireballs can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: FirePressureRadiate
Classes.Notes: A red cannon that periodically shoots a long burning flame that damages the player and compatible enemies upon contact. It cannot be destroyed through any means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Cannon Rotation
Obj_arg0.Description: The rotation of the cannon in degrees. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames before it starts shooting again. Default is 300.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shoot Time
Obj_arg2.Description: How long it will shoot its flame in frames. Default is 300.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only be able to shoot its flame while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups several other FirePressureRadiate instances. The one with the longest wait time becomes the "group leader". All instances will start shooting its flame once the group leader is ready.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action makes it stop shooting its flame.

Classes.Name: FireRing
Classes.Notes: Creates a ring of evenly divided rotating fireballs that damage the player upon contact. The fireballs cannot be destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Name: Radius
Obj_arg0.Description: How far to place the individual fireballs from the object's center. Default is 300.

Obj_arg1.Name: Rotation Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the individual fireballs rotate. Default is 30.

Obj_arg2.Name: Balls Count
Obj_arg2.Description: How many fireballs the ring consists of. Default is 8.

Obj_arg3.Name: Small Radius
Obj_arg3.Description: The smaller radius used to place the fireballs. This has to be smaller Obj_arg0 or else the scaling won't work. Default value matches Obj_arg0.

Obj_arg4.Name: Scaling Time
Obj_arg4.Description: How long it takes for the ring to interpolate between the two radii. Default is 60.

Obj_arg5.Name: Shadow is Down?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, the shadow drop direction is the negated up vector of an individual fireball. By default, the shadow drops into the gravity's direction.

Obj_arg6.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg6.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_A.Description: If used, the fireballs will be close to each other and won't move until this switch gets activated once.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: FishGroup
Classes.Notes: A group of several decorative fish. All fish will move along the specified path. The number of fish to be spawned can be specified as well. The fish will try to escape from the player if they are nearby.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Fish
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of fish in the group. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Escape Spin Attack?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the fish will escape from the player when using a Spin Attack nearby.

Obj_arg2.Name: Enable Gravity?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the fish will adjust to gravity.

Rail.Description: The path that the fish move on.

Classes.Name: Flag
Classes.Notes: A decorative flag that waves in the wind. FlagPeachCastleC and FlagSurfing will slowly turn transparent the closer the player gets to them.

Obj_arg1.Name: Pole Length
Obj_arg1.Description: The length of the optional and decorative pole that the flag gets attached to. Default is 0.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Furthermore, the object will not appear initially.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: FlipPanel
Classes.Notes: A large panel that can be pressed by stepping on it. It has to be grouped with a FlipPanelObserver in order to activate a switch or to spawn a Power Star. Stepping on it again will revert it into its original state. However, once all grouped panels have been activated, they cannot be pressed again.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: The group of panels and their controller. The limit of objects is 32 in SMG1 and 128 in SMG2.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: FlipPanelObserver
Classes.Notes: A controller for Flipswitch panels. Individual panels have to be grouped to this object using GroupId. Once all panels have been pressed, this controller will activate a switch, spawn a Power Star or both. A total of 32 objects can be grouped in SMG1 whereas the limit is 128 in SMG2.

Obj_arg0.Name: Completion Cutscene Time
Obj_arg0.Description: How long the game will be interrupted after activating all panels. One additional second will be added by the game.

Obj_arg7.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg7.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. 0 will look for the first scenario entry. -1 does not register a Power Star.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after activating all grouped panels.

Group.Description: The group of panels and their controller. The limit of objects is 32 in SMG1 and 128 in SMG2.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after pressing all panels.

Classes.Name: FlowerBlossomRellayPlanet
Classes.Notes: A special planet with a model and collision that activates a switch after executing a short cutscene. In order to start the cutscene, another switch needs to be activated first.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the blooming cutscene.

SW_B.Description: If activated, it will start the blooming cutscene.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: FlowerMimic
Classes.Notes: A large flower that tries to eat the player if they step onto it. It cannot be destroyed through any means. When the plant is closed, the player can bounce off of it. If placed inside a PlaneModeCube, all shadows will be disabled.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Fluff
Classes.Notes: A large flower that the player can glide with by grabbing it. It gets pushed by wind streams (FluffWind).

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the player rides this specific Fluff Flower. Gets deactivated again if the player does not ride it anymore.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve causes it to grow from the ground.

Classes.Name: FluffWind
Classes.Notes: A wind stream whose shape and direction can be specified by a path. The wind pushes the player while riding a Floaty Fluff as well as cloud platforms created by the Cloud power-up.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Causes the wind stream to disappear once the switch gets enabled.

Rail.Description: Specifies the shape and direction of the wind stream.

Classes.Name: Foomin
Classes.Notes: A gray tile that flips periodically. If the player stands on it while it flips around, the player will be flung off of it. It usually moves on a path, but it can remain at a fixed position as well. It cannot be destroyed through any means.

Obj_arg0.Name: First Flipping Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: Delay until it flips for the first time. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: Path movement rate multiplied by 100. Default is 250.

SW_A.Description: If used, it won't start flipping while this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: ForbidJumpArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents the player from performing "dolphin" jumps while they are riding a Koopa Shell inside this area.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ForbidSupportTicoArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents the second player's pointer and actions while the main player character is inside this area.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ForbidTriangleJumpArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents any angled Wall Jumps. Instead, the jumping direction will be directly opposite of the Wall Jumped collision triangle.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ForbidWaterSearchArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents the player from performing a special edge dive jump into a WaterArea below the player.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ForceDashCube
Classes.Notes: The player receives a speed boost if they touch ForceDash (floor code 39) collision while using the Rock power-up inside this area. The boost's direction is the area's rotated Z axis.

Obj_arg0.Name: Forwards Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The launch speed boost that the player gains. Default 50.

Obj_arg1.Name: Rock Break Time
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the time in frames that the player stays inside the rock before it breaks. Default is 180.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Fountain
Classes.Notes: A splashing water fountain that only consists of particles instead of an actual model. If the player touches it, they will be flung upwards.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Once enabled, the particles, sounds and sensors will be enabled.

Classes.Name: FountainBig
Classes.Notes: A tall water fountain that consists of a model and particles. If the player touches it, they will be flung upwards. The water fountain will disappear and reappear periodically.

Classes.Name: FurPlanetMap
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision that also supports fur maps. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models. As PlanetMap already supports fur maps in SMG2, FurPlanetMap is rather redundant in this game.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. It won't appear until its appear cutscene action gets triggered.

Classes.Name: Garigari
Classes.Notes: A buzz-saw that moves on a path or remains stationary if no path was assigned. When the player touches the blades, they will take damage. If the saw touches a Bob-omb or bomb, it will cause an explosion. Several other enemies also take damage when touched by the blades, such as Flipbugs (KoteBug) and Slurples (Karikari).

Obj_arg0.Name: Sawing Type
Obj_arg0.Description: What animations and particles to use when it's active.

Obj_arg1.Name: Pose Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how to rotate the object.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
