Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Will be activated once it reaches the path's end.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, the object will start moving.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: GCaptureTarget
Classes.Notes: A small blue star that can pull the player towards it if they touch it with their pointer. If the player is too far away from this object, it will become inactive and the player cannot point at it. It usually remains stationary but can move on a path as well. The player can be ejected while using the Pull Star if he gets to close to it, although this is an optional setting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Release Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The radius in which the player will be released automatically. Default is -1 which deactivates this behavior.

Obj_arg1.Name: Pointing Range
Obj_arg1.Description: The valid range in which the player can use this object. Default is 2500.

Obj_arg2.Name: Inactive Color Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the color to be used when the player is too far away from this object.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: The object will disappear once this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Group.Description: Used to synchronize the execution of several other grouped Pull Stars when the object's appearance cutscene is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when the object appears.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Furthermore, the object will not appear initially.

Classes.Name: GemCageS
Classes.Notes: A breakable object that can spawn several items once destroyed. Can be destroyed using any of the player's attack, except for RockCageS which only works with the Rock power-up.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The item to be spawned after destroying it.

Classes.Name: GeneralRestartPos
Classes.Notes: Defines the respawn point for a Star Ball. The respawn point needs to be linked to a Star Ball (Tamakoro). The respawn point will be used if the player's current spawn ID matches this object's Obj_arg0. The active player spawn point, Star Ball and Star Ball respawn point have to be in the same zone.

Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The player's spawn ID to which this respawn point belongs.

Classes.Name: Gesso
Classes.Notes: A squid enemy that spawns a Coin when defeated. It damages the player upon contact. The player can defeat it with any attack.

Obj_arg0.Name: Initial Nerve
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies its initial behavior. In SMG1, this setting only applies when SW_APPEAR is used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: GhostAttackGhost
Classes.Notes: A ghost version of Luigi that will move around in a predefined GST motion once the player touches it once. It does not appear in a level until the selected mission has been cleared with Luigi already. The GST motion data for it can be found in the gst folder of the Galaxy's Ghost archive. It uses a different execution and drawing order in MagicGalaxy and the second mission of StarCreekGalaxy.

Obj_arg0.Name: Ending Nerve
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the state to be used after it reached the end of the predefined motion.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: GhostMazePlanetMask
Classes.Notes: A darkness model used to cover major portions of the screen except of a cutout showing the player character. It will always be invisible until SW_A gets activated. The model will briefly disappear when an event camera is active. After that it will reappear again.

SW_A.Description: Causes the object to appear and play the Appear animation.

SW_B.Description: Useless as it's registered but never used.

Classes.Name: GlaringLight
Classes.Notes: A variant of SimpleMapObj that gets rendered after most other objects. This is a generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: GlaringLightArea
Classes.Notes: An area that defeats Boos and removes the Boo power-up from the player once entered.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: GliBird
Classes.Notes: The colorful tropical bird that the player can glide with. It's usually deactivated, but it becomes functional when the gliding sequence is started after talking to a correctly set up Jibberjay (Pichan) or Jibberjay Racer (PichanRacer).

Obj_arg6.Name: Indicator Volume Draw Count
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies how many rendering passes should be performed for the red indicator volume. If set to 0, the indicator volume won't be used. Default is 3.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the player starts gliding with Fluzzard.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Camera.Description: Used when the player and Fluzzard die.

Classes.Name: GliBirdNpc
Classes.Notes: A non-playable variant of Fluzzard that sits around casually. Unlike most NPCs, it cannot be talked to at all.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GliderBalloon
Classes.Notes: A large balloon that drops five Star Bits when popped.

Obj_arg0.Name: Use Small Model?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will load the smaller model GliderBalloonMini instead.

Obj_arg1.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: The balloon's color frame.

Obj_arg2.Name: Broken Star Bits Distance
Obj_arg2.Description: Does not work due to a bug. When fixed, this specifies how far the Star Bits reach out when they appear. Default is 1500.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after popping the balloon.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and popped by player 2.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. This only works if the current galaxy is JungleGliderGalaxy.

Classes.Name: GliderCometMedalCage
Classes.Notes: A locked capsule cage that can be opened by activating its SW_B switch.

SW_B.Description: Opens the cage when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: GliderTree
Classes.Notes: A decorative palm tree intended to be used in gliding mini-game sections. It swings when rammed by Fluzzard.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalBarrelGravity
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that revolves around a barrel-shaped planet. Objects are pulled sideways along the cylinder. If Obj_arg1 is positive, objects will be pulled towards the center axis the closer they are to the gravity area.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything. Default is 500.

Obj_arg1.Name: Inwards Pull Distance
Obj_arg1.Description: Adjusts the inwards pull distance. This essentially specifies the gravity angle towards the center axis. For example, if this value is 800 and the distance to the center axis is 900, the resulting angle towards the center axis is 45°. This is because min(45, 800/900 * 180/pi). Default is -1 which disables inwards pulling.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalConeGravity
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that pulls objects in its range towards the lateral surface and the base surface of a cone.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Bottom?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the base surface of the cone will not have gravity.

Obj_arg1.Name: Top Cut Length
Obj_arg1.Description: Defines at which point to cut off the top of the cone. Starts at the cone's tip, and moves towards the flat bottom of the cone. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalCubeGravity
Classes.Notes: A cube-shaped gravity area that pulls objects towards the cube's surface. Each of the cube's faces can be manually toggled. The transition around edges and corners is smooth. The object's scale defines the actual size of the cube.

Obj_arg0.Name: Valid X Axis Faces
Obj_arg0.Description: Defines which sides on the X axis of the cube are valid. Both are enabled by default.

Obj_arg1.Name: Valid Y Axis Faces
Obj_arg1.Description: Defines which sides on the Y axis of the cube are valid. Both are enabled by default.

Obj_arg2.Name: Valid Z Axis Faces
Obj_arg2.Description: Defines which sides on the Z axis of the cube are valid. Both are enabled by default.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalDiskGravity
Classes.Notes: A simple gravity area that pulls objects in its range towards a disk-shaped volume.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Bottom?
Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, only the upper portion of the disk will have gravity.

Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Edges?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the disk's edges will not have gravity.

Obj_arg2.Name: Valid Degrees
Obj_arg2.Description: The radial degrees that will have gravity. Starts pointing towards +X, and then rotates counterclockwise around the Y axis. Default 360

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalDiskTorusGravity
Classes.Notes: A simple gravity area that pulls objects in its range towards a torus/ring-shaped volume.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Bottom?
Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, only the upper portion of the disk will have gravity.

Obj_arg1.Name: Valid Surfaces
Obj_arg1.Description: The valid surfaces to attract objects to. Both are enabled by default.

Obj_arg2.Name: Tube Radius
Obj_arg2.Description: The tube's radius, not to be confused with the major radius of the entire torus. Default 0.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalPlaneGravity
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards a plane. This variant uses a spherical range.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalPlaneGravityInBox
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards a plane. This variant uses a box range and ignores the Range setting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The minimum distance used for calculating gravity speed. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Base Distance Axis
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the axis to use for calculating the distance from the requesting object to this area. Default is -1.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalPlaneGravityInCylinder
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards a plane. This variant uses a cylindrical range and ignores the Range setting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The minimum distance used for calculating the gravity speed. Default is 2000.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalPointGravity
Classes.Notes: A simple gravity area that attracts objects in its range towards its position. The object's scale is ignored.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalSegmentGravity
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that pulls objects in its range towards the lateral surface and base surfaces of a cylinder.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enabled Bases
Obj_arg0.Description: What bases should affect gravity. By default, both bases are enabled.

Obj_arg1.Name: Valid Degrees
Obj_arg1.Description: The radial degrees that will have gravity. Starts pointing towards X+ and then rotates counterclockwise around the Y axis. Default is 360.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GlobalWireGravity
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards the gravity points laid out on a path. The gravity points will be selected at equal intervals.

Obj_arg0.Name: Point Count
Obj_arg0.Description: How many gravity points to calculate, excluding the first and last points on the path. Default is 20.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that lays out the gravity points.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: GoldenTurtle
Classes.Notes: A variant of a Koopa Shell that can be used to open specific treasure chests or damage and destroy various objects. Like a red Koopa Shell, it homes in on compatible objects. While riding the shell underwater, it also plays special sparkling sound effects.

Obj_arg1.Name: Useless
Obj_arg1.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg2.Name: Respawn Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether it respawns after destroying it or not.

Obj_arg3.Name: Appearance Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how the object appears when it respawns.

Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted, eaten and shot by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Gorogoro
Classes.Notes: A rolling stone obstacle that crushes the player when touched. It moves along a path in a rotating motion. It will turn invisible if the camera passes it. For this, it loads a separate model with the suffix Alpha. The Alpha model uses two animations. Wait, which is used for the visible state, and Disappear, which is used to make the model fade out of existence.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Classes.Name: GorogoroCylinderRock
Classes.Notes: A rolling obstacle that moves on a set path. Once it reaches the end of its path, it will reappear at the path's start again. Depending on the current path point, it can perform various actions (Point_arg0).

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: How fast the obstacle moves on the path. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The delay in frames before the actual obstacle will be generated. Default is 0.

Point_arg0.Name: Next Nerve
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies the next state to be used when the object arrives at this point.

Point_arg1.Name: Invalidate Shadow?
Point_arg1.Description: If set, its shadow will be invalidated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the rocks will move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: GoroRockLaneParts
Classes.Notes: A platform that can move on a path, rotate or do both. It features two color animations. Normal.brk is used normally and Change.brk is used when its SW_B gets activated. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RotatorRotateStart, RotatorRotateLoop, RotatorStopAtEnd, RotatorStopAtEndLoop, RotatorRotateSignStart, RotatorRotateSignLoop, RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animation RailMoveSign that would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: Starts the Change.brk color animation when activated. Normal.brk will be used when the switch is not activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: GrandStarReturnDemoStarter
Classes.Notes: Creates and controls the sequence used when the player returns to a HUB world with a Grand Star. It does not appear initially, but it can appear through cutscene actions.

Rail.Description: The fly-in path used at the start of the cutscene.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Notes: Point that the Grand Star will move to

Camera.Description: Uses multiple cameras for different actions. 移動 is used for the fly-in sequence and リザルト is used for the result text sequence. The game also registers a camera action under the name ウェイト but this is never used.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: Grapyon
Classes.Notes: A bug-like enemy with a spiky top that hops around horizontally. It damages the player upon contact. It can be defeated by stomping or Ground Pounding its weak spot. Furthermore, it can be defeated using fireballs, the Spin Drill, Koopa Shells and the Rainbow power-up.

Obj_arg0.Name: Inverted?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, its body will be inverted so that the spiky top points downwards.

SW_A.Description: If used, its body will be inverted whenever the state of the switch changes.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: GravityArrow
Classes.Notes: A decorative arrow panel that rotates towards the player's gravity direction.

Classes.Name: GravityBgmCtrl
Classes.Notes: A controller that changes the background music's state depending on the player's gravity direction. If the player's gravity points downwards, the music's main channel will be played. If the player's gravity points upwards, the music's second channel will be played as well. Only a few selected music tracks support this kind of music change, though.

Classes.Name: GravityFallBlock
Classes.Notes: A block that can be destroyed using the Fire Flower's fireballs. If there's no collision below the block, it will fall down until it hits collision.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after destroying the block.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: GravityLightRoad
Classes.Notes: A beam of light that transports the player through the beam when entered. If no SW_A is used, it will transport the player for 30 seconds before it disappears.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, transportation will be stopped once this switch gets activated. This also causes the beam to disappear.

Classes.Name: GravityTimerChangeWall
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that usually features panels with large arrows on them that are meant to show the gravity direction. It changes its shape and animations depending on the background music's rhythm. This requires the animations DownToUp and UpToDown. Initially, it uses UpToDown.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will perform the UpToDown animation.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: GroupSwitchWatcher
Classes.Notes: A controller that activates SW_A depending on the states of several consecutive input switches. Supported logical links are AND and OR. The first index of the input switches has to be set as SW_B and the number of total consecutive switches has to be specified by Obj_arg0.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Switches
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of switches to be evaluated.

Obj_arg1.Name: Logical Link
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the input switches are evaluated.

Values.Notes: AND (all switches have to be activated)

Obj_arg2.Name: Activation Type
Obj_arg2.Description: How the output switch (SW_A) should be activated or deactivated.

Values.Notes: Activate SW_A if condition is fulfilled and kill itself
Activate SW_A if condition is fulfilled, deactivate SW_A otherwise

SW_A.Description: The switch that should be activated or deactivated depending on the result.

SW_B.Description: The first index of the input switches to be evaluated.

Classes.Name: HammerBros
Classes.Notes: A Koopa Troopa that throws hammers to attack the player. These hammers can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives the player an advantage to attack it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Starting Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay until it starts jumping around.

Obj_arg1.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how items should be spawned.

Obj_arg2.Name: Pass All Points?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will always cycle through all of its points instead of hopping between the two points closest to the player.

Obj_arg3.Name: Connect to Collision?
Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Remains stationary if the switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path points to jump between.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: It and its hammers can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi. Its hammers can be targeted, eaten and shot.

Classes.Name: HammerHeadPackun
Classes.Notes: A large flower enemy that attacks the player by crushing them with its large head. It can be defeated by smashing a Stretch Plant or coconut into it. Furthermore, the player can jump on its head to defeat it, however, this does not work for the spiky variant. The player can also use most of their attacks to defeat it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Drop Items?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it won't drop any Star Bits when defeated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Hanachan
Classes.Notes: A caterpillar enemy that moves on a set path. However, if the player jumps off of it, it will turn aggressive and chase after the player. After a couple of seconds, it returns to its normal state and moves on the path. It can be defeated by Ground Pounding it or by jumping on its belly parts. Using a Ground Pound or Spin Attack nearby will stun it. Furthermore, it can be defeated using most of the player's attacks.

Obj_arg0.Name: Angry Type
Obj_arg0.Description: How it behaves when it turns aggressive.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: HanachanBig
Classes.Notes: A large caterpillar enemy that moves on a set path. Unlike its smaller variants, it always moves on its path, and it cannot be defeated. However, the player can bounce off of its body parts.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Body Parts
Obj_arg0.Description: How many body parts it consists of. Minimum is 3, maximum is 13, default is 9.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: Its path movement speed multiplied by 100. Default is 100.

Obj_arg2.Name: Is Angry?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will turn red and move around more aggressively.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Group.Description: If any of the Big Wigglers in this group gets frozen by the Orange Luma, all of them will stop moving as well.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: HanachanRunaway
Classes.Notes: A variant of a Wiggler intended to be used on tube slides. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance. Its Obj_args specify how it gets positioned on the slide. Unlike its normal variants, it cannot be defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Forwards Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: How fast it moves along the TubeSlider's path. The actual speed value needs to be multiplied by 10. Default is 100.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sidewards Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast it revolves around the TubeSlider's path. The actual speed value needs to be multiplied by 10. Default is 20.

Obj_arg2.Name: Number of Body Parts
Obj_arg2.Description: How many body parts it consists of. Minimum is 1, default is 5.

Obj_arg3.Name: Is Angry?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, it will turn red and move around more aggressively.

Obj_arg5.Name: Initial Angle
Obj_arg5.Description: The angle around the tube slide at which the object gets positioned initially.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain inactive until this switch gets activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: HazeCube
Classes.Notes: An area that, when entered, creates a heat haze effect on the player's screen.

Obj_arg0.Name: Camera Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The distance into the camera's view at which the heat haze effect will be applied. Default is 1000.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the heat haze effect will be applied only if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: HeadLight
Classes.Notes: Creates a spotlight effect that follows the player character. The radius and the light's color can be configured.

Obj_arg0.Name: Red
Obj_arg0.Description: The red color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg1.Name: Green
Obj_arg1.Description: The green color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg2.Name: Blue
Obj_arg2.Description: The blue color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg3.Name: Alpha
Obj_arg3.Description: The alpha channel component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg4.Name: Radius
Obj_arg4.Description: The size of the spotlight. Default is 1000.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: HeavySteeringArea
Classes.Notes: An area that, when entered, causes the player to turn around very slowly, making it harder to steer their character.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: HipDropMoveBlock
Classes.Notes: An object with a model and collision that can be Ground Pounded to move it away from its initial position. The distance, required Ground Pounds and more can be configured. Initially, the object can only be Ground Pounded from the bottom side of the model to move it upwards. It can play various different sounds: Start, Moving, StopEnd and Stop, all of which are self-explanatory. Interestingly, the class offers an unused functionality where one or more buttons (HipDropMoveBlockSwitch) can be attached to the object that will cause the object to move when one of the buttons has been stomped. The positions and offsets can be defined in a file called InitHipDropMoveBlockSwitch.bcsv. The actual model for the button actor does not exist anymore and needs to be restored. Unfortunately, the button does not take the object's rotation into account when placed.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: How far the block can be pushed upwards from its initial position. Default is 100.

Obj_arg1.Name: Required Ground Pounds
Obj_arg1.Description: How often the block has to be Ground Pounded in order to reach the end. Default is 1.

Obj_arg2.Name: Movement Time
Obj_arg2.Description: How long it takes to move the object after Ground Pounding it. Default is 60.

Obj_arg3.Name: Limit Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how to restrict the movement of the block.

Values.Notes: Can be Ground Pounded from bottom and top sides
Can only be Ground Pounded from bottom side

Obj_arg4.Name: Useless
Obj_arg4.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the object has been moved to its end.

SW_B.Description: If used, the spot can only be Ground Pounded while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: HipDropRock
Classes.Notes: A rock that can be destroyed with a Ground Pound attack. It can spawn some items after destroying it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The item to be spawned after destroying it.

Obj_arg1.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg1.Description: The amount of Star Bits to be dropped. Default is 6. Requires Obj_arg0 set to 1.

Obj_arg7.Name: Hide Remains?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, the smaller rocks that remain after destroying it will be hidden.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated when it disappears after destroying it.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated immediately after destroying it.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: HipDropSwitch
Classes.Notes: A button that can be activated using a Ground Pound attack. Once activated, it will activate a switch.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after hitting the switch.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: HipDropTimerSwitch
Classes.Notes: A button that can be activated using a Ground Pound attack. Once activated, it will activate a switch for a set amount of time. After the time runs out, it will reset itself.

Obj_arg0.Name: Timer
Obj_arg0.Description: How long the switch will remain activated before it resets again. Default is 300.

Obj_arg1.Name: Ticking Type
Obj_arg1.Description: The ticking sound effect type to be used. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Screen Effect Type
Obj_arg2.Description: The special screen effect to be used when activating the button.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the button is pressed. Gets deactivated again after the time runs out.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: HitWallTimerSwitch
Classes.Notes: An unused button that activates a switch for a set amount of time. The button can be activated using most of the player's attacks. After the time runs out, it will reset itself.

Obj_arg0.Name: Timer
Obj_arg0.Description: How long the switch will remain activated before it resets again. Default is 300.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when pressing the button.

Classes.Name: HomingKillerLauncher
Classes.Notes: A point that launches bullet-like enemies. HomingKiller generates Bullet Bills, Torpedo generates Torpedo Teds and MagnumKiller generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically. These enemies will explode and damage the player upon contact. They can be used to destroy various other objects and enemies.

Obj_arg0.Name: Homing Activation Range
Obj_arg0.Description: The range the player has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Turn Speed Multiplier
Obj_arg1.Description: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Homing?
Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on the player.

Obj_arg3.Name: Ignore Gravity?
Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, gravity will be ignored.

Obj_arg4.Name: Bullet Count
Obj_arg4.Description: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

Obj_arg5.Name: Launch Delay
Obj_arg5.Description: The delay between shots. Default is 180.

Obj_arg6.Name: Bullet Lifetime
Obj_arg6.Description: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

Obj_arg7.Name: Binder Activation delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: HoneyBee
Classes.Notes: A generic bee NPC that can be talked to. It also features several behaviors to choose from.

Obj_arg0.Name: Behavior & Equipment
Obj_arg0.Description: How it behaves and what item it carries. Types 6 to 9 are stubbed in SMG2 and won't work like intended.

Values.Notes: Picking up honey with bucket (SMG1 only)

Point_arg0.Name: Flying Animation Type
Point_arg0.Description: The animation to be used when it arrives at this path point.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on. Required when Obj_arg0 is set to 2.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is HoneyBee%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

Classes.Name: HoneyQueen
Classes.Notes: The Queen Bee NPC that can be talked to. Additionally, the player can climb on her when using the Bee power-up.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is HoneyQueen%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: IceMeteor
Classes.Notes: A falling ice crystal that creates an ice platform when it lands. Touching the meteor will freeze and damage the player. The ice platform can be stood on. The platform will disappear after three seconds and the crystal will reappear again later on. This object creates lava collision under the appearing location of the ice platform.

Obj_arg0.Name: First Appearance Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay in frames before the actual meteor appears. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Pause Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: How long the object remains invisible until it appears again. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Upwards Distance
Obj_arg2.Description: The Y-offset from which the meteor falls down. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Falling Time
Obj_arg3.Description: How long it takes for the meteor to fall down. Minimum should be 15. Default is 180.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: InfernoMario
Classes.Notes: An unused and unfinished variant of a Cosmic Clone that crashes the game due to a missing model. It appears to be passive, but it will turn towards the player if they are close enough and teleport next to them. Then, it will chase after the player and mimic all of their movements like normal Cosmic Clones do. However, it can be defeated using most of the player's attacks as well as some enemy attacks.

Obj_arg7.Name: Useless
Obj_arg7.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, all clones will be killed and the object will stop generating clones.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Classes.Name: InfernoMarioGenerator
Classes.Notes: Generates clones of the player that mimic all of their movements. If the player touches one, they will take damage and the clone disappears. The clones cannot be defeated through any other means. The generator and all of its clones will be destroyed when SW_B gets activated. This causes all remaining clones to drop Star Bits.

Obj_arg1.Name: Number of Clones
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of clones to be generated. Default is 40.

Obj_arg3.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg3.Description: The delay between each generation. Default is 90.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, all clones will be killed and the object will stop generating clones.

Camera.Description: Uses 出現デモカメラ for appearing.

Classes.Name: InvisiblePolygonObj
Classes.Notes: A collision polygon without an actual visual model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: ItemBlock
Classes.Notes: A ? Block that spawns items when hit. SplashCoinBlock and TimerCoinBlock spawn Coins, SplashPieceBock and TimerPieceBlock spawn Star Bits, CoinBlock2D spawns a single Coin and ItemBlockSwitch does not spawn any items, but it activates SW_DEAD. The "Splash" blocks drop the items immediately when hit. The "Timer" blocks award the player one item each time it's hit. However, these variants will automatically disappear after a timer runs out.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Items
Obj_arg0.Description: How many items will be spawned after hitting the block. Default is 8.

Obj_arg1.Name: Hit Timer
Obj_arg1.Description: How long the player is able to hit the block consecutively. Default is 240.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how to calculate the shadow.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after hitting the block.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and hit by player 2.

Classes.Name: ItemCollectionPlanetWall
Classes.Notes: A special model without collision which is usually visible unless it is assigned to the cutscene with the name パワースター帰還[アイテム惑星]. While the cutscene runs, the wall will be invisible but triggering its cutscene action will make it fade in again.

Classes.Name: ItemDice
Classes.Notes: A die block that can spawn either ten Coins, a Goomba or a 1-Up Mushroom depending on the side it lands on when hit. The player can hit it using Spin Attacks, Star Bits, snowballs, fireballs, Yoshi's projectiles and the Rock power-up.

Obj_arg1.Name: Horizontal Throw Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the die moves horizontally when hit. Default is 18.

Obj_arg2.Name: Vertical Throw Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: How fast the die moves vertically when hit. Default is 18.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and hit by player 2.

Classes.Name: ItemDrill
Classes.Notes: A drill item that the player can carry. It allows the player to dig through collision upon shaking the Wiimote. The player can get rid of it by taking damage or by picking up another power-up item.

Obj_arg0.Name: Against Collision Normal?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will always dig against the normal of the collision triangle below.

Obj_arg1.Name: Air Dig Distance
Obj_arg1.Description: How far the object checks for collision to determine when to end drilling. Greater values can allow "digging through air". Default is 300.

Obj_arg2.Name: Enable Reflection?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, an additional check for NoDig collision will be performed while the player is using the drill. This effectively enables the (angled) reflection behavior.

Obj_arg3.Name: Delay Gravity Update?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the player's gravity from 15 frames earlier will be used to determine where to drill, giving the player more control over drilling while gravity changes.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: If the player picks up one of the Drills in this group, all other Drills will temporarily disappear. They will all reappear if the player looses a Drill from this group.

Camera.Description: 固有 is used while drilling. Uses 出現デモカメラ when it appears via SW_APPEAR.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Classes.Name: ItemRoomDoor
Classes.Notes: A special door that can teleport the player through cutscenes. It tries to connect to three cutscenes. The cutscene マリオ顔惑星変化 is used for the Starship transformation during which the object will remain deactivated until it's forced to appear. アイテム部屋への入室 is used when entering the door and アイテム部屋からの退室 is used when exiting the door.

Obj_arg0.Name: Prevent Entering?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the door cannot be entered.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: Takes part in the cutscenes named アイテム部屋への入室, アイテム部屋からの退室 and マリオ顔惑星変化. For the cutscene アイテム部屋からの退室 it can use a special cutscene nerve function that will cause the door to open.

Classes.Name: Jellyfish
Classes.Notes: A jellyfish enemy that spawns a Coin when defeated. It can be defeated through most of the player's attacks as well as explosions, and it damages the player upon contact. It can move on a path or remain stationary.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 5.

Obj_arg1.Name: Last Point Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it remains on the last path point before it moves again. Default is 60.

Obj_arg2.Name: Movement Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how it should move on the path when it reaches the last point.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: JellyfishElectric
Classes.Notes: A jellyfish enemy that spawns a Coin (SMG1) or ten Star Bits (SMG2) when defeated. It can be defeated with a Koopa Shell or the Rainbow power-up, and it damages the player upon contact. It can move on a path or remain stationary.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 5.

Obj_arg1.Name: Last Point Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it remains on the last path point before it moves again. Default is 60.

Obj_arg2.Name: Movement Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how it should move on the path when it reaches the last point.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: JetTurtle
Classes.Notes: A Koopa Shell that can be carried by the player. It can be used to open specific treasure chests or damage and destroy various objects. The player can ride it underwater to move faster.

Obj_arg0.Name: Shell Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The Koopa Shell variant to be created. Each kind has a slightly different function.

Obj_arg1.Name: Useless
Obj_arg1.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg2.Name: Respawn Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether it respawns after destroying it or not.

Obj_arg3.Name: Appearance Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how the object appears when it respawns.

Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted, eaten and shot by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Jiraira
Classes.Notes: A land mine that quickly charges and explodes when stepping on its large trigger. It regenerates after a few seconds. The explosion also causes nearby land mines to charge and explode when they are hit by its explosion. It does not get clipped.

Obj_arg1.Name: Explosion Range
Obj_arg1.Description: The explosion's damage range. Default is 500.

SW_DEAD.Description: Meant to be activated when it gets killed, but this is not possible at all.

Classes.Name: Jugem
Classes.Notes: An enemy that rides a cloud. It moves to the path point that the player is closest to. It throws a Spiny when the player is nearby. The Spiny can be eaten and shot by Yoshi. If the Spiny has been killed, it will throw another one. It can be defeated using most of the player's attacks, and it can be eaten by Yoshi. However, it will respawn after a while. At least one Spiny should be linked to it, otherwise it won't throw any Spiny.

Obj_arg0.Name: Respawn Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it takes for it to respawn after it dies. Default is 900.

Point_arg0.Name: Distancing Type
Point_arg0.Description: How it behaves when the player approaches it at this point.

Values.Notes: Revolve around point to keep distance
Always stays at this path point

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: JumpBeamer
Classes.Notes: A purple stationary robot enemy with a spring head. It remains in the ground passively before the player approaches it. If the player is nearby, it jumps out of the ground and emits several rings of electricity. The player can bounce off of its spring head. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. It is not possible to destroy it through any means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Ring Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the individual rings grow. Default is 20.

Obj_arg1.Name: Ring Duration
Obj_arg1.Description: The lifetime of an individual ring before it disappears. Default is 100.

SW_A.Description: It remains passive while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: It will become passive after activating this switch.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

Group.Description: If one Jump Beamer in this group emits a ring, all the other Jump Beamers will do so as well.

Camera.Description: Used when player gets bounced off.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: JumpBranch
Classes.Notes: A pole that can be swung from and jumped off of.

Classes.Name: JumpGuarder
Classes.Notes: A green stationary robot enemy with a spring head. It remains in the ground passively before the player approaches it. If the player is nearby, it jumps out of the ground and emits several Topmini. It will keep regenerating Topmini even if the player killed some of them. The player can bounce off of its spring head. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. It is not possible to destroy it through any means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to declare. Useless because the Coins are never spawned.

Obj_arg1.Name: Launch Velocity
Obj_arg1.Description: The speed at which the Topmini are launched from this object.

Obj_arg2.Name: Number of Topmini
Obj_arg2.Description: Defines the number of Topmini to be spawned. Default is 4.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain passive until this switch gets activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will become passive after activating this switch.

Group.Description: If one Jump Guarder in this group launches a Topmini, all the other Jump Guarders will do so as well.

Camera.Description: Used when player gets bounced off.

Classes.Name: JumpHole
Classes.Notes: If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be launched along its assigned path.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the Star Ball will move on.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: JumpSpider
Classes.Notes: A spider enemy that jumps when the player is in its range. It attacks passively as the player receives damage upon contact. It can be defeated using most of the player's attacks.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: JumpStand
Classes.Notes: A spring-like trampoline that bounces the player into the air when Ground Pounded.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: JumpStandAuto
Classes.Notes: A spring-like trampoline that bounces the player into the air when jumping on it.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Kabokuri
Classes.Notes: A Goomba that wears a pumpkin mask. It wanders along a set path, and it sporadically emits a blue flame that burns the player upon contact. The enemy itself damages the player upon contact. The pumpkin mask can be destroyed with most of the player's attacks. This will reveal the Goomba. If the player uses a Ground Pound, the mask and the Goomba will be destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Calculate Gravity?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it won't calculate gravity and the object won't rotate with gravity.

Point_arg0.Name: Emit Flame
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies if it will emit a flame at this point or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Kameck
Classes.Notes: A Koopa Troopa that can cast various magical spells. The object's name declares what spells it casts. If the object's name is FireBallBeamKameck (SMG1) or Kameck (SMG2), it will cast fireballs. If the object's name is TurtleBeamKameck (SMG1), it will cast sliding Koopa Shells. SMG2 features two more variants: KameckKuriboMini and KameckMeramera which create Mini Goombas and Li'l Cinders, respectively. It moves between path points or stays at a fixed position. After casting a spell, it will temporarily disappear. It can be defeated using most of the player's attacks as well as explosions. It drops a single Coin when defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Cast Objects
Obj_arg0.Description: How many fireballs/enemies/etc. it creates at once. Minimum is 1, maximum is 3. Default is 1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Hide Visibility Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it stays visible after casting a spell. Default is 30.

Obj_arg3.Name: Activation Range
Obj_arg3.Description: The valid distance to the player in which it becomes active. Default is 3000.

Point_arg0.Name: Attack Type
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies whether it attacks the player or not at this point. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain invisible until this switch gets activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. It can use two special cutscene actions. ザコカメック登場 will make it appear whereas ザコカメック強制死亡 kills it.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: Kanina
Classes.Notes: A crab enemy that damages the player upon contact. It can be defeated by attacking the weak spot on its back. However, it can be defeated with fireballs, the Spin Drill, Koopa Shells and the Rainbow power-up as well. It can dig through the ground to warp back to its initial spot. KaninaRed drops some Star Bits when defeated whereas Kanina spawns a 1-Up.

Obj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Dig?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it won't dig into the ground.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated. This switch is required in SMG1. Does not work for Kanina in SMG2.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after it dies or when it gets eaten by Yoshi.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted, eaten and shot by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: Karikari
Classes.Notes: A small enemy that will chase after the player if they get too close. It will try to stick to the player's body to damage them. The player can get rid of them by using a Spin Attack. It can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. If shot by a Star Bit, it will drop three Star Bits instead of one. It can also be defeated by an enemy's explosion crush attack.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

Classes.Name: Karon
Classes.Notes: A skeleton enemy that wanders around passively. It will chase after the player to attack them. Its body disassembles when stomped, Ground Pounded, attacked with a Spin Attack or a fireball. However, it will be defeated when the player is using the Rainbow power-up, the Spin Drill or Yoshi's projectiles. Furthermore, it will sink down when touching SinkDown collision or lava collision (SMG2 only).

Obj_arg0.Name: Don't Stop SW_A Animation?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, its idle animation won't stop when SW_A is used and not activated yet.

Obj_arg1.Name: Use Path Direction Sight?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will only look and move into the path's direction.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will remain inactive while this switch is deactivated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and disassembled by Yoshi.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: KeySwitch
Classes.Notes: A collectable key that can activate a switch when collected. When it appears through any means, it will start a short appearance cutscene that will lock the game if it's not specified in the zone's CameraParam.bcam file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting it.

Camera.Description: Used when the key appears.

Classes.Name: KickStone
Classes.Notes: A small stone that can be kicked. It drops a single Star Bit or a Coin when hit by the player or explosions. The object automatically tries to connect to collision within 300 units.

Obj_arg0.Name: Drops Coin?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will drop a single Coin when kicked. Otherwise, it will drop a Star Bit.

Obj_arg1.Name: Connector Ignores Gravity?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the object's down vector will be used to determine the collision to connect the object to. Otherwise, the object's gravity will be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Don't Connect to Collision?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it won't connect to nearby collision.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: KingTossin
Classes.Notes: A large armadillo boss that will try to attack the player by rolling into them. It can only be defeated by hitting the weak spot with the Rock power-up. When it's not rolling, it will hop around for a few seconds. It may spawn a Power Star if the object and Scenario entry are configured correctly.

Obj_arg0.Name: Use Vector Register Camera?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will calculate the focal point of a vector register camera. The vector register's camera index is 1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg1.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. -1 does not register a Power Star.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on during the intro cutscene.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it. Requires Obj_arg1 to be configured correctly.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: キングトッシンデモ開始位置

Classes.Name: Kinopio
Classes.Notes: The iconic mushroom NPC that can be talked to. It features a wide range of different behaviors and equipment. Furthermore, it can spawn a Power Star if configured correctly.

Obj_arg1.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg2.Description: The animation/behavior to be used.

Obj_arg3.Name: Spawns Power Star?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, it will register a Power Star and spawn it after triggering the correct event flow.

Obj_arg4.Name: SW_APPEAR Behavior
Obj_arg4.Description: How it functions when its SW_APPEAR switch gets triggered. This setting is ignored if Obj_arg2 is set to 4.

Obj_arg5.Name: Strict LOD Distances?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, the high-poly model will be used when the player is closer to the object than usual. This also affects the distances for the middle-poly and low-poly models.

Obj_arg6.Name: Invalidate Sensor?
Obj_arg6.Description: If set, its body sensor will be invalidated so that all sensor-related interactions have no effect.

Obj_arg7.Name: Equipment
Obj_arg7.Description: The equipment that he wears/carries.

Point_arg0.Name: Point Behavior
Point_arg0.Description: How it behaves when it arrives at this point. Default is -1.

Values.Notes: Pauses for 1 second, then proceeds walking
Pauses for 2 seconds, then proceeds walking

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after triggering a specific message event flow. Requires Obj_arg2 set to 8.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Kinopio%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: KinopioBank
Classes.Notes: A Toad that allows the player to store Star Bits that can be shared across save files. He may give players free Star Bits depending on the number of stored Star Bits. An additional Toad (Kinopio) can be linked to it which will be hidden once this object is set to appear.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscene with the name ファイルセレクトからの開始.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is KinopioBank%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Check bank and initialize if necessary

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: KinopioPostman
Classes.Notes: A Toad that delivers special letters, such as those that open up a new mission. The letters and their appearance conditions are defined in the game's code. Initially, it will be hidden until the player has collected 13 Power Stars. An additional Toad (Kinopio) can be linked to it which will be hidden once this object is set to appear. This uses a very complex dialogue system that doesn't allow for much customization. MarioFaceShipZone provides dialogues, though.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: When activated, the game will check if the player has collected at least 13 Power Stars. If true, Mailtoad will appear.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: マリオ位置[郵便屋さんイベント]
Values.Notes: Player's position when he delivers a special letter

DemoCast.Description: It will register to several cutscenes used on Starship Mario. Its special cutscene action functor causes it to reappear at its initial position. The cutscenes that it registers to are ファイルセレクトからの開始, 郵便屋さんイベント[タスク], 郵便屋さんイベント[ロゼッタ], グランドスター帰還[２回目以降], パワースター帰還, パワースター帰還[NPC紹介], パワースター帰還[アイテム惑星], パワースター帰還[初回] and でしゃばりルイージ終了.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: Uses the dialogues KinopioPostmanOpen, KinopioPostmanLetterNormal, KinopioPostmanNoNewLetter, KinopioPostmanLetterPeach, KinopioPostmanLetterWitch, and KinopioPostmanLetterRosetta. These dialogues are to be specified in the zone's text archive.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: Kiraira
Classes.Notes: A sea mine that is chained to a fixation. When the player approaches it, its eyes will open, and it turns towards the player. Touching it will cause it to explode which hurts the player. If hit with a Koopa Shell, its explosion will also target other nearby objects.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated after it explodes. Gets deactivated again when it recovers.

Rail.Description: Can be used to specify the shape of the chain.

Group.Description: If one of the mines in this group explodes, all active mines will turn towards the exploded mine.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: KirairaRail
Classes.Notes: A sea mine that moves on a path. When the player approaches it, its eyes will open, and it turns towards the player. Touching it will cause it to explode which hurts the player. If hit with a Koopa Shell, its explosion will also target other nearby objects.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 5.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated after it explodes. Gets deactivated again when it recovers.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Group.Description: If one of the mines in this group explodes, all active mines will turn towards the exploded mine.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: KoopaAssaultFallObj
Classes.Notes: A decorative falling crystal. It's dead by default since its appearance is controlled by the MeetKoopaDemoObj it should be linked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Registered but never used.

Classes.Name: KoopaBattle
Classes.Notes: The boss version of Bowser, the main antagonist. He attacks with fire breath and falling meteors (AttackRock) that the player can launch into him. All fights require AttackRock instances, a KoopaDemoChamber and a KoopaBattlePlanet, they should not be linked to it directly, though. Furthermore, the final encounter also requires AttackRockFinal, KoopaFinalStarPlanet and KoopaFinalBattlePos. Additionally, it requires a specific cutscene setup. It always spawns a Power Star when defeated, which requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

SW_A.Description: If used, the boss battle will start once this switch gets activated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after defeating him.

DemoCast.Description: Registers to the cutscenes クッパオープニングデモ and クッパダウンデモ which are used for the cutscenes before and after the battle, respectively. Furthermore, KoopaLv3 also registers to クッパ最終戦開始デモ and クッパ最終戦終了デモ which are used before and after the final battle phase, respectively.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Message.Description: For each encounter, it uses special dialogues during cutscenes. For KoopaLv1 these are DemoKoopaVs1Opening and DemoKoopaVs1Down. For KoopaLv2 these are DemoKoopaVs2Opening and DemoKoopaVs2Down. For KoopaLv3 these are DemoKoopaVs3Opening, DemoKoopaLastBattleStart, DemoKoopaLastBattleEnd.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: KoopaBattlePlanet
