Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision intended to be used for Bowser battle setups. It automatically registers to the accessor of Bowser battle setup objects. It can also register any object linked to it. The appearance and disappearance of the linked objects will be synchronized with this object. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: KoopaDemoChamber
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and optional collision intended to be used for Bowser battle setups. It automatically registers to the accessor of Bowser battle setup objects. Initially, the object is not visible. It can also register any object linked to. The appearance and disappearance of the linked objects will be synchronized with this object.

Obj_arg0.Name: Use Break Model?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it loads and creates the destroyed model for use with some special cutscenes.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: KoopaFinalBattlePos
Classes.Notes: Marks the position of the final boss fight against Bowser that takes place in the sky. It automatically registers to the accessor of Bowser battle setup objects. The Bowser battle sequencer invokes this controller when needed.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the final battle starts.

Classes.Name: KoopaFinalStarPlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision intended to be used for Bowser battle setups. It automatically registers to the accessor of Bowser battle setup objects. Initially, the object is not visible. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrCastle
Classes.Notes: A castle tank boss that is controlled by Bowser Jr. It features rotating three rotating Fire Bars, vents that suck in cloud platforms and a large glass capsule. The player has to Ground Pound the glass three times to defeat the boss. After hitting it twice, the lower portion will emerge from the ground, allowing it to move around the arena. It always spawns a Power Star when defeated.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Starting Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle when activated.

SW_B.Description: The object will use its high-poly models when this switch gets activated.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Notes: Player's position after defeating it, the player is invisible during that cutscene, though

DemoCast.Description: Automatically registers to the cutscene with the name クッパJrキャッスル登場.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Message.Description: DemoOpeningKoopaJrCastle is used during the intro cutscene with Bowser Jr.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its balls of electricity can be removed by player 2.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrCastleCloudStep
Classes.Notes: A stationary cloud platform that can be stood on using the Bee or Cloud power-ups. If the player does not have any of these two power-ups and steps on the platform, it will temporarily disappear. When Ground Pounded, it will temporarily disappear as well, no matter what power-up is currently active. When Bowser Jr.'s Boomsday Machine is charging nearby, it will be attracted by the boss and disappear upon contact.

Obj_arg0.Name: Broken Shadow Validation
Obj_arg0.Description: Does not work due to a bug. When fixed, its shadows will be invalidated unless this argument is set.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrCastleGate
Classes.Notes: A pair of large gate doors that can be unlocked by activating a switch or by triggering its special cutscene nerve action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gate will be opened when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the switch gets activated after the gate opens through activating SW_A.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene nerve action opens the gate.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrCastleWindUp
Classes.Notes: A fan object that creates a gust of wind that can push cloud platforms created by the Cloud power-up. If Bowser Jr.'s Boomsday Machine moves over this fan, it will stop creating the gust.

Obj_arg0.Name: Wind Length
Obj_arg0.Description: The length of the wind gust. Default is 1200.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator
Classes.Notes: A controller that periodically generates platforms that move on a set path. The platforms that it creates always use the model KoopaJrLv2Lift. The actual platforms are usually represented by KoopaJrLv2LiftForGenerator objects which have to be linked to the generator.

Obj_arg6.Name: First Appearance Delay
Obj_arg6.Description: The time in frames it takes before the first platform appears. Default is 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: Individual Spawn Delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames between when each platform spawns. Default is 180.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The object will start execution when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the platforms will start to appear only after this switch has been activated once.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrRobot
Classes.Notes: A robot boss that is controlled by Bowser Jr. It features blue weak spots that have to be destroyed using Bullet Bills. After destroying these spots, the head needs to be attacked. It always spawns a Power Star. Several objects can be linked to it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after defeating the boss.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when it attacks with its hammers. Gets deactivated again after performing this attack.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

DemoCast.Description: Automatically registers to the cutscene with the name クッパJrロボットデモ.

Message.Description: DemoOpeningKoopaJrRobot is used during the intro cutscene with Bowser Jr.

Classes.Name: KoopaJrRobotBreakableStep
Classes.Notes: A stationary platform that breaks and falls when hit by a Banzai Bill, Megahammer or other crushing objects. After falling for a couple of seconds, the platform will disappear.

Classes.Name: KoopaNpc
Classes.Notes: A small variant of Bowser that lies down on the ground. When attacked, he will stand up and get angry at the player. Unlike most NPCs, it cannot be talked to at all.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated. A bit buggy because it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: KoopaSealField
Classes.Notes: A large door that is locked by three (KoopaSealField) or one (KoopaSealFieldMiddle) seals. These seals can be destroyed using Bowser Attack Rocks. One GravityLightRoad and one AttackRockTutorial can be linked to it. The linked AttackRockTutorial will not reappear after destroying the seals. The GravityLightRoad will appear after destroying the seals.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after the player went through the gravity light beam.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated after destroying all seals.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Uses 扉イン when entering the door through the gravity light beam.

Classes.Name: KoopaStatueVomit
Classes.Notes: A statue of Bowser that turns around when activating its SW_B switch. The actual laser beam is created by a separate object called ElectricRail.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rotates Right?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will rotate to the right. Otherwise, it will rotate to the left.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, this will get activated after the turning around.

SW_B.Description: When used, the statue will rotate when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: KoteBug
Classes.Notes: A bug-like enemy that remains idle until the player approaches it. If the player has the Bee power-up, it will chase after the player to damage them. Otherwise, it will flee from the player before dropping on its back after a while. This can be accomplished by attacking it with most of the player's attacks as well. Attacking it again will defeat it. However, it can be instantly defeated using a Ground Pound, the Rainbow power-up and the player's fireballs. Usually, it reveals three Star Bits when defeated. However, it drops a Coin when Ground Pounded or stomped.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Kuribo
Classes.Notes: A Goomba that can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. A Spin Attack will stun it, though. It can also be defeated by an enemy's explosion, crush or shockwave attack. It wanders around randomly. Once the player gets close, it will chase after the player to damage them. It drops a Coin when stomped or Ground Pounded, and it drops Star Bits when damaged through other means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Don't Calculate Gravity?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it won't calculate gravity. Instead, its down vector becomes the gravity vector.

Obj_arg1.Name: Initial State
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies its initial behavior.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: KuriboChief
Classes.Notes: A large Goomba enemy that can only be defeated by stunning it with a Spin Attack and damaging it again with most of the player's attacks. It can also be defeated by an enemy's crush or shockwave attack. It wanders around randomly. Once the player gets close, it will chase after the player to damage them. It drops some Star Bits when damaged through other means.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register cameras.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will spawn a Key that will activate this switch when collected.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: KuriboMini
Classes.Notes: A small Goomba enemy that can be instantly defeated using most of the player's attacks. It can also be defeated by an enemy's explosion, crush or shockwave attack. It wanders around randomly. Once the player gets close, it will chase after the player to damage them. It drops a Coin when stomped or Ground Pounded, and it drops a Star Bit when damaged through other means.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, the object will be killed.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: LavaBubble
Classes.Notes: A small lava bubble that jumps out and back into lava and damages the player upon contact. Obj_arg0 and Obj_arg3 implicitly define how far it jumps, which requires excessive testing.

Obj_arg0.Name: Jump Velocity
Obj_arg0.Description: How fast it moves when jumping. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Broken Gravity Fall Direction
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the direction it falls in will be affected by gravity. This is effectively useless, since the object never recalculates its gravity vector.

Obj_arg2.Name: Gravity Jump Direction?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the direction it jumps in will be its negated gravity vector.

Obj_arg3.Name: Jump Time
Obj_arg3.Description: How long it jumps before disappearing again. Default is 100.

Obj_arg4.Name: Appearance Delay
Obj_arg4.Description: How long it takes before it appears again. Default is 90.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: LavaFloater
Classes.Notes: A platform that sinks when the player steps on it. Once the player gets off of this platform, it rises up again. It creates rippling lava bubble particles when it sinks. This effect goes by the name LavaBubble and needs to be specified. It can also use optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: MapPartsFloaterMoveUpEnd, MapPartsFloaterRidden, MapPartsFloaterMoveDown, and MapPartsFloaterMoveUp.

MoveConditionType.Name: Sinking Distance
MoveConditionType.Description: How far it can sink when stepped on. Default is 0.

RotateSpeed.Name: Sinking Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast it sinks when stepped on. Default is 0.

RotateAngle.Name: Rising Speed
RotateAngle.Description: How fast it rises up again. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: If RotateAccelType is 1 and this switch is activated, the platform won't move.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: LavaGeyser
Classes.Notes: A lava geyser that periodically appears and disappear. It damages the player and compatible objects upon contact.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rising Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay until it starts rising up again. Default is 180.

Obj_arg1.Name: Rising Time
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it stays visible before disappearing again. Default is 180.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object will only appear while this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If activated, the geyser will disappear forever.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: LavaHomeVolcanoFlow
Classes.Notes: A large decorative volcano eruption effect.

SW_A.Description: Starts the eruption when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: LavaProminence
Classes.Notes: A fireball that appears periodically and moves on a path. It damages the player upon contact. The variant LavaProminenceWithoutShadow has no shadow.

Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it takes before it appears again. Default is 180.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: The rate at which it moves. Default is 20.

Obj_arg3.Name: End Offset
Obj_arg3.Description: The offset from the path's end at which the fireball disappears. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only appear when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: LavaSeparateWaterfall
Classes.Notes: A large castle-like planet consisting of two halves that move on two separate RailObj instances. The halves do not move until its SW_B gets activated. The RailObj instances can be configured like generic RailMoveObj objects; point_arg0 specifies the movement speed, for instance.

SW_B.Description: Causes the two halves to start moving once this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: LeafBoard
Classes.Notes: A leaf raft that can be steered by the player. Its movement on the Y axis sometimes fails when moving between water areas with different elevations. Furthermore, its ripple effect does not rotate correctly, but this can be fixed by setting the effect's Follow field to T/R.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: LensFlareArea
Classes.Notes: An area that causes lens flare effects on the camera when entered. The lens flare models will be rendered around a proper BrightSun or BrightObj instance.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enabled Models
Obj_arg0.Description: Bit field of models that should be rendered when entering this area. By default, all models are activated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: LiftFlower
Classes.Notes: A platform that disappears and reappears periodically. It always moves into one direction.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: How far it moves upwards. Default is 600.

Obj_arg1.Name: Initial Movement Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The delay in frames before it starts moving for the first time. Default is 0.

Rail.Description: Can be registered, although it's never used for anything.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: LightArea
Classes.Notes: An area that changes the currently active lighting configuration when entered. The available light configurations as well as their IDs have to be specified in the zone's Light file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Light ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the light configuration to be used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: LightFruit
Classes.Notes: A yellow pear that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Bulb Yoshi. Can be temporarily destroyed using Ground Pounds.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and swung by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: LotusLeaf
Classes.Notes: A floating lily pad platform that shakes when the player stands on it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: LuckyDice
Classes.Notes: A die block that can spawn a single Star Bit, one, three or five 1-Up Mushrooms depending on the side it lands on when hit. The player can hit it using Spin Attacks, Star Bits, snowballs, fireballs, Yoshi's projectiles and the Rock power-up. Interestingly, it declares 1000 Star Bits, although it can only spawn one.

Obj_arg1.Name: Horizontal Throw Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the dice moves horizontally when hit. Default is 18.

Obj_arg2.Name: Vertical Throw Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: How fast the dice moves vertically when hit. Default is 18.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and hit by player 2.

Classes.Name: LuigiIntrusively
Classes.Notes: An NPC variant of Luigi. It enables the player to play as Luigi when talked to in a galaxy. However, it will appear only if certain game progress conditions are met.

Obj_arg7.Name: Special Talk Camera?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will use the camera with the name 独自会話 when talked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Only used when Obj_arg7 is set. The camera used for talking to him goes by the label 独自会話.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If registered to でしゃばりルイージ終了, it can use an incomplete special cutscene functor action that does nothing.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label formats are LuigiIntrusivelyStart%03d and LuigiIntrusively%03d, where %03d is the text message ID. If set to -1, the default dialogue from SceneCommonMessage will be used.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: LuigiTalkNpc
Classes.Notes: A non-playable variant of Luigi that can be talked to. However, it will be hidden by default, meaning that SW_APPEAR or SW_AWAKE can be used to make it appear.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disable After Luigi Unlocked?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set and Luigi starts appearing in other galaxies, this object won't appear anymore, no matter what.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. For the Starship's cutscene 顔惑星注目会話イベント301 it can use a special cutscene functor action which makes it face the player.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is LuigiTalkNpc%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: MagmaBoatPlanetIce
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and collision. It creates an Ice model as well. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). When it appears, the ice model's "Freeze" animation plays.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: MagmaBoatPlanetMagma
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and collision. It creates an Ice model as well. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). If SW_A gets activated, the ice model appears with its "Freeze" animation and the object will disappear shortly after.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the ice model appears and the object itself will disappear shortly after.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated after the ice model appears.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: MagmaMeteor
Classes.Notes: A falling lava meteor that creates a lava pool when it lands. Touching the meteor will burn the player. The pool will disappear after three seconds and the meteor will reappear again later on.

Obj_arg0.Name: First Appearance Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay in frames before the actual meteor appears. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Pause Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: How long the object remains invisible until it appears again. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Upwards Distance
Obj_arg2.Description: The Y-offset from which the meteor falls down. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Falling Time
Obj_arg3.Description: How long it takes for the meteor to fall down. Minimum should be 15. Default is 180.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: MagmaSeaWave
Classes.Notes: A lava wave that move along a path. If it reaches the last point, it will teleport right back to the first point.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 10.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: MameMuimuiAttackMan
Classes.Notes: The monkey NPC who will prompt the player to play a scoring mini-game where one has to defeat as many Gummits as possible. The mini-game controller (MameMuimuiScorer or MameMuimuiScorerLv2) needs to be linked to it. It will register a Power Star, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. A complex dialogue with flow nodes needs to be set up as well.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is MameMuimuiAttackMan%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Replace number variable with player's score
Replace number variable with minimum score
Replace number variable with high score

AnimeFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for AnimeFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: MameMuimuiScorer
Classes.Notes: A controller for The Chimp's Skating Challenge which sets up the mini-game and Gummits. The offsets and sequences of the Gummits are specified in the ActorInfo files PositionList.bcsv and Sequence.bcsv, respectively. The player has 40 seconds to score points. The default high scores are 500 for MameMuimuiScorer and 600 for MameMuimuiScorerLv2. The object needs to be linked to a MameMuimuiAttackMan instance.

SW_A.Description: Kept activated while the mini-game is active.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Values.Notes: Player's position when the mini-game begins

Player2Targetable.Description: The Gummits can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: ManholeCover
Classes.Notes: A manhole that can be flipped by Ground Pounding on top of it or by jumping through it from below.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the switch will be activated at all times and deactivated while it's flipping.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: MarinePlant
Classes.Notes: A decorative underwater plant spawner which uses ShapeModelNo to derive the correct model to be loaded.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Plants
Obj_arg0.Description: The amount of plants to be placed. Default is 7.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: The texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Placement Range
Obj_arg2.Description: The range in which the plants will be positioned. Default is 200.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: MarioActor
Classes.Notes: A controller that sets the spawn point for the player at the start of a mission and at Checkpoints. May also be used for other things such as the warp areas on the Comet Observatory. If placed in a generic object placement file, this will create a glitchy clone of the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Entrance Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Defines how the player enters the scene.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: オープニングカメラマリオ座標

Camera.Description: The starting camera to be used when spawning at this point.

Classes.Name: MarioFaceAfterGrandStarTakeOffDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear in the cutscene where Starship Mario takes off to a new world after collecting a Grand Star. The individual models that it creates are DemoMarioFaceShipPlanet, Meister, WorldMapAccessPanel, MarioFaceShipRudder, and MiniWorldWarpPoint. The object needs to appear through a cutscene action.

DemoCast.Description: Takes part in the cutscene named グランドスター後発進デモ. It has a cutscene functor action which causes a white screen fade.

Classes.Name: MarioFacePlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and collision intended for use on Starship Mario. It also supports fur maps.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Triggering its cutscene functor action will display the Startship Mario explanation text.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: MarioFacePlanetPrevious
Classes.Notes: A generic object with a model and collision that tries to register to special Starship Mario cutscenes.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the object appears and deactivated when the object dies.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscenes スター１個目直後のゲームスタート and マリオ顔惑星変化. For the latter, it registers a special cutscene action nerve which causes the camera to shake and make the screen turn white for two seconds.

Classes.Name: MarioFacePlanetTakeOffDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear in the cutscene where Starship Mario takes off for the first time. The individual models that it creates are DemoMarioFaceShipPlanet, Meister, WorldMapAccessPanel, and MarioFaceShipRudder. It does nothing until SW_APPEAR gets activated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: Registers to the cutscene named マリオ顔惑星発進デモ.

Classes.Name: MarioFaceShipNpcRegister
Classes.Notes: Links a compatible parent object to a specific Starship Mario object appearance event. This also sets up and holds the short camera that usually zooms onto the parent object. Compatible objects are any objects with the MarioFaceShipNpcRegister property. The actual events are configured in the respective SystemDataTable files.

Obj_arg0.Name: Event ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The Starship Mario event that it belongs to.

Camera.Description: Used when the parent object gets introduced during the appearance event.

Classes.Name: MarioLauncher
Classes.Notes: A cannon that the player can use to shoot themselves to distant places. The player can freely move the camera around, zoom onto distant parts and leave the cannon again if desired.

Obj_arg0.Name: Shooting Direction
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the rough direction that the player can shoot into.

Obj_arg1.Name: Auto-shoot Timer?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the player will be given 5 seconds before the cannon automatically shoots the player.

SW_A.Description: This setting won't work properly due to a programming error. When used, it's supposed to prevent the player from entering and using the cannon while this switch is deactivated. This is not always the case though. Activating and deactivating the switch will temporarily fix this issue, but using the cannon will trigger the bug again.

SW_B.Description: If used, the switch will be activated while the player is inside the cannon. It will be deactivated again once the player leaves the cannon through any means.

Camera.Description: Used when entering the cannon.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: MarioLauncherTarget
Classes.Notes: A target for a cannon that the player can be shot against.  If the player hits the sensor with the name "Hit", they will receive a 1-Up and the Hit animation will be played. However, the NoHit animation will be played when the player hits another part. The object won't react if the player touches it through other means other than using the cannon.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Classes.Name: MarioNoCapArea
Classes.Notes: An area that hides Mario's cap when entered.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: MechanicKoopaMini
Classes.Notes: A robotic enemy that walks on a path. If the player is nearby, it will pursue the player to attack them with a flame. It can be defeated using a Ground Pound attack, which will cause it to spawn a single Coin. In SMG2, a Key (KeySwitch) can be linked to it which appears once this enemy is defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Jumps when Appearing?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will jump up and turn towards the player when it appears. Does not work in SMG2.

Obj_arg1.Name: Don't Pause Walking?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it won't pause while walking.

Obj_arg2.Name: Don't Calculate Gravity?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it won't calculate gravity. Instead, the negated up vector will be used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it won't pursue the player until this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: MeetKoopaDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the cutscene where Bowser is encountered for the first time. The individual models that it creates are DemoKoopa, DemoKoopaArm, Peach and TicoBaby. Exactly five KoopaAssaultFallObj instances have to be linked to this object. It does nothing until SW_APPEAR gets activated. Once activated, it will occasionally shake the screen.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If activated, Bowser will start to walk around and the falling meteors will appear.

SW_B.Description: Can be activated or deactivated using cutscene actions.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: ピーチ誘拐デモ基準点

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. It can use a special cutscene nerve action which will start the conversation with Bowser.

Message.Description: The text to be displayed can be found in SceneCommonMessage.arc/StoryBook.msbt. The text goes by the prefix DemoMeetKoopa. Furthermore, StoryBook_MeetKoopa_PeachHelp is used for Peach's text.

Classes.Name: Meister
Classes.Notes: The large purple Luma NPC that can be talked to. It registers to various Starship Mario cutscenes and events.

Obj_arg0.Name: Registers Starship Events?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will register and register to various Starship Mario events. This is only read if the current stage is MarioFaceShipGalaxy.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscenes with the names ハラペコスターピースチコ紹介, マリオ顔惑星変化, グランドスター帰還後（ワールド１）, グランドスター帰還後（ワールド２）, グランドスター帰還後（ワールド３）, グランドスター帰還後（ワールド４）, グランドスター帰還後（ワールド５）, ノーマルエンディング後デモ, スター120個エンディング後デモ, アイテム部屋からの退室, スター１個目直後のゲームスタート, パワースター帰還[初回], and ゲームオーバー後のデモ.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Meister%03d, where %03d is the text message ID. Additionally, it will use various complex dialogues from SceneCommonMessage. If Obj_arg0 is set, it will also load dialogues for the special appearance events from SceneCommonMessage.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Number of cleared Power Stars is even?

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: MemoryRoadDoor
Classes.Notes: A pair of closed doors that can be opened. It also flashes depending on the background music's beat.

SW_A.Description: Makes the doors open once activated.

Classes.Name: MemoryRoadStep
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports loading a model based on its ShapeModelNo. It will flash depending on the background music's beat.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: Menbo
Classes.Notes: A spider-like enemy that lunges across water. When it touches ice collision, it will be frozen to ice. It can be defeated by stomping, Spin Attacks, Ground Pounding, Yoshi's projectiles, Koopa Shells and explosions.

Obj_arg7.Name: Move Limit Collision Detection Distance
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies how far down it looks for the collision that limits its movement. Default is 1000.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscene with the name 星の入り江惑星氷化 which is used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy when the main planet gets frozen.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Meramera
Classes.Notes: An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions.

Obj_arg0.Name: Initial Behavior
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies its initial behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Respawns?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it'll keep respawning when killed.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: MercatorTransformCube
Classes.Notes: A special area that projects compatible objects inside it onto a sphere around the zone's origin. The area's initial placement will be used for the calculations. Therefore, the switches are effectively useless.

Obj_arg0.Name: Projection Radius
Obj_arg0.Description: The radius of the sphere that the objects will get projected on.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: MessageArea
Classes.Notes: An area that forcibly displays all linked shouting messages when entered.

Obj_arg0.Name: Message Link ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The message link ID of the shouting messages that should be displayed. Not to be confused with the MessageId of an object.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Metbo
Classes.Notes: A Goomba wearing a metal helmet. Therefore, they have to be stunned with a Spin Attack first before the player can stomp its weak spot. However, they can be defeated using the Rainbow power-up, Yoshi's projectiles or by having Yoshi eat them. It drops a Coin or three Star Bits depending on how it was defeated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will move around only if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: MeteorStrikeLauncher
Classes.Notes: A spawner for meteors that will crumble once they hit collision or the player. They damage the player upon contact. However, MeteorStrikeEnvironment does not interact with the player. If the object is called MeteorStrike, the meteors will only spawn if the spawner object is out of view. If the object is called MeteorCannon, the camera will shake once a meteor crumbles. For some reason, MeteorStrikeEnvironment crashes the game if a meteor hits collision.

Obj_arg0.Name: Fall Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the meteors fall. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The spawn delay of the individual meteors in seconds. Needs to be a positive number.

Obj_arg2.Name: Allow Multiple Meteors?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, multiple meteors can move on the path at the same time.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the meteors move on.

Classes.Name: MirrorArea
Classes.Notes: An area that causes compatible objects inside it to create a mirrored model. The mirrored models are usually rendered onto SimpleMirrorObj instances.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Moc
Classes.Notes: A strange wood NPC that can be talked to.

Obj_arg0.Name: Shape
Obj_arg0.Description: The shape to use.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spawns Power Star?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will register a Power Star. Its EventFunc needs to be triggered via an event flow node to make it spawn.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Moc%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Mogu
Classes.Notes: A mole enemy that hides in its hatch if the player is too far away or too close to it. If the player is nearby, it will come out of its hatch, and it will try to attack the player by throwing wrenches at them. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at it or by Ground Pounding nearby. When stunned, it can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. If the stage's name is CannonFleetGalaxy, it will use a greater range in which it can detect the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disable Wrench Gravity?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the wrench that it throws won't be affected by gravity.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only turn to the player and throw wrenches while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Mogucchi
Classes.Notes: A mole enemy that moves on a set path. The player takes damage by touching it. It can be stunned by Ground Pounding nearby which makes it vulnerable to Spin Attacks. However, it can be defeated with any player attacks, such as fireballs and Koopa Shells.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 5.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: MogucchiShooter
Classes.Notes: A mole enemy that uses a floating cannon to shoot cannonballs at the player. If the object's name is KillerShooter, it will shoot Bullet Bills instead. It can be defeated using Yoshi's projectiles or explosions.

Obj_arg0.Name: Launch Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay between shots. Default is 90.

SW_A.Description: If used, it won't shoot projectiles while this switch is not activated. Furthermore, its clipping will be toggled when this switch's state changes.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Monte
Classes.Notes: An exotic NPC that can be talked to. If enabled, it can throw the player upwards or towards a certain target point.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Chuckster Type
Obj_arg1.Description: The behavior to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Throw Height
Obj_arg2.Description: How far up the player gets thrown. Default is 700. Ignored if using a GeneralPos to specify the target.

Obj_arg3.Name: Throw Speed
Obj_arg3.Description: The rate at which the player gets thrown. Default is 50.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Values.Value: モンテ投げターゲット位置
Values.Notes: Position to throw the player at

Camera.Description: Used when the player gets thrown.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Monte%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: MorphItemCollection
Classes.Notes: Displays a model of a power-up that cannot be collected. These objects only serve a decorative purpose. Natively, only the Spring, Bee, Boo, Fire, Cloud, Rock and Drill power-ups are supported. Can be registered to Starship Mario events via MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Classes.Name: MorphItemNeoBee
Classes.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Bee character. This power-up state allows them to fly around like a bee.

Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.

Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.

Obj_arg2.Name: Landing Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Values.Notes: Stays in position where it appeared

Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow & Clipping Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow and clipping properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

Obj_arg5.Name: Appearance Camera Type
Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies what appearance event cameras are to be used.

Values.Notes: Use 出現1 and 出現2

Obj_arg6.Name: Rotation Type
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies how the item rotates. It never visibly rotates while inside a bubble.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after it is destroyed.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Camera.Description: Used when the item appears.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Classes.Name: MorphItemNeoFire
Classes.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Fire character. This temporary power-up state allows them to shoot fireballs.

Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.

Obj_arg1.Name: Binder Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Enables or disables collision binding.

Obj_arg2.Name: Landing Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.

Values.Notes: Stays in position where it appeared

Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow & Clipping Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow and clipping properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once
Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

Obj_arg5.Name: Appearance Camera Type
Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies what appearance event cameras are to be used.

Values.Notes: Use 出現1 and 出現2

Obj_arg6.Name: Rotation Type
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies how the item rotates. It never visibly rotates while inside a bubble.

Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.
