MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Classes.Name: MorphSwitchArea
Classes.Notes: If the player stays inside this area and fulfills the specified conditions (Obj_arg0), it will activate its SW_A switch. If the player leaves the area again or the condition is not met anymore, the switch will be deactivated again. If Obj_arg0 is set to 1, it will check if the player is "in rush". This refers to the state where the player is bound to another object, for example Fluzzard, Rock Mushroom's rolling rock, the Star Ball and more.

Obj_arg0.Name: Condition
Obj_arg0.Description: The required power-up state condition to activate the switch.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated or deactivated whether the specified condition is fulfilled or not.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: MultipleChoiceDice
Classes.Notes: A die block that activates a switch depending on the side it lands on when hit. The player can hit it using Spin Attacks, Star Bits, snowballs, fireballs, Yoshi's projectiles and the Rock power-up.

Obj_arg1.Name: Horizontal Throw Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the die moves horizontally when hit. Default is 18.

Obj_arg2.Name: Vertical Throw Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: How fast the die moves vertically when hit. Default is 18.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when it lands on a red circle face.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated when it lands on a blue cross face.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and hit by player 2.

Classes.Name: MysteryMountainPlanet
Classes.Notes: A collision-less cake planet that is wrapped inside a present box. It uses the two animations BoxVanish and CakeVanish, which cause the box and cake to vanish if SW_A is activated. If the player is within 3000 units while the object is being initialized, the cake will automatically vanish.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the vanish animations will be played.

Classes.Name: NeedlePlant
Classes.Notes: A spiky plant that damages the player when touched. It can be destroyed with fireballs, Yoshi's projectiles, the Rock power-up and the Rainbow power-up, Coconuts and Stretch Plants.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The item to be spawned after spinning near it.

Obj_arg1.Name: Validate Shadow?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, its shadow will be enabled.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated when it dies. Due to an oversight, this does not work for NeedlePlant in SMG2.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and pulled by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: NeedleTrap
Classes.Notes: A trap panel with spikes that pop out periodically. They will disappear again after 1.5 seconds.

Obj_arg0.Name: First Appearance Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The delay in frames before the spikes appear for the first time. Default is 0.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Nigero
Classes.Notes: A frog-like enemy that jumps and burrows into the ground. If it does so, it will reappear out of a random spot again. They will try to pick up an item if they find one and run away with it. It can pick up Coins, Purple Coins, Silver Stars, Star Chips and Blue Chips. They can be defeated by having Yoshi eat them or by stomping on top of them. However, they will reappear again after a few seconds.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: NokonokoLand
Classes.Notes: A small turtle enemy that walks around passively. Touching it damages the player. When stunned with a Spin Attack, it enters its shell which can be picked up by the player. Green is the default color. Red ones move slightly faster. Blue ones behave exactly like green ones.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg3.Name: Doesn't Respawn?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, it will not respawn after destroying its shell.

Point_arg0.Name: Turn Type
Point_arg0.Description: How it behaves when it arrives at this point.

Values.Notes: Keeps on walking and does nothing special
Pauses and looks around, then proceeds walking

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Group.Description: Registers objects of the same kind, but the group is never used for anything.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action causes it to appear.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted, eaten and shot by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: NokonokoLandBig
Classes.Notes: A big turtle enemy that walks around passively. Touching its body (excluding the shell) damages the player. It can be defeated by the Spin Drill which causes it to drop a single Coin. The player can bounce off its shell. If performed several consecutive times, the player will be awarded a 1-Up on every bounce.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Once activated, it will return to its initial path coordinate.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: NoMessageArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents the player from talking to NPC-like objects such as Toads or signboards.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: NonSleepArea
Classes.Notes: An area that prevents the player from sleeping. Furthermore, this also changes the player's idle animation.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: NormalEndingDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the ending cutscene where Rosalina visits Starship Mario. The individual models that it creates are DemoMarioFaceShipPlanet, WorldMapAccessPanel, MarioFaceShipRudder, DemoAstroCocoon, DemoAstroPlanet, TicoBaby, Peach, Rosetta, Meister, and GrandStar. Some joints of the models MarioShipTakeOff and DemoAstroPlanetNull are used to position the other models.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: ノーマルエンディングデモ基準点

DemoCast.Description: Registers to the cutscenes with the names ノーマルエンディング１, ノーマルエンディング２, ノーマルエンディング３, and ノーマルエンディング４. For ノーマルエンディング１ it can use a special cutscene nerve action which makes the actual components appear.

Message.Description: The text to be displayed can be found in SceneCommonMessage.arc/StoryBook.msbt. The text goes by the labels DemoEnding1st, DemoEnding2nd, DemoEnding3rd, and DemoEnding4th.

Classes.Name: NoteFairy
Classes.Notes: A set of Rainbow Notes that can be collected in order to activate a switch. It can also spawn a Power Star if Obj_arg7 and the galaxy's Scenario file are configured correctly.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Notes
Obj_arg0.Description: If set to -1, the necessary notes to play the song will be created. If set to -2, notes will be placed on path points only. Any other positive number specifies how many notes should be spawned, however, this number is ignored when Obj_arg4 is not negative.

Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the creator note moves along the path. Requires Obj_arg3 set to any value between 1 and 6 inclusive. Default is 13.

Obj_arg2.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg2.Description: How long it takes before the notes disappear again. Default is 20.

Obj_arg3.Name: Appearance Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how the individual notes appear and whether a short cutscene should be played or not.

Values.Notes: Single note appears, moves along path and creates other notes, starts appearance camera
Single note appears, moves along path and creates other notes, starts appearance camera
Single note moves on path and creates trail of notes, cutscene runs until all notes have appeared
Notes appear one by one, starts appearance camera
Notes appear one by one, no appearance jingle plays

Obj_arg4.Name: Song Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the song that should be played.

Obj_arg5.Name: Completion SFX Type
Obj_arg5.Description: Can be used to enable the completion jingle.

Obj_arg6.Name: BGM Change Type
Obj_arg6.Description: How the stage's BGM will be changed while the notes are active.

Obj_arg7.Name: Power Star Type
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies whether a Power Star should be spawned and how it appears.

Values.Notes: Spawn Power Star from object's position
Spawn Power Star from note's position
Spawn Power Star from note's position

Path_arg0.Name: Note Play Length
Path_arg0.Description: Specifies how long each note play out. Only used when Obj_arg0 is set to -2.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all notes.

SW_B.Description: If used, all notes will be destroyed once this switch is deactivated.

Rail.Description: The path that the notes will be placed on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawns once all notes have been collected. Requires Obj_arg7 to be configured correctly.

Camera.Description: Used when the notes appear. This is only used by a few appearance types.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: Nyoropon
Classes.Notes: A tube worm-like enemy that opens its eyes and tries to block the player's movement when approached. When the player touches it, they'll be damaged. It can be defeated with a Koopa Shell or by the light shone by the shell itself. Furthermore, the player can use Spin Attacks or Star Bits to defeat it. This causes it to drop three Star Bits.

Obj_arg7.Name: Eyes Open During Intro?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, its eyes will be opened during a mission's intro sequence.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: OceanSphere
Classes.Notes: A sphere of water that essentially functions as a visible WaterArea. If the stage's name is TearDropGalaxy, it becomes translucent and uses a lighter shade of blue; if the stage's name is SkullSharkGalaxy, it retains the dark blue color but becomes translucent as well. When it appears through a cutscene, the water will scale up first.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. The object won't appear until this cutscene causes it to do so through a cutscene action.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. Only works if the object isn't already part of another cutscene.

Classes.Name: OldFortressCover
Classes.Notes: A cover that can be moved once by activating its SW_A switch. Its "Move" animation specifies how it moves. After that, the cover will not disappear.

Obj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Open?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, SW_A will be ignored.

SW_A.Description: Opens when this switch gets activated.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: OmoteuLandSky
Classes.Notes: A decorative background model meant to be placed around entire galaxies. It has gravity-indicating arrows that point upwards or downwards depending on the player's gravity.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: OnimasuJump
Classes.Notes: A stone box enemy that jumps between its path points. By default, the jumping velocity is so low that the jump is barely noticeable. The direction it rotates to while moving can be configured as well.

Obj_arg0.Name: Pause Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it pauses before moving. Default is 90.

Obj_arg1.Name: Move Time
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it takes to move to the next point. This also affects the jump velocity. Default is 30.

Obj_arg2.Name: Comet Pause Delay
Obj_arg2.Description: How long it pauses before moving during a Double Time comet. Default is 45.

Obj_arg3.Name: Comet Move Time
Obj_arg3.Description: How long it takes to move to the next point during a Double Time Comet. This also affects the jump velocity. Default is 15.

Point_arg0.Name: Turn Direction
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies how to turn and move at this point.

Values.Notes: Rotates backward & remains at point before moving.

SW_A.Description: If used, it won't move until this switch gets activated once.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: OpeningDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the opening cutscene where Mario receives the letter from Peach and appears through a Warp Pipe. The object's placement specifies where the Warp Pipe appears from. The individual models that it creates are PeachShootingStar, PeachPrologueSky, and EarthenPipe. Furthermore, it uses the layouts PrologueText and PeachLetterMini. Before the player appears, the music STM_SMG2_EV_PROLOGUE_02 starts to play.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: OtaKing
Classes.Notes: A large octopus boss that resides in a large lava pool. In order to defeat it, the player has to fling its coconuts back against him. It shoots either three fireballs or a coconut. After the first phase, it will start to spawn Blue Podoboos. In SMG1, it will always spawn a Power Star when defeated, which requires a properly configured Scenario entry. There's also a "Spicy" variant which requires a few more hits. This variant does not spawn the long tentacles, though. If added and used in SMG2, it will crash the game when skipping the intro cutscene as the code does not account for the missing tentacles.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spicy Variant?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it loads the models for the Spicy variant and requires more hits to be defeated.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss fight once activated.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated after starting the third phase (after he looses the crown).

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its coconuts can be targeted and fetched by player 2.

Classes.Name: OtaRock
Classes.Notes: An octopus enemy that attacks the player by spitting fireballs and coconuts at them. It can be defeated with a Koopa Shell, a coconut, or any attacks caused by another enemy.

Obj_arg0.Name: Always Shoots Fireballs?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will spit fireballs instead of coconuts.

Obj_arg1.Name: Starts With Coconut?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will begin to spit a coconut instead of a fireball.

SW_A.Description: If used, it remains passive while this switch is not activated. It's intended to be placed inside a TakoBarrelA or another container when using this switch. Once activated, it will hop out and behave as usual.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its coconuts can be targeted and fetched by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: OtaRockTank
Classes.Notes: A green octopus boss that drives in a wheeled barrel. It can shoot multiple fireballs and coconuts from its blasters. It moves along a path, and it may stop at a path point to spit some projectiles. The fireballs create Matter Splatter holes when they land. It can be defeated by flinging coconuts against it multiple times. After defeating it, it may spawn a Power Star if the object and Scenario entry are configured correctly.

Obj_arg0.Name: Spawns Power Star?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it registers a Power Star to be spawned after defeating it.

Point_arg0.Name: Multiple Attacks
Point_arg0.Description: Can be used to disable multiple attacks while it moves on the path segment from this to the next point. Default is -1.

Values.Notes: Can attack multiple times on segment
Don't attack multiple times on segment

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it. Requires Obj_arg0 to be set.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Camera.Description: Used during the battle.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its coconuts can be targeted and fetched by player 2.

Classes.Name: PackunFlowerBig
Classes.Notes: A huge plant enemy that emerges from the ground. Unlike most enemies, it cannot be defeated at all. However, it can be stunned with a Spin Attack or a Star Bit.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: PackunPetit
Classes.Notes: A plant enemy that tries to bite the player if they are nearby. It can be defeated through all player attacks as well as some enemy attacks. Once defeated, it will either drop a Coin or three Star Bits depending on how it was defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Turn?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it won't turn around.

Obj_arg7.Name: Use Collision Binder?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will use a collision binder which makes it react to collision. Furthermore, it will also react to gravity instead of being in a locked position.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated when it dies. It won't drop any items when killed, however.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and pulled by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PartsModel
Classes.Notes: A "minor object" that gets created by a parent object that it is linked to. Therefore, it cannot be placed on its own. It comes with a model, optional collision, effects and sounds. How it gets used depends on the parent object.

Classes.Name: Patakuri
Classes.Notes: A Goomba with wings that flies across a set path. It can be defeated by stomping or Ground Pounding on top of it. All other attacks cause it to lose its wings, turning it into a regular Goomba.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PatakuriBig
Classes.Notes: A huge Goomba with wings that flies across a set path. Any of the player's attacks cause it to lose its wings, turning it into a regular Big Goomba.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Created but never used.

Classes.Name: Peach
Classes.Notes: An NPC version of Mario's eternal damsel in distress that can be talked to. When attacked, she will pull an umbrella to defend herself. However, this behavior is exclusive to SMG2.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Peach%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PeachCastleNightPlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision that is meant to show fireworks. The "Fire" sound effect is synchronized with the object's particles. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. This planet supports optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: Penguin
Classes.Notes: A cute penguin NPC that can be talked to.

Obj_arg0.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg0.Description: How it behaves.

Obj_arg7.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg7.Description: The color frame to be used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Penguin%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PenguinCoach
Classes.Notes: A tall penguin NPC that can be talked to. In SMG1, it also controls parts of the surfing mini-game by interacting with a grouped SurfRay object.

Obj_arg0.Name: Event Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether it should register a Power Star and join races. Default is 0.

Values.Notes: Register Power Star, joins race, uses tutorial

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups PenguinCoach and SurfRay. This is used to notify SurfRay about the tutorial states. This object only registers to this group if Obj_arg0 is set to 2 or 3.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

Camera.Description: Uses 会話 when talking. If Obj_arg0 is 2, it will use チュートリアル for the tutorial.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action causes it to return to its initial position.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is PenguinCoach%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PenguinMaster
Classes.Notes: An elderly penguin NPC that can be talked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is PenguinMaster%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Petari
Classes.Notes: A bag-like enemy that wanders around while becoming fully invisible. However, its path is indicated by the footprints it creates. If the player isn't too close, it will pause and turn visible. It will start to wander around again if the player comes closer, though. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Ground Pounds, stomping, fireballs, the Rainbow power-up as well as by having Yoshi eat it. Once defeated, it will drop 20 Star Bits.

Obj_arg0.Name: Footprint Y Offset
Obj_arg0.Description: How far to displace each footprint below the object's position. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg1.Description: How many Star Bits it can spawn when defeated. Default is 20.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: PetitPorter
Classes.Notes: A dish that teleports the player to a specified destination point. It can be activated by using a Spin Attack while standing on it. The player will be teleported back to the teleporter after the specified amount of time elapsed. The destination point (PetitPorterWarpPoint) needs to be specified, however, the return point (PetitPorterExitPoint) can be specified.

Obj_arg0.Name: Teleporter Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The teleporter's group which can be used to link warp and exit points to it.

Obj_arg1.Name: Timer
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it takes before the player gets teleported back again. Default is 600.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated while the teleporter is still active. Gets deactivated once it becomes unusable.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated once the player teleports to the destination and gets deactivated again after the timer runs out.

Camera.Description: Used for multiple warping circumstances. 基点でワープイン is used when warping from the teleporter. ワープ点でワープアウト is used when the player appears at the destination point. ワープ点でワープイン is used when the player gets teleported after the timer runs out. 基点でワープアウト is used when the player appears at the return point.

Classes.Name: PetitPorterExitPoint
Classes.Notes: A point in space that can be used to specify the position where the player gets teleported to after the timer of a Bonus Planet Teleporter runs out. It can be grouped with a corresponding teleporter using Obj_arg0.

Obj_arg0.Name: Teleporter Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The teleporter group to which this point belongs.

Classes.Name: PetitPorterWarpPoint
Classes.Notes: A point in space that is used to specify the position where the player gets teleported to when using a Bonus Planet Teleporter. It can be grouped with a corresponding teleporter using Obj_arg0.

Obj_arg0.Name: Teleporter Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The teleporter group to which this point belongs.

Classes.Name: Peto
Classes.Notes: A purple blob enemy that creates fields of electricity. It jumps around randomly or between fixed path points. It can be defeated with all player attacks as well as explosions, which causes it to drop a Coin.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path points to jump between.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PhantomTorch
Classes.Notes: A flame that burns the player and other compatible objects upon contact. It can be extinguished using a Spin Attack.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies the item to be spawned after putting out the fire.

Obj_arg1.Name: Decorative?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the flame won't burn anything, and it can't be extinguished.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups other objects of the same kind. Special sound effects will be played when extinguishing the flames in this group. The limit of objects in a group is 32.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and extinguished by player 2.

Classes.Name: Pichan
Classes.Notes: An orange bird NPC that can be talked to. Fluzzard (GliBird) needs to be added as a separate object. It can register a Power Star, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. A complex dialogue with flow nodes should be set up in order to control the mini-game.

Obj_arg0.Name: Spawns Power Star?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will register a Power Star. Its EventFunc needs to be triggered via an event flow node to make it spawn.

Obj_arg1.Name: Initialize Tutorial?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the tutorial controller will be created, thus enabling the tutorial sequence. This only works in gliding stages, namely JungleGliderGalaxy and ChallengeGliderGalaxy.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: レース開始時マリオ位置
ピーチャン位置[スター渡し]

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Pichan%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

AnimeFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for AnimeFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PichanRacer
Classes.Notes: A bird NPC intended for gliding races that moves in a predefined GST motion during the race. The GST motion data for it can be found in the gst folder of the Galaxy's Ghost archive. It can register a Power Star if Obj_arg0 is 0, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. A complex dialogue with flow nodes should be set up in order to control the race.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame / Power Star
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used. If 0, this also registers a Power Star to be spawned via event flow nodes. Default is 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: GST File ID
Obj_arg7.Description: The ID of the GST file to be loaded. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Values.Value: ピーチャンレーサーレース終了後位置

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is PichanRacer%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PicketSwitch
Classes.Notes: A stump that can be Ground Pounded in order to activate a switch.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after Ground Pounding the stump.

Classes.Name: PictureJoinPlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and optional collision that acts as a BaseMtxFollowTarget. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: PipeModeCube
Classes.Notes: An area that changes the direction the player is moving to by 90 degrees as soon as entered, presumably intended to be used to connect two PlaneModeCube areas around a corner.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PlaneCircularModeCube
Classes.Notes: An area that restricts the player's movement to a 2D plane while the player is inside it. The movement direction is adjusted for moving around a circular center point. Basically, this also allows the player to keep running into the direction the stick was held in first. This area may be a bit complicated to use, so it's advised to take a look at Tarantox's zone in SMG1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PlaneCollisionArea
Classes.Notes: An area that extends the player's sensor range to detect items. This allows the player to collect an item while they stand closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PlaneModeCube
Classes.Notes: An area that restricts the player's movement to a 2D plane while the player is inside it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PlanetMap
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Any object defined in PlanetMapDataTable usually becomes a PlanetMap object, excluding some objects. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models. In SMG2, this class supports fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If used, it won't appear until its appear cutscene action gets triggered.

Classes.Name: PlanetMapAnimLow
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision whose Low model is animated. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models. In SMG2, this class supports fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If used, it won't appear until its appear cutscene action gets triggered.

Classes.Name: PlanetMapFarClippable
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision with a far clipping distance of 50 meters. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models. In SMG2, this class supports fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg3.Name: Useless

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If used, it won't appear until its appear cutscene action gets triggered.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: PlanetMapPress
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision whose collision may crush the player. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: PlanetMapProjmap
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision that uses a projection map matrix. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Classes.Name: PlanetMapStrongLight
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision that is affected by strong light. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.
