SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: Plant
Classes.Notes: A beanstalk-like vine that the player can swing along by shaking the Wiimote. Once the player reaches the end of the vine, it will cause them to jump off. The launch speed and angle are configurable.

Obj_arg0.Name: Launch Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: How fast the player gets flung off after reaching the end of the plant's path. Default is 30.

Obj_arg1.Name: Launch Angle
Obj_arg1.Description: At what angle the player gets launched off after reaching the end of the plant's path. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Play Appearance Camera?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will play a short event camera cutscene when its tuber gets popped.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The vine will appear when this switch is activated, rendering its tuber redundant.

Rail.Description: Lays out the vine that can be climbed.

Camera.Description: Uses 出現デモ when it appears and 掴まり while the player is climbing the vine.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its bud can be targeted and opened by player 2.

Classes.Name: PlantGroup
Classes.Notes: A group of decorative plants that can appear in many shapes. In SMG2, some objects of this class use ShapeModelNo to derive the proper model to be loaded. The plants attach to the nearest collision below them. If no collision is available, the individual plant may be placed at the origin of the galaxy.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Plants
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of plants to be placed. Default is 7.

Obj_arg1.Name: Number of Items
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of items to be spawned. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg2.Description: The kind of item to be spawned.

Obj_arg3.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used. The available colors depend on the used model. See the individual plant objects for detailed lists.

Obj_arg4.Name: Calculate Gravity?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, gravity will be taken into account when positioning the plants.

Obj_arg5.Name: Prevent Random Rotation?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, the individual plants won't be randomly rotated when placed. This setting is always enabled for PlantD02 (sunflower).

Obj_arg6.Name: Y Offset
Obj_arg6.Description: The Y offset added to every plant's Y coordinate. Default is 0.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Can be used to lay out the plants on a line.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: PlantSlider
Classes.Notes: A vine with Star Bit Flowers that the player can slide along by grabbing onto the vine. Once the player reaches the end of the vine, it will cause them to jump off. Unlike similar objects, the player doesn't need to swing their Wiimote.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invalidate Flower Clipping?
Obj_arg0.Description: Invalidates clipping for all flowers while the vine is not being clipped.

Obj_arg1.Name: Launch Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the player gets launched off the vine. Default is 20.

Obj_arg2.Name: Launch Angle
Obj_arg2.Description: At what angle the player gets launched off after reaching the end of the plant's path. Default is 25.

Obj_arg3.Name: Bending Factor
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how much the vine bends when grabbed by the player. This also affects where the player lands. Negative values aren't allowed. Default is 15.

Obj_arg4.Name: Base Matrix from Front & Side?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the player's base matrix will be calculated from the front and side vectors at the currently touched part of the vine. By default, it will be calculated from front and up vectors. This effect is barely noticeable in game.

Rail.Description: Lays out the vine that can be slid on.

Camera.Description: Uses 滑り while the player is sliding the vine.

Classes.Name: PlayAttackMan
Classes.Notes: The monkey NPC that will give the player a Power Star when talked to. It will register a Power Star, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is PlayAttackMan%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PlayerMorphLimitArea
Classes.Notes: An area that restricts the use of power-ups inside this area. If the player leaves the area again, any power-up effects will be removed instantly. Furthermore, the player will automatically dismount Yoshi.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PlayerSideRetainOffArea
Classes.Notes: An area that adjusts the player's movement direction all the time. Usually, when a camera change occurs, the player will keep walking into the direction the stick was held before the camera changed. This prevents exactly that.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Poihana
Classes.Notes: A strange duck-like enemy that moves around passively and chases after the player if they are nearby. It will then try to fling the player upwards. It cannot be defeated through any means, but the player can stun it using most attacks. Furthermore, it will always try to return to its initial position if it walks too far away from it. It uses a mirror model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Launch Intensity
Obj_arg0.Description: How far the player moves upwards when flung. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies its general behavior.

Values.Notes: Walk around and reset home position when it flings the player up

Obj_arg4.Name: Can Drown?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, it can and will drown if it's inside water.

Obj_arg7.Name: Use Small Binder?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will use a smaller collision binder.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when it flings the player upwards.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

MirrorActor.Description: A mirrored version of this object is created for mirror reflection setups if placed inside a MirrorArea.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: Pole
Classes.Notes: A climbable pole. Pole and PoleNoModel can be climbed from all variants and the player can also climb the top part. PoleSquare and PoleSquareNoModel can be climbed from four directions and the top cannot be reached. In SMG2, Pole2Way was added which can be climbed from two directions only, so it's intended to be used in 2D-restricted sections. In SMG1, there's also code for an unfinished variant called TreeCube, but that one crashes due to missing collision. If placed in TwisterTowerGalaxy, the player will be properly removed from the pole when they touch ground.

Obj_arg0.Name: Top not Climbable?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the top won't be climbable. This setting is always enabled for PoleSquare and PoleSquareNoModel.

Obj_arg1.Name: Invert Direction?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the player moves into the opposite direction instead.

Obj_arg2.Name: Collision Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the collision mesh to be used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when climbing the pole.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. The object won't appear until this cutscene causes it to do so through a cutscene action.

Classes.Name: PoleObstacleParts
Classes.Notes: A simple decorative object with a model and collision that can be created by RailPlacementPoleObstacle or by placing it directly.

Classes.Name: Polta
Classes.Notes: A ghostly rock boss that attacks by throwing large stones against the player. While all of them damage the player when hit, the yellow ones drop a Coin and the black ones cause a Bomb Boo to appear with which the player can attack the boss. During the second phase, the boss creates two rock hands that can be used for attacking the player and defending itself. In SMG1, it will spawn a Power Star, although this requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.

SW_A.Description: Starts the boss battle once activated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: ポルタ開始デモプレイヤー位置
ポルタデモプレイヤー位置

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its rocks can be targeted, frozen and destroyed by player 2.

Classes.Name: PomponPlant
Classes.Notes: A bubbly plant that bounces the player off when they touch it. It can spawn items when hit by the player. If one of the players touch the plant with their pointer, it will swing around.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The kind of item to spawn.

Obj_arg1.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of items to spawn.

Classes.Name: Popo
Classes.Notes: A pink enemy that tries to cling onto Yoshi, but runs away from the player under normal circumstances. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Ground Pounds or by stomping on top of it. Furthermore, it can be shaken off Yoshi, which defeats it as well.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PositiveDice
Classes.Notes: A die block that can spawn a single Star Bit or a 1-Up Mushroom depending on the side it lands on when hit. The player can hit it using Spin Attacks, Star Bits, snowballs, fireballs, Yoshi's projectiles and the Rock power-up.

Obj_arg1.Name: Horizontal Throw Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: How fast the dice moves horizontally when hit. Default is 18.

Obj_arg2.Name: Vertical Throw Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: How fast the dice moves vertically when hit. Default is 18.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and hit by player 2.

Classes.Name: PostFogArea
Classes.Notes: An area that renders a fog post effect on the screen while the player is inside it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Inner Radius
Obj_arg0.Description: Ranges from 0 to 10000 inclusive. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Outer Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: Ranges from 0 to 10000 inclusive. Default is 10000.

Obj_arg2.Name: Alpha
Obj_arg2.Description: The alpha channel component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg3.Name: Red
Obj_arg3.Description: The red color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg4.Name: Blue
Obj_arg4.Description: The blue color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg5.Name: Green
Obj_arg5.Description: The green color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg6.Name: Gradient Type
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies on what parts of the view the fog should be applied on.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PostOutlineArea
Classes.Notes: An area that renders a thick outline around some edges while the player is inside it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Intensity
Obj_arg0.Description: Thickness and intensity of the outlines. Ranges from 0 to 255.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PowerStar
Classes.Notes: The main collectible in most levels. A Power Star usually represents one specific scenario. When collecting it, a short cutscene will be played. If this is a Grand Star and the current galaxy is VsKoopaLv3Galaxy, Peach will appear during the Star Get cutscene.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The scenario to which this Power Star belongs. Should be a valid ID.

Obj_arg1.Name: Appearance Gravity?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, gravity will affect how the Power Star moves during its appearance cutscene.

Obj_arg2.Name: Ignores Gravity?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, its pose won't be affected by gravity and is instead specified by the initial rotation.

Obj_arg3.Name: Elliptic Cylinder Shadow?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, an elliptic cylinder will be used as its shadow model instead of an ellipsoid.

Obj_arg4.Name: Appear Nearest Point?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the Power Star will appear at the PowerStarAppearPoint closest to the player. Otherwise, the Power Star's original position will be used if the player is closer to it than to the other points.

Obj_arg5.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg5.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Used to group this object with other PowerStarAppearPoint instances. If the Power Star appears, it will spawn at the instance that the player is closest to. Limit is 16 objects per group. This does not work when spawned after defeating most bosses or after collecting all Purple Coins.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Values.Value: スターゲットデモ座標
Values.Notes: Optional placement for its Star Get cutscene

Camera.Description: Used when the Power Star appears.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. It can use two special cutscene nerves for the cutscenes ミニ太陽消失 and グランドスター復活.

MirrorActor.Description: A mirrored version of this object is created for mirror reflection setups if placed inside a MirrorArea.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. Only supported in HoneyBeeVillageGalaxy2, MokumokuValleyGalaxy2, TwisterTowerGalaxy3 and UndergroundDangeonGalaxy2.

Classes.Name: PowerStarAppearPoint
Classes.Notes: A spawn point where a grouped Power Star can appear. The spawn point that the player is closest to will be used for appearance.

Group.Description: Used to group this and other instances to a specific Power Star. Limit is 16 objects per group.

Camera.Description: Used when the Power Star appears at this point.

Classes.Name: PowerStarHalo
Classes.Notes: A large decorative light that is meant to be placed around a Power Star. It will disappear if the player is close enough, however, it will reappear again if the player leaves the disappearance range again.

Obj_arg0.Name: Disappearance Range
Obj_arg0.Description: The range in which it will disappear divided by 100. Default is 70.

Obj_arg1.Name: Don't Appear During Intro?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it won't appear during the intro cutscene of a level.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: PrepareKoopaFinalDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers several objects that appear during the cutscene before entering Bowser's Galaxy Generator. The individual models that it creates are Meister, TicoBaby, and MiniVsKoopaLv3Galaxy.

DemoCast.Description: Registers to the cutscene named クッパ最終戦突入. It has a cutscene functor action which causes a white screen fade.

Message.Description: The text to be displayed can be found in SceneCommonMessage.arc/StoryBook.msbt. The text goes by the prefix DemoKoopaCastle.

Classes.Name: PriorDrawAir
Classes.Notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. It gets rendered before many other objects.

Obj_arg0.Name: Range
Obj_arg0.Description: Active distance from player's position.

Obj_arg1.Name: Hide during Intro?
Obj_arg1.Description: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

Obj_arg2.Name: Always Active?
Obj_arg2.Description: Always active if enabled.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_B.Description: Disappears if activated, reappears if deactivated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Appears if 消滅 action gets triggered.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: ProjectionMapAir
Classes.Notes: Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section. The model uses a projection map matrix.

Obj_arg0.Name: Range
Obj_arg0.Description: Active distance from player's position.

Obj_arg1.Name: Hide during Intro?
Obj_arg1.Description: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

Obj_arg2.Name: Always Active?
Obj_arg2.Description: Always active if enabled.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_B.Description: Disappears if activated, reappears if deactivated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Appears if 消滅 action gets triggered.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: ProjectionMapSky
Classes.Notes: A decorative background model that is meant to be placed around entire galaxies. It follows the camera's position, so it's not possible for the player to reach the end of the model, unlike atmosphere objects. Furthermore, the model uses a projection map matrix.

Obj_arg0.Name: Mirror Reflection Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to use a reflection model or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: Pukupuku
Classes.Notes: A fish enemy that swims on a set path if placed underwater or hops around a path if placed elsewhere. It can be defeated through all player attacks, which causes it to drop a Coin or three Star Bits when defeated.

Point_arg0.Name: Jump Type
Point_arg0.Description: How it jumps and moves on this point. Default is -1.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: PukupukuWaterSurface
Classes.Notes: A fish enemy that swims on the surface of the water area it's inside. When it touches ice collision, it will be frozen to ice. It can be defeated through all player attacks, which causes it to drop a Coin or three Star Bits when defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invalidate Shadow?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, its shadow will be invalidated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PullBackArea
Classes.Notes: An area that returns the player to the last safe position they stood on before entering this area.  The game won't treat Ice and GlassIce collision as proper safe collision triangles, however, this can be enabled with a RecoveryFloorControlArea.

Obj_arg0.Name: Throw Type
Obj_arg0.Description: If used, the player will be thrown out instead of returning to the previous safe collision triangle. This setting is only usable by cylindrical areas. All other shapes will return the player to the previous safe collision triangle.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: PullTargetBridge
Classes.Notes: An object that can be targeted and pulled with Yoshi's tongue, which causes the object to fall. Unfortunately, there is no object with a proper model that uses this class anymore.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and pulled by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PullTargetDrawer
Classes.Notes: A block that can be pulled out using Yoshi's tongue by targeting its handle.

Obj_arg0.Name: Pull Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: How far the block moves when pulled. Depending on the model's shape, this may be glitchy. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Retract Timer
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it takes before the block retracts again. Default is -1, which disables the timer.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after pulling out the block.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and pulled by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: PunchBox
Classes.Notes: A Brick Block that can be destroyed through all player attacks. It may drop a Coin when destroyed. However, when destroyed through SW_A, it drops one Star Bit.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be dropped. Default is 1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies whether to use a shadow or not.

SW_A.Description: Destroys the block once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: PunchingKinoko
Classes.Notes: A bubbly plant that the player can fling around to damage other objects and enemies. However, if it hits the player, they will lose a lot of Star Bits. If placed inside a ClipDrawArea in SMG2, it will be shrunken down and unusable. When Bulb Yoshi's light surrounds the plant, it will grow back to its usable size.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.

SW_B.Description: Kills the object once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and flung (SMG2 only) by player 2.

Classes.Name: PurpleCoinCompleteWatcher
Classes.Notes: A controller that activates a switch once 100 Purple Coins have been collected.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting 100 Purple Coins.

Classes.Name: Pyudon
Classes.Notes: A flying bird enemy that smacks onto the player if they walk under it. It can be defeated by stomping, Ground Pounds, Spin Attacks or by having Yoshi eat it, which causes it to drop a Coin or three Star Bits.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will stay passive while the switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: QuestionCoin
Classes.Notes: A large collectable Coin that can activate a switch when collected. It can also make the player jump when collected. The object's up vector is used as the player's jumping direction.

Obj_arg0.Name: Player Jump Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: If set to a positive value, the player will jump after collecting it. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Player Jump Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how the player jumps when collecting the Coin.

Obj_arg2.Name: Rotation Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Defines how to rotate the object.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Length Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Unlike most shadow length settings, this one only supports a fixed set of length values.

Obj_arg4.Name: Updates Shadow?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the player jumps.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 1000 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Classes.Name: QuicksandPlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and collision. It is meant to use collision triangles with AreaMove and/or RailMove floor codes. RailMove only works if the object is connected to a path. If the player stands on these triangles, a moving sand sound effect will be played. It may use two animations called "Move" and "Reverse"; the former would be played by default.

Obj_arg3.Name: Reverse?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the "Reverse" animation will be played if it exists.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Used for the pushing direction for RailMove collision.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: Rabbit
Classes.Notes: A cute rabbit NPC that can be talked to.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg1.Description: How it behaves.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Rabbit%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: RaceRail
Classes.Notes: Lays out the rough layout of a race mini-game.

Path_arg0.Name: Race ID
Path_arg0.Description: The race's internal ID. Default is 0.

Path_arg7.Name: Goal Radius
Path_arg7.Description: The valid goal point range. Default is 650.

Point_arg0.Name: Requires Pass?
Point_arg0.Description: If set, this point needs to be passed by the player.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: Lays out the rough course of the race.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: レース開始時マリオ位置
Values.Notes: Player's position at the race's start

Camera.Description: Used when the race stars.

Classes.Name: RailAndRotateMoveObj
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that usually moves on a set path and rotates along one of its axes. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RotatorRotateStart, RotatorRotateLoop, RotatorStopAtEnd, RotatorStopAtEndLoop, RotatorRotateSignStart, RotatorRotateSignLoop, RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animations Move and RailMoveSign; the latter would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior. Lastly, it can also use the stage effects Start, Moving, and Stop.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point
Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: RailCoin
Classes.Notes: Creates a group of Coins (RailCoin) or Purple Coins (PurpleRailCoin) that are arranged on a path. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be created. Default is 8.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Coins will disappear again. Default is -1, which makes the Coins appear indefinitely.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.

Obj_arg4.Name: Pose Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Defines how to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coins to the collision below in SMG2, although this feature is broken.

Values.Notes: Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity
Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity
Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

Obj_arg7.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg7.Description: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after collecting all Coins.

SW_B.Description: Causes all Coins to appear when activated and causes all Coins to disappear when it gets deactivated again.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path to place the Coins on.

MercatorTransform.Description: Can use Mercator projection for placement.

Camera.Description: Used when the Coins appear.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If its special action functor gets triggered, all Coins will appear.

Classes.Name: RailDemoMoveObj
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that usually moves on a set path. Once it starts moving, it plays a short camera cutscene. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animations Move and RailMoveSign; the latter would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior. Lastly, it can also use the stage effects Start, Moving, and Stop.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point
Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when the object starts moving.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the collision will be enabled if and only if this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object will move only while this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The rotation speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: RailMoveObjPress
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that usually moves on a set path. Unlike other variants, this one is hard-coded to be able to crush the player. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type

Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg2.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
Point_arg2.Description: How fast the object rotates. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Point_arg4.Name: Rotation Axis
Point_arg4.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg6.Name: Rotation Type
Point_arg6.Description: Specifies how the object rotates on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotate at point, pause path movement until finished
Rotate between this and next point, don't pause path movement

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 and Point_arg2 specify speed or time values.

Values.Notes: Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: RailSeesawMoveObj
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that usually moves on a set path and rotates when stepped on. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Some sound effects depend on the used rotation type. If RotateAxis is 0, the sounds are MapPartsSeesaw1AxisRotatorBound and MapPartsSeesaw1AxisRotatorMove. If RotateAxis is 1, the only sound is MapPartsRotateLoop. If RotateAxis is 2, the only sound is MapPartsSeesaw2AxisRollerRotatorMove. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animations Move and RailMoveSign; the latter would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior. Lastly, it can also use the stage effects Start, Moving, and Stop.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point
Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast it rotates. Default is 0. Only used if RotateAxis is 0.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many angles in degrees the platform rotates. Default is 0.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Type
RotateAxis.Description: How the platform moves when stepped on. Default corresponds to 1.

Rotate XZ plane, returns to original rotation

RotateAccelType.Description: Affects how long it will remain in motion. If RotateAxis is 0 or 1, it also affects how fast rotation will speed up. Default is 0.

RotateStopTime.Name: Restore Force
RotateStopTime.Description: The force used to restore its original rotation after getting of the platform. Only used if RotateAxis is 0 or 1.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: RandomEffectObj
Classes.Notes: A particles effect with a clipping radius of 1500 (SMG1) / 500 (SMG2) units and a far clipping distance of 400 (SMG1) / 50 (SMG2) meters. The particles will emit after a random amount of frames, where the randomization interval is [Obj_arg0 - Obj_arg1, Obj_arg0 + Obj_arg1]. The particle data needs to be specified in AutoEffectList, where UniqueName matches the object's name. It can also use sound effects. EffectEmitStart specifies the sound effect used when it starts functioning. EffectEmitting specifies the looping sound effect that is played while particles are emitting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Average Time
Obj_arg0.Description: The average time between emissions. Default is 600. In SMG2, this will also invert the cutscene function, meaning that the object will disappear if its cutscene action gets triggered.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Deviation
Obj_arg1.Description: The random time deviation. Default is 180.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will emit particles only if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups objects of the same kind, but the group is never used for anything.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: If used, it will start functioning once its cutscene action gets triggered. In SMG2, it will stop functioning if Obj_arg0 is set.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: RasterScrollArea
Classes.Notes: An area that creates a wobbly screen effect when the player enters it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Stretch Amplitude
Obj_arg0.Description: How intense the screen should be stretched.

Obj_arg1.Name: Stretch Height
Obj_arg1.Description: The vertical stretch factor.

Obj_arg2.Name: Stretch Width
Obj_arg2.Description: The horizontal stretch factor.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: RecoveryFloorControlArea
Classes.Notes: Normally, when the player falls into a PullBackArea, they won't be returned to the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision. Instead, the game treats several other collision types as safe rescuing positions. However, this area ignores the check for these two collision types so that these collision triangles are treated as proper rescuing positions.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: RedBlueTurnBlock
Classes.Notes: A platform that flips around when SW_A gets activated. If the switch gets deactivated again, the platform returns to its original placement.

SW_A.Description: Flips the platform when activated. When deactivated again, the platform returns to its original placement.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: RelayDrill2DPlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and collision whose collision is deactivated by default. Therefore, the collision has to be activated via SW_A when desired.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: Enables the collision once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: RepeatBlock
Classes.Notes: A set of small blocks that start out as a normal platform and begin to move like a snake when stepped on by the player. However, if no path was assigned, it won't move at all. The total length of blocks will be (Obj_arg3 + 1) * Obj_arg2. Another RepeatBlock instance can be linked to it, which ensures that all Snake Blocks move once stepped on.

Obj_arg0.Name: Block Width
Obj_arg0.Description: The width of blocks to be created. Default is 2.

Obj_arg1.Name: Block Height
Obj_arg1.Description: The height of blocks to be created. Default is 2.

Obj_arg2.Name: Block Depth
Obj_arg2.Description: The depth of blocks to be created. Default is 2.

Obj_arg3.Name: Trail Factor
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how long the trail of blocks to be created will be. Default is 3.

Obj_arg4.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg4.Description: The rate at which the blocks move. Default is 5.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Classes.Name: RepeatBlockShadowChangeArea
Classes.Notes: An area that changes into what direction the shadows of Snake Blocks point that move inside this area.

Obj_arg0.Name: Direction Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies into what direction the shadows point.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: RepeatTimerSwitch
Classes.Notes: A controller that activates and deactivates SW_A periodically. It will play a constant ticking noise.

Obj_arg0.Name: Activated Time
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it takes before SW_A gets deactivated again. Default is 60.

Obj_arg1.Name: Deactivated Time
Obj_arg1.Description: How long it takes before SW_A gets activated again. Matches Obj_arg0 by default.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The object will start to function when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated and deactivated periodically.

Classes.Name: RepeatTimerSwitchingBlock
Classes.Notes: A Beat Block platform whose visibility changes depending on the background music's beat. By default, the block will be visible, however, this can be inverted.

Obj_arg0.Name: Invisible Initially?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the block will be invisible initially.

Obj_arg1.Name: Fast Changes?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the block's visibility changes rapidly.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated if this block isn't visible; gets deactivated if this block is visible.

SW_B.Description: The block won't change if this switch is activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: RestartObj
Classes.Notes: A checkpoint flag that is used to change the player's respawn point once touched or attacked by them. The respawn point and the flag itself need to be in the same zone. The object attaches to nearby collision.

Obj_arg0.Name: Spawn Point ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the spawn point that the player should respawn at after activating this flag.

SW_A.Description: If used, the flag cannot be activated while this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and activated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: RingBeamer
Classes.Notes: A spiked mechanical enemy that emits circular shockwaves that electrocute the player upon contact. It is stationary and cannot be destroyed through any means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Ring Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the individual rings grow. Default is 20.

Obj_arg1.Name: Ring Duration
Obj_arg1.Description: The lifetime of an individual ring before it disappears. Default is 100.

Obj_arg2.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg2.Description: The color frame to be used by the individual rings.

SW_A.Description: It remains passive while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: It will become passive after activating this switch.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: If one Ring Beamer in this group emits a ring, all the other Ring Beamers will do so as well.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: RisePictureBookPlanet
Classes.Notes: A special pop-up book planet that can ascend and descend again. It also consists of two Blue Flames that are attached to the planet. The flames burn the player and compatible objects upon contact.

SW_A.Description: If activated, the pop-up book ascends; if deactivated, the pop-up book descends.

Classes.Name: RockBreakCage
Classes.Notes: An obstacle that requires two hits dealt with the Rock power-up to be destroyed.

Classes.Name: RockCreator
Classes.Notes: A spawner that creates rolling boulders. The boulders can be destroyed by attacking the red crystal part, however, fireballs don't work. When using the Rock or Rainbow power-ups, the player doesn't have to attack the crystal specifically.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rolling Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it rolls. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The delay in seconds between the spawns. If non-positive, only one instance will spawn. Default is -1.

Obj_arg2.Name: Break at Last Point?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, it will break once it reaches the last path point.

Obj_arg3.Name: Path Roll Time
Obj_arg3.Description: The time in frames that it rolls on the path before falling down. Default is 45.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg5.Name: Decelerate When Attacked?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, it will decelerate and accelerate again when it successfully damaged an object, such as the player.

Point_arg0.Name: Fall Type
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies how it rolls at this point.

Point_arg1.Name: Path Movement Type
Point_arg1.Description: Specifies how the movement is affected by the path.

Values.Notes: Moves along path starting from this point

Point_arg2.Name: Follow Tangent?
Point_arg2.Description: If set, it will follow the path's tangent until this point has been reached.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The boulders will appear when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Stops spawning more boulders once activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the boulders roll on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: RockReflector
Classes.Notes: A fence that rebounds the player when they roll into it with the Rock power-up.

Classes.Name: RollingWaterBreakArea
Classes.Notes: An area that will cause Rolling Water Bubbles without a path to pop when entered.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: RollingWaterCreator
Classes.Notes: Creates rolling water bubbles that trap the player upon contact. The bubbles can move on a set path or roll around with the help of gravity. Bubbles that don't move on a path will pop once they enter a RollingWaterBreakArea.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the bubbles move on the path. Default is 15.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: Delay in seconds before another bubble appears. Default is 5.

Obj_arg2.Name: Bubble Duration
Obj_arg2.Description: Life duration of a single bubble. Default is 10. Only works if no path is assigned.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the player is inside a bubble. Gets deactivated when the player leaves a bubble again.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and popped by player 2.

Classes.Name: Rosetta (SMG2)
Classes.Notes: The mother of all Lumas, Rosalina. There's some unfinished functionality for registering a Power Star, but it's not possible to use this without code modifications.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: RotateHammerPressure
Classes.Notes: A large rotating hammer that can crush the player. Due to the way its shadows are set up, it usually has a rotation angle of 90 degrees. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RotateMoveObjStart, RotateMoveObjMove, RotateMoveObjStop, Appear, RotatorRotateStart, RotatorRotateLoop, RotatorStopAtEnd, RotatorStopAtEndLoop, RotatorRotateSignStart, and RotatorRotateSignLoop. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) as well as texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations. Lastly, it can also use the stage effects Start, Moving, and Stop.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Up & Side Shadows?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the UpShadow and SideShadow shadows will be invalidated.

Obj_arg3.Name: Invert Push Collision Up Vector?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the push collision's up vector will be inverted.

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

Classes.Name: RotateSeesawTrampoline
Classes.Notes: A seesaw-like platform that rotates when stepped on. Unlike SimpleSeesawObj, it uses two particle effects named Wait and Move that won't be rotated. It supports three rotation modes. Furthermore, it can use optional sound effects. If RotateAxis is 0, the sounds are MapPartsSeesaw1AxisRotatorBound and MapPartsSeesaw1AxisRotatorMove. If RotateAxis is 1, the only sound is MapPartsRotateLoop. If RotateAxis is 2, the only sound is MapPartsSeesaw2AxisRollerRotatorMove.

RotateStopTime.Name: Restore Force
RotateStopTime.Description: The force used to restore its original rotation after getting of the platform. Only used if RotateAxis is 0 or 1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: SamboHead
Classes.Notes: A green flower enemy that hides in the ground and hops out if the player is nearby. It hops towards the player to damage them. It can be defeated by most of the player's attack. If the player is too far away, it will hide in the ground again.

Obj_arg0.Name: Doesn't Hide Again?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it won't hide in the ground when the player is too far away from it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only come out of the ground if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

Classes.Name: SandBird
Classes.Notes: A platform consisting of various smaller chunks. The chunks are SandBirdParts objects that have to be linked to this object. If no path is assigned, the platform won't move at all. If a path is assigned, it will start moving once the player steps on one of the blocks.

Obj_arg0.Name: Default Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 6.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Point_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves from this point.

Rail.Description: The path that it can move on.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: SandBirdParts
Classes.Notes: A platform chunk to be used by the SandBird object that it is linked to. When hit by an enemy's fireballs, explosions, crushing attacks or fling attacks, it will disappear for a while.

Obj_arg0.Name: Respawn Delay
Obj_arg0.Description: The time in frames before it reappears again. Default is 100.

Classes.Name: Sandstorm
Classes.Notes: A sandstorm enemy that moves on a path. Sucks the player in once they get in its range. If the player shakes their Wiimote, they will be launched into the air. SunakazeKun may use two spiky rock obstacles to defend itself.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Rock Obstacles?
Obj_arg0.Description: Enables the two spiky rock obstacles if set.

Obj_arg1.Name: Use White Color?
Obj_arg1.Description: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.

SW_A.Description: Activated while the player is inside the sandstorm.

Rail.Description: Specifies the movement path.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when player gets launched.

Classes.Name: Sandy
Classes.Notes: A strange boss that throws large sand boulders or bombs to attack the player. Sometimes, it opens its large mouth which the player needs to attack with fireballs in order to defeat it. During the second phase, it creates two large cannons that shoot more obstacles. Once defeated, it will spawn a Power Star. However, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. If SW_APPEAR is not used, the boss battle will start immediately.

SW_APPEAR.Description: If used, the boss battle will start once this switch gets activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated during the cutscene that plays after defeating it.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Player2Targetable.Description: Its projectiles can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: ScenarioStarter
Classes.Notes: The controller that sets up the fly-in path sequence for a Star mission. Once the mission starts, the player will fly along the path. In SMG2, the player will be positioned at the start of the path during the intro cutscene. However, in SMG1, a GeneralPos has to be used.

Obj_arg0.Name: Flight Time
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it takes to complete the flight. Default 300.

Obj_arg3.Name: Camera Count
Obj_arg3.Description: The number of event cameras to be used during the flight.

Obj_arg5.Name: Player Rotation
Obj_arg5.Description: The initial rotation of the player used before the player gets launched. This also affects the angle at which the player lands.

Rail.Description: The path that the player will fly along.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: スタートカメラマリオ座標

Camera.Description: Used when flying. Multiple camera configurations can be used, the count needs to be specified by Obj_arg3, though.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SceneChangeArea
Classes.Notes: An area that ends the current scene and makes the Star Select screen for Sky Station Galaxy (IslandFleetGalaxy) appear.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ScoreAttackCounter
Classes.Notes: Specifies the minimum score and the time limit for scoring missions and keeps track of the player's actual score.

Obj_arg0.Name: Required Score
Obj_arg0.Description: The required score. Default is 5000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg1.Description: The time limit in seconds. Default is 180.

Classes.Name: ScoreAttackMan
Classes.Notes: The monkey NPC who will prompt the player to play a scoring mini-game where one has to score a lot of points. The scoring controller (ScoreAttackCounter) that specifies the minimum score and time limit needs to be added as a separate object. It will register a Power Star, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. It will use the player spawn point with MarioNo set to 1 when restarting the mini-game.

Obj_arg0.Name: Notice Player Range
Obj_arg0.Description: The range in which it talks to the player automatically. Default is 800.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Gets deactivated after the mini-game. Alternatively, it can be activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Camera.Description: 呼び止め is used when he calls for the player. 再セット会話 is used when talking to the player.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: Its dialogue sequence is part of SceneCommonMessage, meaning that there is no need to set it up individually.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Replace number variable with high score
Replace number variable with minimum score

AnimeFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for AnimeFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: ScrewSwitch
Classes.Notes: A blue screw that can be screwed into its base by using a Spin Attack on it. After that, it will activate a switch. It will be connected to the collision below.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after spinning.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: ScrewSwitchReverse
Classes.Notes: A yellow screw that can be removed by using a Spin Attack on it. After that, it will activate a switch, and it will try to make the player jump off.

Obj_arg0.Name: Force Jump?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will force the player to jump off the screw after it disappears.

Obj_arg7.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg7.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after spinning.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SeaGullGroup
Classes.Notes: A group of several decorative seagulls. All seagulls will be placed along the specified path, however, the seagulls will not fly along the path. The number of seagulls to be spawned can be specified as well. If the object is SeaGullGroupMarioFace, the seagulls will appear only if the current world that the player resides in is World 1, World 2 or World S.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Seagulls
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of seagulls in the group. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Disable Sounds?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, the seagulls won't emit any sound effects.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The seagulls will appear when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the seagulls move on.

Classes.Name: SearchBeamer
Classes.Notes: A stationary robotic enemy that shoots lasers to attack the player. It won't be able to shoot any lasers if the player stands on its head.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it rotates. Default is 8.

Obj_arg1.Name: Attacking Range
Obj_arg1.Description: The active range in which it will attack the player. Default is 1000.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will attack only if this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: SecretGate
Classes.Notes: A gate that can be passed through. If the player is "riding" another object, such as the Rock power-up's Rolling Rock, Star Balls or Tube Slides, the object sets that it has been passed through. This object is usually linked to a proper SecretGateCounter instance which checks whether all gates have been passed through.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything. Default is 500.

Obj_arg1.Name: Vertical Particle Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: How far up from the object's position to emit the particle effects. Default is 600.

Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Vertical Particle Offset?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the particle effect won't be offset, which renders Obj_arg1 useless.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg3.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when passing through the gate.

Classes.Name: SecretGateCounter
Classes.Notes: Registers and observes SecretGate objects. It will display the number of passed gates and play a short jingle every time the player passes a gate. The object itself does not activate any switches, however, the individual gates do.

Classes.Name: ShadowColorArea
Classes.Notes: An area that can be used to change the color of all object shadows when entered by the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Red
Obj_arg0.Description: The red color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive.

Obj_arg1.Name: Green
Obj_arg1.Description: The green color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive.

Obj_arg2.Name: Blue
Obj_arg2.Description: The blue color component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: ShadowFarClipCtrlArea
Classes.Notes: An area that can be used to overwrite the galaxy's shadow far clipping settings when entered by the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Far Clipping Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The far clipping distance to be used for all shadows. Default is 7000 or the value provided by the galaxy's ShadowControllerParam file.

Obj_arg1.Name: Enable Far Clipping?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, far clipping will be enabled for all shadows.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Shellfish
Classes.Notes: A stationary clam enemy that opens and closes its valves periodically. Usually, it contains an item inside that the player can collect. It may damage the player by closing its valves. The game supports variants containing a Coin or a Star Chip. The class also contains code for ShellfishBlueChip and ShellfishKinokoOneUp who contain a Blue Chip and a 1-Up Mushroom, respectively. However, the 1-Up Mushroom variant does not work properly as the item is always invisible. When hit with a Koopa Shell, it will open its valves and become stunned for a few seconds.

Obj_arg0.Name: Chip Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of Chip Group that the Chip belongs to.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: ShootingStar
Classes.Notes: A shooting star that releases Star Bits when it hits the ground. It will periodically reappear until all of its Star Bits have been collected.

Obj_arg0.Name: Star Bits per Iteration
Obj_arg0.Description: How many Star Bits should be released at max per iteration. Default is 5.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The spawn delay of the individual shooting stars in seconds. Default is 240.

Obj_arg2.Name: Falling Distance
Obj_arg2.Description: From how far up it will fall down. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Number of Total Star Bits
Obj_arg3.Description: How many Star Bits can appear in total. Default is 5.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SignBoard
Classes.Notes: A generic signboard that acts like an NPC, meaning that the player can read it or talk to it.

Obj_arg0.Name: 2P Mode Type
Obj_arg0.Description: If set to 0, the object will be hidden during single-player. During 2P mode, the object will pop up.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated. If used along with Obj_arg0, the object will appear if this switch is activated and if 2P mode is active.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is SignBoard%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

Classes.Name: SimpleBreakableCollisionObj
Classes.Notes: A basic object that can be destroyed through various means. Unlike other variants, it comes with an additional collision mesh named Break that will be used after destroying it. The supported methods to destroy a certain object are hard-coded. It needs the animation Break.bck that will be used when the object gets destroyed. In addition, it also supports an optional visibility animation called Break.bva. Finally, it may use sound or particle effects when it gets destroyed. These go by the names MapObjActorBreak and Break, respectively.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

Obj_arg3.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg3.Description: The kind of item to spawn when destroyed.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after destroying the object. Although the game reads this value, the jingle functionality has been removed in SMG2.

Obj_arg5.Name: Cutscene Breaking Delay
Obj_arg5.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before the object gets destroyed when its cutscene is playing. Default is 60.

Obj_arg6.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg6.Description: The number of items to spawn when destroyed. Default is 1 for Coins and 5 for Star Bits.

Obj_arg7.Name: SW_DEAD Activation Delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before SW_DEAD gets activated. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.
