SW_A.Description: If used, the object cannot be destroyed while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: Destroys the object once triggered.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: If Obj_arg3 is set to 3, this object will spawn a Power Star when destroyed.

Camera.Description: Used when destroying the object.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action destroys it once triggered.

Classes.Name: SimpleBreakableDeleteShadowObj
Classes.Notes: A basic object that can be destroyed through various means. Unlike other variants, its shadows will be invalidated after destroying it. The supported methods to destroy a certain object are hard-coded. It needs the animation Break.bck that will be used when the object gets destroyed. In addition, it also supports an optional visibility animation called Break.bva. Finally, it may use sound or particle effects when it gets destroyed. These go by the names MapObjActorBreak and Break, respectively.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

Obj_arg3.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg3.Description: The kind of item to spawn when destroyed.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after destroying the object. Although the game reads this value, the jingle functionality has been removed in SMG2.

Obj_arg5.Name: Cutscene Breaking Delay
Obj_arg5.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before the object gets destroyed when its cutscene is playing. Default is 60.

Obj_arg6.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg6.Description: The number of items to spawn when destroyed. Default is 1 for Coins and 5 for Star Bits.

Obj_arg7.Name: SW_DEAD Activation Delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before SW_DEAD gets activated. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object cannot be destroyed while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: Destroys the object once triggered.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: If Obj_arg3 is set to 3, this object will spawn a Power Star when destroyed.

Camera.Description: Used when destroying the object.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action destroys it once triggered.

Classes.Name: SimpleBreakableIndirectObj
Classes.Notes: A basic object that can be destroyed through various means. Unlike other variants, it registers to the indirect map object draw buffer. The supported methods to destroy a certain object are hard-coded. It needs the animation Break.bck that will be used when the object gets destroyed. In addition, it also supports an optional visibility animation called Break.bva. Finally, it may use sound or particle effects when it gets destroyed. These go by the names MapObjActorBreak and Break, respectively.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

Obj_arg3.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg3.Description: The kind of item to spawn when destroyed.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after destroying the object. Although the game reads this value, the jingle functionality has been removed in SMG2.

Obj_arg5.Name: Cutscene Breaking Delay
Obj_arg5.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before the object gets destroyed when its cutscene is playing. Default is 60.

Obj_arg6.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg6.Description: The number of items to spawn when destroyed. Default is 1 for Coins and 5 for Star Bits.

Obj_arg7.Name: SW_DEAD Activation Delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before SW_DEAD gets activated. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object cannot be destroyed while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: Destroys the object once triggered.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: If Obj_arg3 is set to 3, this object will spawn a Power Star when destroyed.

Camera.Description: Used when destroying the object.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action destroys it once triggered.

Classes.Name: SimpleBreakableObj
Classes.Notes: A basic object that can be destroyed through various means. However, the supported methods to destroy a certain object are hard-coded. It needs the animation Break.bck that will be used when the object gets destroyed. In addition, it also supports an optional visibility animation called Break.bva. Finally, it may use sound or particle effects when it gets destroyed. These go by the names MapObjActorBreak and Break, respectively.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

Obj_arg3.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg3.Description: The kind of item to spawn when destroyed.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after destroying the object. Although the game reads this value, the jingle functionality has been removed in SMG2.

Obj_arg5.Name: Cutscene Breaking Delay
Obj_arg5.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before the object gets destroyed when its cutscene is playing. Default is 60.

Obj_arg6.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg6.Description: The number of items to spawn when destroyed. Default is 1 for Coins and 5 for Star Bits.

Obj_arg7.Name: SW_DEAD Activation Delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before SW_DEAD gets activated. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object cannot be destroyed while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: Destroys the object once triggered.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: If Obj_arg3 is set to 3, this object will spawn a Power Star when destroyed.

Camera.Description: Used when destroying the object.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action destroys it once triggered.

Classes.Name: SimpleBreakableStrongLightObj
Classes.Notes: A basic object that can be destroyed through various means. Unlike other variants, it gets rendered after most other objects. The supported methods to destroy a certain object are hard-coded. It needs the animation Break.bck that will be used when the object gets destroyed. In addition, it also supports an optional visibility animation called Break.bva. Finally, it may use sound or particle effects when it gets destroyed. These go by the names MapObjActorBreak and Break, respectively.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

Obj_arg3.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg3.Description: The kind of item to spawn when destroyed.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after destroying the object. Although the game reads this value, the jingle functionality has been removed in SMG2.

Obj_arg5.Name: Cutscene Breaking Delay
Obj_arg5.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before the object gets destroyed when its cutscene is playing. Default is 60.

Obj_arg6.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg6.Description: The number of items to spawn when destroyed. Default is 1 for Coins and 5 for Star Bits.

Obj_arg7.Name: SW_DEAD Activation Delay
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before SW_DEAD gets activated. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the object cannot be destroyed while this switch is not activated.

SW_B.Description: Destroys the object once triggered.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: If Obj_arg3 is set to 3, this object will spawn a Power Star when destroyed.

Camera.Description: Used when destroying the object.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action destroys it once triggered.

Classes.Name: SimpleClipPartsObj
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that can be clipped in a Matter Splatter setup. It can also move on a path and rotate along its own axes. It can use optional sound effects whose names are self-explanatory: RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn, RotatorRotateStart, RotatorRotateLoop, RotatorStopAtEnd, RotatorStopAtEndLoop, RotatorRotateSignStart, and RotatorRotateSignLoop. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animation RailMoveSign that would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior.

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: If used, the collision will be enabled if and only if this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object will move only while this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The rotation speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: SimpleDemoExecutor
Classes.Notes: Starts a simple cutscene using just a camera.

Obj_arg1.Name: SW_A Activation Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames that has to elapse before SW_A gets activated. Default is 60.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Starts the cutscene once activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated once the cutscene starts.

Camera.Description: Used when the cutscene is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SimpleEnvironmentObj
Classes.Notes: Decorative objects that are meant to be placed in the background of a galaxy, such as asteroids. It also supports an optional Bloom model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: SimpleFloaterObj
Classes.Notes: A platform that sinks when the player steps on it. Once the player gets off of this platform, it rises up again. It can also use optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: MapPartsFloaterMoveUpEnd, MapPartsFloaterRidden, MapPartsFloaterMoveDown, and MapPartsFloaterMoveUp. Furthermore, it can use effects with the name Ripple that will appear at the object's original position.

MoveConditionType.Name: Sinking Distance
MoveConditionType.Description: How far it can sink when stepped on. Default is 0.

RotateSpeed.Name: Sinking Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast it sinks when stepped on. Default is 0.

RotateAngle.Name: Rising Speed
RotateAngle.Description: How fast it rises up again. Default is 0.

RotateAxis.Name: Spring Bounce Speed
RotateAxis.Description: How fast the spring motion is. Only used if RotateAccelType is 1. Default is RotateAngle multiplied by 0.001.

RotateAccelType.Name: Motion Type
RotateAccelType.Description: How it moves when stepped on. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: If RotateAccelType is 1 and this switch is activated, the platform won't move.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SimpleMapObj
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SimpleMapObjFarMax
Classes.Notes: A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and a maximum far clipping distance. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SimpleMapObjPush
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and optional collision whose sensors push the player away. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SimpleMapObjWithEffect
Classes.Notes:
A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: SimpleSeesawObj
Classes.Notes: A seesaw-like platform that rotates when stepped on. It supports two (SMG1) / three (SMG2) rotation modes. Furthermore, it can use optional sound effects. If RotateAxis is 0, the sounds are MapPartsSeesaw1AxisRotatorBound and MapPartsSeesaw1AxisRotatorMove. If RotateAxis is 1, the only sound is MapPartsRotateLoop. If RotateAxis is 2, the only sound is MapPartsSeesaw2AxisRollerRotatorMove.

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast it rotates. Default is 0. Only used if RotateAxis is 0.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many angles in degrees the platform rotates. Default is 0.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Type
RotateAxis.Description: How the platform moves when stepped on. Default corresponds to 1.

Values.Notes: Rotate around Z axis, returns to original rotation
Rotate XZ plane, returns to original rotation

RotateAccelType.Name: Inertia Factor / Acceleration
RotateAccelType.Description: Affects how long it will remain in motion. If RotateAxis is 0 or 1, it also affects how fast rotation will speed up. Default is 0.

RotateStopTime.Name: Restore Force
RotateStopTime.Description: The force used to restore its original rotation after getting of the platform. Only used if RotateAxis is 0 or 1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: SimpleTextureSwitchChangeObj
Classes.Notes: A variant of SimpleMapObj that starts the TexChange.btk animation and freezes its frame at 1 once its SW_A gets activated. Like SimpleMapObj, this is a generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv). Lastly, it also supports an optional Bloom model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

Obj_arg1.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg1.Description: If TexChange.btp/.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_A.Description: Applies frame 1 of the TexChange.btk animation.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: Sky
Classes.Notes: A decorative background model that is meant to be placed around entire galaxies. It follows the camera's position, so it's not possible for the player to reach the end of the model, unlike atmosphere objects.

Obj_arg0.Name: Mirror Reflection Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to use a reflection model or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_B.Description: If used and activated, the sky model will disappear and the SpaceInner model will be used instead. If the switch gets deactivated again, SpaceInner disappears and the original sky model will reappear.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SlopeRunningCancelArea
Classes.Notes: The player's running movement will be immediately stopped if they touch a steep surface inside this area.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SmallStone
Classes.Notes: A circle of eight smaller objects that can be released from the ground by using a Spin Attack while inside the circle. Each chunk will spawn a Star Bit when released. The chunks attach to the nearest collision below them. If no collision is available, the individual plant may be placed at the origin of the galaxy.

Obj_arg0.Name: Y Offset
Obj_arg0.Description: The Y offset added to every chunk's Y coordinate. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Ignore Gravity?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, gravity will be ignored when placing the object. Instead, the object's placement rotation will be used.

Obj_arg2.Name: Show Splash Particles?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the Star Bits will emit a water splash effect if they appear in water.

Classes.Name: SmokeEffectColorArea
Classes.Notes: An area that changes the primary and environment colors of the player's running dust cloud particles when entered.

Obj_arg0.Name: Primary Red
Obj_arg0.Description: The primary color's red component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg1.Name: Primary Green
Obj_arg1.Description: The primary color's green component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg2.Name: Primary Blue
Obj_arg2.Description: The primary color's blue component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg3.Name: Environment Red
Obj_arg3.Description: The environment color's red component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg4.Name: Environment Green
Obj_arg4.Description: The environment color's green component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

Obj_arg5.Name: Environment Blue
Obj_arg5.Description: The environment color's blue component. Ranges from 0 to 255 inclusive. Default is 255.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Snakehead
Classes.Notes: An eel enemy that usually lurks at a fixed position. It will move along its path when the player comes near. It can be defeated using Koopa Shells. When defeated, the small variant spawns eight Star Bits whereas the large variant spawns a 1-Up Mushroom.

Obj_arg0.Name: Forwards Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves forwards. Default is 15.

Obj_arg1.Name: Backwards Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: The rate at which it moves backwards. Default is 10.

Obj_arg2.Name: Activation Range
Obj_arg2.Description: The valid distance to the player in which it becomes active. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg3.Description: How it moves along the path. Default is 0.

Values.Notes: Lurks and moves when player is nearby

Obj_arg4.Name: Invalidate Shadow?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, its shadow will be invalidated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on. The path should NOT be closed.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 300 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: SnowBall
Classes.Notes: A snowball that can be rolled by walking against it or by hitting it with a Spin Attack. It will become bigger when rolling it through snow, but it shrinks down otherwise. It can also be used to attack various enemies and destroy some obstacles.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and hit by player 2.

Classes.Name: SnowDollKoopa
Classes.Notes: A large snow statue of Bowser that can be destroyed with by hitting it twice with various player attacks, such as snowballs and fireballs. It may spawn a Power Star if the object and Scenario entry are configured correctly.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Snowballs
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of snowballs that will appear when destroying it.

Obj_arg2.Name: Play Riddle SFX?
Obj_arg2.Description: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.

Obj_arg3.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg3.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. -1 does not register a Power Star.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SnowMan
Classes.Notes: A snowman consisting of two parts that can be melted with fireballs. Depending on the melted parts, several switches can be activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated when both parts are melted.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the head or body is melted.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated when the body part is melted.

Classes.Name: SnowMound
Classes.Notes: A snow obstacle that can be destroyed with various player attacks, such as snowballs and fireballs.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Snowballs
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of snowballs that will appear when destroying it.

Obj_arg2.Name: Use Dead Tree?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, a dead snow tree will appear once this object is destroyed.

Classes.Name: SoundEmitterCube
Classes.Notes: A cube-shaped area that plays a sound effect. The closer the player is to the area, the louder the sound effect gets. In SMG2, the sound effects that can be played are specified in ActionSound.bcsv. More sound effects can be easily added by editing said file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Sound Effect ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The sound effect to be played. Sound effects 4 and above were added in SMG2.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sound Position
Obj_arg1.Description: The point to use for calculating stereo sounds.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SoundEmitterCubeWorldMapSync
Classes.Notes: A cube-shaped area that plays a sound effect when the player is in the specified world. The closer the player is to the area, the louder the sound effect gets. It uses the exact same sound effects as SoundEmitterCube.

Obj_arg0.Name: Sound Effect ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The sound effect to be played. Sound effects 4 and above were added in SMG2.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sound Position
Obj_arg1.Description: The point to use for calculating stereo sounds.

Obj_arg7.Name: World ID
Obj_arg7.Description: The ID of the world that the player has to be in to play the sound effect.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SoundEmitterPoint
Classes.Notes: A point in space that emits a sound effect. The sound effects that can be played are specified in ActionSound.bcsv. More sound effects can be easily added by editing said file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Sound Effect ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The sound effect to be played.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sound Position
Obj_arg1.Description: The point to use for calculating stereo sounds.

Obj_arg2.Name: Cutscene Functionality
Obj_arg2.Description: Determines what cutscenes the object registers to.

Values.Notes: Sound effect plays during all cutscenes
Sound effect plays during specific story cutscenes

Obj_arg3.Name: SW_A Setting
Obj_arg3.Description: How SW_A functions.

Values.Notes: SW_A starts the sound effect if SW_APPEAR is used and not activated

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If Obj_arg3 is -1, the emitter will be killed once activated. If Obj_arg3 is 0, the sound effect will start playing if SW_APPEAR is used and not activated.

Rail.Description: If used, the entire path emits the sound effect.

DemoCast.Description: If Obj_arg2 is set to 1, it will try to register to the cutscenes with the names ピーチからの手紙, ベビチコ出会い, ピーチ誘拐, スピンドライバ初出, クッパ最終戦突入, ノーマルエンディング１, ノーマルエンディング２, ノーマルエンディング３ and ノーマルエンディング４.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: If Obj_arg2 is set to -1, Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SoundEmitterSphere
Classes.Notes: A spherical area that plays a sound effect. The closer the player is to the area, the louder the sound effect gets. In SMG2, the sound effects that can be played are specified in ActionSound.bcsv. More sound effects can be easily added by editing said file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Sound Effect ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The sound effect to be played. Sound effects 6 and above were added in SMG2.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sound Position
Obj_arg1.Description: The point to use for calculating stereo sounds.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SoundPlayArea
Classes.Notes: An area that starts playing a sound effect when entered. The sound effects that can be played are specified in ActionSound.bcsv. More sound effects can be easily added by editing said file.

Obj_arg0.Name: Sound Effect ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The sound effect to be played.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SoundSyncSky
Classes.Notes: A decorative background model plays its Appear animation depending on the background music's beat. It follows the camera's position, so it's not possible for the player to reach the end of the model, unlike atmosphere objects.

Obj_arg0.Name: Mirror Reflection Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to use a reflection model or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: SoundSyncSwitch
Classes.Notes: A controller that activates or deactivates a switch depending on the music's beat. It will also play ticking sound effects depending on the configuration. By default, SW_A will be activated and deactivated over and over again.

Obj_arg0.Name: SW_A Toggle Beats
Obj_arg0.Description: How many beats it takes before SW_A gets toggled. Default is 8.

Obj_arg1.Name: SW_A Toggle Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: How many seconds it takes to toggle SW_A after the required beats played. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Ticking Sound Delay
Obj_arg2.Description: How long it takes until the ticking sound starts to play. Default is 0.

Obj_arg3.Name: Ticking Sound Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how to play the ticking sounds. Default is -1.

Values.Notes: Play in game and through Wiimote speaker

Obj_arg4.Name: SW_A Activation Time
Obj_arg4.Description: How long SW_A will be kept activated before it gets deactivated again. Default is 0, which disables this restriction.

SW_APPEAR.Description: If used, the object will update only if this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Will be activated or deactivated depending on the configuration.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object will not update while this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: SpaceMine
Classes.Notes: A space mine that explodes upon contact. However, it can be safely destroyed with the Rainbow power-up, Star Bits, Yoshi's projectiles, and explosions caused by enemies (e.g. Bullet Bills).

Obj_arg0.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to use a shadow or not. Default is -1.

Values.Notes: Use shadow, calculated all the time

Obj_arg1.Name: Use Collision Binder?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, it will use a collision binder which makes it react to collision.

Obj_arg2.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg2.Description: The item(s) that it drops when destroyed with one of various attacks. Default is -1.

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and destroyed by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: SpaceShipStep
Classes.Notes: A platform that moves on a set path once the player steps on it. If the platform is out of view for 4 seconds, it will return to its initial position. If the platform gets damaged by an enemy's explosion, the platform will fall down.

Obj_arg3.Name: Disable Resetting
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the platform won't return to its initial position when it's out of view.

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: SphereRailDash
Classes.Notes: An invisible rail for the Star Ball that boosts its rolling speed. It also causes the player to roll on the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning.

Obj_arg0.Name: Detection Radius
Obj_arg0.Description: The radius of the sensor that detects Star Balls. Default is 200.

Obj_arg1.Name: Rolling Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: The rate at which Star Balls will move. Default is 50.

Obj_arg2.Name: Acceleration Time
Obj_arg2.Description: The time in frames it takes for a Star Ball to reach the maximum speed. Default is 180.

Rail.Description: The path that the Star Ball will move on.

Classes.Name: SpinCloudBlock
Classes.Notes: A single cloud platform created using the Cloud power-up. Does nothing when placed directly, though, rendering the standalone object and class completely useless. The platform itself disappears after some seconds.

Classes.Name: SpinCloudFrontDefineArea
Classes.Notes: An area that controls and sets the facing direction of all Cloud Flower platforms created inside it. The facing direction is the area's rotated Z axis.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SpinCloudItem
Classes.Notes: A collectable item that turns the player into a Cloud character. This power-up state allows them to create up to three temporary cloud platforms.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Uses 出現デモカメラ for appearing.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Classes.Name: SpinDriver
Classes.Notes: A small star-shaped ring that slings the player upwards or from one place to another when using the Spin Attack nearby.

Obj_arg0.Name: Speed / Flight Time
Obj_arg0.Description: The speed the sling star slings you at. If a path is assigned, this value is instead used as the time in frames the flight lasts. Default speed is 40, default flight time is 300.

Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg1.Description: Sets the shadow drop length.

Obj_arg2.Name: Player Pull Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how the player gets pulled into the Launch Star when nearby.

Values.Notes: Doesn't get pulled into Sling Star

Obj_arg3.Name: Camera Count
Obj_arg3.Description: The number of event cameras to be used during the flight.

Obj_arg4.Name: Appearance Jingle
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies how the appearance jingle will be played.

Obj_arg5.Name: Player Rotation
Obj_arg5.Description: The initial rotation of the player used before the player gets launched. This also affects the angle at which the player lands.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that the player will fly along.

Camera.Description: Used when flying. Multiple camera configurations can be used, the count needs to be specified by Obj_arg3, though. Furthermore, 出現イベント用 is used for appearance.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: SpinGuidanceArea
Classes.Notes: An area that displays a layout showing how to perform Spin Attacks with the Wiimote.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power-Up Condition
Obj_arg0.Description: The required power-up state condition to enable the tutorial.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the tutorial will be shown only if this switch is deactivated. Can be used in combination with SW_B.

SW_B.Description: If this and SW_A are used, the tutorial will be shown only if SW_A and SW_B are deactivated. Has no use if SW_A is not used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SpinLeverSwitch
Classes.Notes: A lever that can be activated using most of the player's attacks, explosions or by having Yoshi pull it with his tongue. SpinLeverSwitchForceAnim allows the switch to be flipped over automatically if SW_B is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the lever has been flipped over.

SW_B.Description: If activated, the lever will be flipped over automatically.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and flipped over by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: SpinSwitchArea
Classes.Notes: An area that toggles a switch once the player performs a Spin Attack inside it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets toggled each time the player performs a Spin Attack.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: StaffRollDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Sets up the ending credits by creating and registering several objects as well as the scrolling text. The objects StaffRollSky, StaffRollDecorateFaceShip, StaffRollDecorateComet and PeachCastleNightPlanet need to be linked to it. Further, it uses nine GeneralPos positions to specify the player's position during the cycles. The GeneralPos instances also specify the background (BVA frame) from StaffRollSky to be used during the individual cycles. If the player has collected 120 Power Stars, the epilogue sequence (ChildRoomGalaxy) will be initiated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the credits start playing. Gets deactivated again after the credits played.

NamePos.Description: Uses nine points to specify the player's position as well as the background during cycles. The name's format is マリオ位置%02d空%02d where the variables are the cycle index and StaffRollSky's BVA frame, respectively.

Classes.Name: StarListBoard
Classes.Notes: A special signboard that can display the Star List by triggering a special event flow node.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is StarListBoard%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Classes.Name: StarPiece
Classes.Notes: One of the game's main collectibles that can be collected using any player's pointer or by simply touching it.

Obj_arg3.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow with gravity direction once

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 10 points in The Chimp's challenges.

MirrorActor.Description: A mirrored version of this object is created for mirror reflection setups if placed inside a MirrorArea.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: StarPieceCluster
Classes.Notes: A large decorative crystal that will be destroyed when touched by the player. One object (usually a StarPieceFollowGroup) needs to be linked to this object.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after destroying the crystal.

Classes.Name: StarPieceClusterRock
Classes.Notes: A small blue crystal that releases some Star Bits or Coins when broken using the Rock power-up. The Star Bits will automatically move towards the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The kind of item to spawn.

Obj_arg1.Name: Item Count
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of items to spawn. Default is 4.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

Classes.Name: StarPieceFlow
Classes.Notes: A group of Star Bits that move on a set path.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the Star Bits move on the path. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg1.Description: Amount of Star Bits to be distributed along the path. Default is 1.

Obj_arg3.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow with gravity direction once

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the Star Bits will only be collectable while this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, all Star Bits will fall.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that the Star Bits will move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: The object and the Star Bits take part in the cutscene.

Classes.Name: StarPieceFlower
Classes.Notes: A floating flower that reveals its petals and releases a Star Bit when touched.

Obj_arg0.Name: Enable Shadow?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, its shadow will be enabled.

Classes.Name: StarPieceFollowGroup
Classes.Notes: A group of Star Bits that revolve around the player after they appear. They will move away from the player after a set amount of time has passed. If the current level is EggStarGalaxy2, no more Star Bits will appear if the player has accumulated 100 or more Star Bits.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Star Bits to be spawned. Default is 6.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg1.Description: How long the Star Bits will remain visible before they disappear. Default is 1200.

Obj_arg2.Name: Radius
Obj_arg2.Description: How far the Star Bits should be placed from the player. Default is 350.

Obj_arg3.Name: Displacement Factor
Obj_arg3.Description: How much to displace the Star Bits on its Y axis. Default is 10.

SW_A.Description: Makes the Star Bits appear once this switch gets activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the Star Bits won't appear while this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: StarPieceGroup
Classes.Notes: A group of Star Bits that are arranged in a circle or placed along a path.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg0.Description: Amount of Star Bits to be distributed along the path or circle. Default is 6.

Obj_arg1.Name: Circle Placement Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The radius of the Star Bit circle. Only used if a path has not been assigned. Default is 400.

Obj_arg2.Name: Path Placement Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how the Star Bits are placed on the path. This is only used when a path has been assigned.

Values.Notes: Evenly distribute Star Bits on path
Only one Star Bit per path point (ignores Obj_arg0)

Obj_arg3.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow properties.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow with gravity direction once

Obj_arg5.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Star Bits will disappear again. Default is -1, which makes the Star Bits appear indefinitely.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the Star Bits will only be collectable while this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, all Star Bits will fall.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Can be used to lay out the Star Bits on the path instead of a circle.

Group.Description: Groups objects of the same type, but the group is never used for anything.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: The object and the Star Bits take part in the cutscene.

Classes.Name: StarPieceMother
Classes.Notes: A large rainbow-colored Star Bit. It supports different functions. If connected to a path, it will create a trail of Star Bits when it moves. Otherwise, it remains stationary and can be collected to obtain all Star Bits at once. If it's connected to a path, it requires SW_APPEAR.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Star Bits to be created on its path. Default is 6.

Obj_arg1.Name: Broken Path Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: Meant to specify the starting coordinate on the path at which the Star Bits will be created. However, it crashes the game most of the time. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 10.

Obj_arg3.Name: Star Bit Color Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The color frame to be used for every Star Bit.

Obj_arg4.Name: Star Bit Shadow Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the shadow properties of every Star Bit.

Values.Notes: Calculate shadow with gravity direction once

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the Star Bits will only be collectable while this switch is activated. If used and the object is not connected to a path, it can only be collected when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: StarPieceSpot
Classes.Notes: An invisible spot from which some Star Bits can spawn. If SW_APPEAR is used, they will only appear when triggering said switch. Otherwise, the Star Bits will spawn when attacking the spot with a Spin Attack.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Star Bits to be spawned. Default is 5.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The Star Bits will appear only when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: StarPieceSpotEruption
Classes.Notes: A decorative volcanic smoke effect that can spawn Star Bits when activating its SW_A.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Star Bits
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Star Bits to be spawned. Default is 20.

Obj_arg1.Name: Vertical Speed
Obj_arg1.Description: The vertical speed at which the Star Bits are emitted. Default is 150.

Obj_arg2.Name: Horizontal Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: The horizontal speed at which the Star Bits are emitted. Default is 30.

SW_A.Description: If used, the Star Bits will appear when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: StarReturnDemoStarter
Classes.Notes: Creates and controls the sequence used when the player returns to a HUB world with a Power Star. It does not appear initially, but it can appear through cutscene actions.

Rail.Description: The fly-in path used at the start of the cutscene.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscenes with the names グランドスター帰還[２回目以降], パワースター帰還, パワースター帰還[NPC紹介], パワースター帰還[アイテム惑星] and パワースター帰還[初回].

Classes.Name: StinkBugParent
Classes.Notes: A larger variant of a Mandibug that carries a child on its back. Likewise, it charges towards the player. It can be defeated by Ground Pounding its child and then its back. It will spawn a Power Star when defeated, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. In SMG2, this object won't appear initially unless it's forced to appear through cutscene actions.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: 子連れカメムシデモ後ポイント
Values.Notes: Player's position after defeating the child

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its cutscene nerve action should be triggered during the cutscene part with the name ダメージ中.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: StinkBugSmall
Classes.Notes: A purple bug enemy that charges towards the player. It can be defeated by Ground Pounding on its back. It drops three Star Bits in SMG1 and a single Coin in SMG2 when defeated.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rotation Angle
Obj_arg0.Description: How many degrees it rotates left and right. Default is 180, which means it makes a full rotation.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Distance
Obj_arg1.Description: How far it moves when it charges at the player. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg7.Name: Disable Collision Mesh?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, its collision mesh will be disabled so that the player cannot stand on its back.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated when it dies. If used, it won't drop any items.

SW_A.Description: If activated, it will start to fall down which causes it to respond to gravity too.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: StoryBookAreaText
Classes.Notes: An area that will display a specific text message when entered in special "picture book" stages.

Obj_arg0.Name: Message ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the message to be displayed. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Message.Description: Displayed when the player is inside this area. The dialogue's label has the format StoryBook%03d where %03d is Obj_arg0's value.

Classes.Name: StoryBookAreaWarp
Classes.Notes: An area that will warp the player to a specific point when entered in special "picture book" stages.

Obj_arg0.Name: Warp ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The ID of the warp point that the player should be warped to. Default is -1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Player Animation
Obj_arg1.Description: The player's animation used after arriving at the destination. Default is -1.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

NamePos.Description: The point that the player gets warped to. The name has the format 絵本移動ポイント%03d where %03d is Obj_arg0's value.

Classes.Name: StrayTico
Classes.Notes: A Silver Star that is trapped in a bubble. It can be collected by popping the bubble. It should be linked to a proper CollectTico instance using ParentID (SMG1) / GeneratorId (SMG2).

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when collected.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: StringSpider
Classes.Notes: A spider enemy that hangs from a thread of webbing. When the player is nearby, it will drop and swing back and forth on their threads to damage the player. They can be defeated using most of the player's attacks, explosions and objects like Stretch Plants. They can drop a Coin or three Star Bits.

Obj_arg0.Name: Thread Length
Obj_arg0.Description: The length of its thread. Default is 300.

Obj_arg1.Name: Swing Axis
Obj_arg1.Description: The axis that it swings along. If set to 2, it will swing along its own Z axis.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg2.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is -1 which causes it to use a spherical shadow instead.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will drop when this switch is activated and climb up again when deactivated again.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and attacked (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: SunLightArea
Classes.Notes: An area that defeats Boos and removes the Boo power-up from the player if they are not covered by "Sunshade" collision meshes. SunshadeMapParts is the only class of objects that supports these collision meshes. Thus, the area cannot be properly utilized in SMG2.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SuperDreamer
Classes.Notes: A cosmic variant of Rosalina that offers players to beat the level for them. However, the spirit will only appear if SW_APPEAR is activated or if the player failed the selected mission a set amount of times. The PAD data used to simulate player input can be found in the pad folder of the Galaxy's Ghost archive.

Obj_arg0.Name: PAD File & Spawn ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The index of the Galaxy's Dreamer%d.pad file to use, where %d is this argument's value. This also specifies the spawn point for the player.

Obj_arg1.Name: Required Deaths
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of deaths required in the currently selected mission for it to appear. Default is -1 which means it requires SW_APPEAR to appear.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label formats are SuperDreamer%03d and SuperDreamerEnd%03d, where %03d is the text message ID. If set to -1, the default dialogue from SceneCommonMessage will be used.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

KillFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for KillFunc event flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: SuperSpinDriver
Classes.Notes: A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another when using the Spin Attack nearby. If the object is SuperSpinDriverGreen, the model SuperSpinDriverEmpty will be loaded and the Launch Star cannot be used until the player has collected all three special Green Stars.

Obj_arg0.Name: Flight Time
Obj_arg0.Description: How long it takes to complete the flight. Default 300.

Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg1.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg2.Name: Player Pull Type
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies how the player gets pulled into the Launch Star when nearby.

Values.Notes: Doesn't get pulled into Launch Star

Obj_arg3.Name: Camera Count
Obj_arg3.Description: The number of event cameras to be used during the flight.

Obj_arg4.Name: Appearance Jingle
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies how the appearance jingle will be played.

Obj_arg5.Name: Player Rotation
Obj_arg5.Description: The initial rotation of the player used before the player gets launched. This also affects the angle at which the player lands.

Obj_arg6.Name: Respawn Type
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies whether the object should reappear after dying or not.

Values.Notes: Object needs to be spawned again
Object spawns if it has already appeared before dying

Obj_arg7.Name: Draw Path Range Index
Obj_arg7.Description: The index of this Launch Star's path that is used for updating the segment of the flight path that should be rendered. Useless in SMG2 since this feature is dummied-out in that game.

Path_arg1.Name: Visible Path Cut Length
Path_arg1.Description: How much to cut off from the visible path's end. Default is 0.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the Launch Star will be shrunken an unusable until the switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: Once activated, the Launch Star will disappear. If the switch gets deactivated again, it will reappear.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that the player will fly along.

Group.Description: Used to group the Launch Star with a TicoFat-like object. The objects in this group will appear once the TicoFat-like object disappears.

Camera.Description: Used when flying. Multiple camera configurations can be used, the count needs to be specified by Obj_arg3, though. Furthermore, 出現イベント用 is used for appearance.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Message.Description: Optional text to be displayed on its center. The text dialogue's label format is SuperSpinDriver%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

Classes.Name: SupportFlushPoint
Classes.Notes: An orange butterfly that only appears while playing with two players. It can be targeted and attacked by the Orange Luma which causes it to make some items appear.

Obj_arg0.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg0.Description: The kind of item to spawn.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and attacked by player 2, causing it to spawn some items.

Classes.Name: SwingRope
Classes.Notes: A vine that the player can swing around on by grabbing onto it. The player can jump off it at any given time. scale_y specifies the length of the vine.

Camera.Description: Used when swinging on the vine.

Classes.Name: SwitchArea
Classes.Notes: An area that manipulates a switch once the player enters it. The logic and several additional conditions can be specified.

Obj_arg0.Name: Deactivate Outside Area?
Obj_arg0.Description: If enabled, SW_A will be disabled again after leaving the area.

Obj_arg1.Name: Negate Output?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, SW_A will be deactivated instead.

Obj_arg2.Name: Ground Use Only?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the player must be on the ground to activate SW_A.

Obj_arg4.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies what sound effect to play after updating SW_A's state. This only occurs once per area.

Obj_arg5.Name: Required Rush Condition
Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies what special rush condition is needed to activate the switch.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: The event to trigger when Mario enters the area.

SW_B.Description: If used, this switch needs to be activated in order to make this area manipulate SW_A.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SwitchFreezePlanet
Classes.Notes: A special planet object that uses an additional "Ice" model that will appear when its cutscene functor action gets triggered.

Obj_arg0.Name: Already Frozen?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the planet will already use its "Ice" model.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its special cutscene functor action causes it to freeze up.

Classes.Name: SwitchingMoveBlock
Classes.Notes: A platform that can move and rotate when SW_A gets activated. If the switch gets deactivated again, the platform returns to its original placement.

Obj_arg0.Name: X Offset
Obj_arg0.Description: How far to move the object from its position on the X-axis. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Y Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: How far to move the object from its position on the Y-axis. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Z Offset
Obj_arg2.Description: How far to move the object from its position on the Z-axis. Default is 0.

Obj_arg3.Name: X Rotation
Obj_arg3.Description: How much to rotate object around the X-axis. Default is 0.

Obj_arg4.Name: Y Rotation
Obj_arg4.Description: How much to rotate object around the Y-axis. Default is 0.

Obj_arg5.Name: Z Rotation
Obj_arg5.Description: How much to rotate object around the Z-axis. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: Applies the offset and rotation to the object's placement when activated. When deactivated again, the object returns to its original placement.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: SwitchSynchronizer
Classes.Notes: Provides NOT gate logic for switches. There are two possible outcomes. If SW_B and SW_A are activated, SW_A will be deactivated. If SW_B and SW_A are deactivated, SW_A will be activated.

SW_A.Description: Secondary input, also functions as output.

SW_B.Description: Primary input switch.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: Takobo
Classes.Notes: An octopus enemy that can be defeated using most player attacks. It can also be defeated by an enemy's explosion attack and Koopa Shells. It moves a set distance. Once the player gets close, it will headbutt the player (SMG1) or shoot a rock at the player (SMG2). It drops a Coin when stomped or Ground Pounded, and it drops Star Bits when damaged through other means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Lava Interaction
Obj_arg0.Description: How it interacts with lava collision.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Obj_arg1.Description: In what directions it moves.

Obj_arg2.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: The rate at which it moves. Default is 5.

Obj_arg3.Name: Movement Distance
Obj_arg3.Description: How far it moves from its initial position. Default is 500.

Obj_arg4.Name: Disable Rock Gravity?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, the rocks that it throws won't recalculate their gravity vector.

Obj_arg5.Name: Connect to Collision?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, it will connect to the collision mesh below.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: TakoHei
Classes.Notes: An octopus enemy that can be defeated using most player attacks. When the player gets near, it hops backwards to flee. If they flee for too long, they will stop hopping around for a short while. It will shoot a rock at the player to defend from a short distance. It drops a Coin when stomped or Ground Pounded, and it drops Star Bits when damaged through other means.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated (SMG2 only) by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: TakoSho
Classes.Notes: An octopus enemy that can be defeated using most player attacks. It can also be defeated by an enemy's explosion attack and Koopa Shells. It moves a set distance. Once the player gets close, it will shoot two rocks at the player, one at a time, to damage them. It drops a Coin when stomped or Ground Pounded, and it drops Star Bits when damaged through other means.

Obj_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Obj_arg1.Description: In what directions it moves.

Obj_arg2.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: The rate at which it moves. Default is 5.

Obj_arg3.Name: Movement Distance
Obj_arg3.Description: How far it moves from its initial position. Default is 500.

Obj_arg5.Name: Connect to Collision?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, it will connect to the collision mesh below.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted, frozen and defeated by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: Tamakoro
Classes.Notes: A rolling ball containing a Power Star or a Purple Coin that the player can ride on by jumping on it. In SMG1, the tutorial signboard TamakoroTutorial needs to be linked to it. In SMG2, the signboard is not mandatory, and it's renamed to SignBoardTamakoro. Furthermore, GeneralRestartPos can be linked to the Star Ball to specify a respawn point for the Star Ball in SMG2. It will always spawn a Power Star when destroyed which requires a properly configured Scenario entry. If it contains a Purple Coin, no Power Star will be spawned.

Obj_arg0.Name: Holds Purple Coin?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the Star Ball will hold a Purple Coin instead of a Power Star.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the player starts riding the Star Ball. Gets deactivated again after the Star Ball gets destroyed.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after opening it. If Obj_arg0 is set in SMG2, it won't spawn a Power Star.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: TamakoroJumpGuidanceArea
Classes.Notes: An area that displays a layout showing how to jump with a Star Ball.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power-Up Condition
Obj_arg0.Description: The required power-up state condition to enable the tutorial.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the tutorial will be shown only if this switch is activated. Can be used in combination with SW_B.

SW_B.Description: If this and SW_A are used, the tutorial will be shown only if SW_A is activated and SW_B is deactivated. Has no use if SW_A is not used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: TamakoroMoveGuidanceArea
Classes.Notes: An area that displays a layout showing how to move with a Star Ball.

Obj_arg0.Name: Power-Up Condition
Obj_arg0.Description: The required power-up state condition to enable the tutorial.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the tutorial will be shown only if this switch is activated. Can be used in combination with SW_B.

SW_B.Description: If this and SW_A are used, the tutorial will be shown only if SW_A is activated and SW_B is deactivated. Has no use if SW_A is not used.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: TamakoroTutorial
Classes.Notes: A special signboard that needs to be linked to a proper Tamakoro instance. It will teach the player about Star Ball controls when talked to or when the player steps on the Star Ball.

Obj_arg0.Name: Prevent Tutorial?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the tutorial sequence will be skipped even if the player hasn't played the tutorial yet.

Message.Description: Uses TamakoroTutorial when Obj_arg0 is set to -1 and TamakoroTutorial2nd if set to any other value. The dialogues are found in SceneCommonMessage.

Classes.Name: Terebo
Classes.Notes: An undead enemy that moves on a set path. It cannot be defeated by any means, however, it will hide for a short amount of time when using the Spin Attack nearby. It can be defeated using fireballs, the Rainbow power-up and Koopa Shell light beams.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves. If not set to -1, it will also enable gravity calculation. Default is 5.

Point_arg0.Name: Hide Type
Point_arg0.Description: If set to 0, this point allows the Octoboo to hide. In order to hide an Octoomba properly, this needs to be set to 0 for the first and last point of a path segment.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Group.Description: If one Octoboo from this group gets frozen by the Orange Luma, all Octoboos will stop moving.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: TereboGroup
Classes.Notes: A generator that creates a group of Octoboos that move on a set path. Obj_arg6 needs to be configured as the default number of Octoboos is 0.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which the Octoboos moves. If not set to -1, it will also enable gravity calculation. Default is 5.

Obj_arg6.Name: Number of Octoboos
Obj_arg6.Description: The number of Octoboos. Default is 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: Octoboo Spacing
Obj_arg7.Description: The distance between each Octoboo. If the value is 0, the Octoboos will be evenly laid out on the path. Default is 0.

Point_arg0.Name: Hide Type
Point_arg0.Description: If set to 0, this point allows the Octoboos to hide. In order to hide an Octoomba properly, this needs to be set to 0 for the first and last point of a path segment.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The Octoboos and Octoboos will appear when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: The Octoboos will become visible and resume movement when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the Octoboos moves on.

Group.Description: If one Octoboo from this group gets frozen by the Orange Luma, all Octoboos will stop moving.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: The Octoboos can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Teresa
Classes.Notes: A ghost enemy that will hide when looked at by the player. If the player turns away, it will go after the player to attack them. When the player is using the Boo power-up, it will chase the player. It can be defeated using fireballs, the Rainbow power-up and Koopa Shell light rays. Furthermore, it will be defeated when it enters a GlaringLightArea or a SunLightArea. If the object is called TeresaChief, it will spawn a Power Star when defeated, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Obj_arg0.Name: Appearance Type
Obj_arg0.Description: How the Boo appears.
