Obj_arg1.Name: Matter Splatter Drop Size
Obj_arg1.Description: The radius of the Matter Splatter drop. Default is 0 which disables the drop.

Obj_arg6.Name: Toad/Luma Color
Obj_arg6.Description: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.

Obj_arg7.Name: Item Type
Obj_arg7.Description: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 6 also creates a Key, all other values create a Coin. If the object is TeresaChief, it will always spawn a Power Star instead.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated by the Key that will be spawned if Obj_arg7 is set to 6.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: TeresaAtomic
Classes.Notes: A large Boo surrounded by four smaller Boos that can move on a path or move forwards indefinitely. They damage the player upon contact. It will be defeated when it enters a GlaringLightArea or a SunLightArea. If Obj_arg2 is set, it will spawn a Power Star when defeated, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Matter Splatter Drop Size
Obj_arg1.Description: The radius of the Matter Splatter drop. Default is 0 which disables the drop.

Obj_arg2.Name: Power Star Type
Obj_arg2.Description: If non-negative, it will register and spawn a Power Star.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

Classes.Name: TeresaWater
Classes.Notes: A simple Boo variant for underwater sections that moves back and forth. It can be defeated using the Rainbow power-up or a Koopa Shell's light ray, causing it to drop a single Coin.

Obj_arg0.Name: Front Movement Limit
Obj_arg0.Description: How far it moves back and forth. Default is 800.

Obj_arg1.Name: Invalidate Shadow?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, its shadow will be invalidated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 100 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: Tico (SMG2)
Classes.Notes: A cute star-shaped NPC that can be talked to. It supports various different behaviors. Interestingly, it also creates a cutscene model for Young Master Luma if Obj_arg1 is set to 2, but this is never used.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used. This also specifies what texts should be displayed when feeding it Star Bits. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Behavior
Obj_arg1.Description: Its general behavior.

Values.Notes: Fall to the ground, then talk to the player
Moves on path, pauses when player is near
Disables player control until player is nearby

Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Dialogue?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the talk controller won't be initialized. In other words, it cannot be talked to.

Obj_arg4.Name: Feed Message
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the texts to be used when feeding it Star Bits. By default, this value is equal to Obj_arg0's value.

Values.Notes: Thank you!/That's the ticket!/So generous! So tasty!/Happy deliciousness.../Thanks so much!
ALL FOR MEEE!/Snacky happiness!/Boooom! Flavor!/So full... So happy!/Yay! Thanks!

Obj_arg5.Name: Gravity Affects Pose?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, its pose will be affected by gravity.

Path_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Path_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves on the path.

Path_arg1.Name: Start Near Player?
Path_arg1.Description: If set, it will start to move from the path coordinate that is closest to the player. Only used if Obj_arg1 is set to 6.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Can be used to start the path movement if Obj_arg1 is set to 6 or 8. Alternatively, it can be activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on. Needed when Obj_arg1 is set to 6 or 8.

Group.Description: Used to group it crystal cages in Gateway Galaxy. Useless in SMG2, though.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. If registered to マリオ顔惑星変化, it cannot be talked to, and it will only turn towards the player.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is Tico%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes. Enables a special talk sequence, however, this won't work since it never gets initialized. Therefore, this is effectively useless.

KillFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for KillFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. if placed on Starship Mario.

Classes.Name: TicoBaby
Classes.Notes: A variant of Master Luma that lies down on the ground. If the object is killed, for example through the cutscene system, the player's Spin Attacks will be enabled.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscene with the name ベビチコ出会い. While that cutscene is running, it performs some background music changes. If the cutscene part マリオ驚き is active, the music will be changed to BGM_SMG2_EV_PROLO_03. If the cutscene part チコ帽子の中へ is active, the music will be changed to BGM_SMG2_JG_MEETCHIKO.

Classes.Name: TicoBig
Classes.Notes: A large Luma NPC that can be talked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is TicoBig%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: TicoCoin
Classes.Notes: One of the main collectibles in a Galaxy. There should only be one in every proper Galaxy. TubeSliderTicoCoin is a variant to be used on tube slides. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance. TubeSliderTicoCoin has a far clipping distance of 300 meters.

Obj_arg0.Name: Initial Angle
Obj_arg0.Description: The angle around the tube slide at which the object gets positioned initially.

Obj_arg1.Name: Edge Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: The offset from the tube's edge at which the object should be placed. Default is 0.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Uses 出現デモカメラ for appearing.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 1000 points in The Chimp's challenges.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. However, this only works during the first scenario of JungleGliderGalaxy.

Classes.Name: TicoFatCoin
Classes.Notes: A bigger Luma that requests a certain number of Coins. If the player gives them Coins, it will transform, disappear and activate a switch. If the player already gave it Coins before, it will disappear immediately and activate the switch. There should only be one per stage. When it transforms, it tries to move on a path, however, this is optional.

Obj_arg1.Name: Requested Coins
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of requested Coins. Default is 5.

Obj_arg7.Name: Special Talking Camera?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will use the camera with the name 独自会話 when talked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Very buggy so it shouldn't be used. The object will appear when this switch is activated, but it will always have appeared even if the switch is deactivated. Deactivating the switch again will fix this, though.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after it disappears. Alternatively, it can be activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it can move on after eating the player's Coins.

Camera.Description: Uses 飛行 when flying. If Obj_arg7 is set, it will use 独自会話 when talked to.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: Its dialogue sequence is part of SceneCommonMessage, meaning that there is no need to set it up individually.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

Classes.Name: TicoFatStarPiece
Classes.Notes: A Hungry Luma that appears when requested on a World map. The number of Star Bits it demands is specified in the World's respective WorldMap data file. Once fed, it will along its path and disappear.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated. However, this shouldn't be used.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on after eating Star Bits.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscene with the name ハラペコスターピースチコ紹介.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: Its dialogue sequence is part of SceneCommonMessage, meaning that there is no need to set it up individually.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Classes.Name: TicoRail
Classes.Notes: A decorative variant of a Luma that moves on a set path. If two or more TicoRail objects share the same path, they may interact with each other when they meet on the path. It can be fed Star Bits, although this effect is purely cosmetic. The texts that are displayed when fed can be adjusted too.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used. This also specifies what texts should be displayed when feeding it Star Bits. Default is 0.

Obj_arg4.Name: Feed Message
Obj_arg4.Description: Specifies the texts to be used when feeding it Star Bits. By default, this value is equal to Obj_arg0's value.

Values.Notes: Thank you!/That's the ticket!/So generous! So tasty!/Happy deliciousness.../Thanks so much!
ALL FOR MEEE!/Snacky happiness!/Boooom! Flavor!/So full... So happy!/Yay! Thanks!

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in the cutscene named バトラーグリーンドライバ説明.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc. In SMG1, this only works in the Comet Observatory.

Classes.Name: TicoSeedGuidanceCube
Classes.Notes: If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to feed a Hungry Luma with Star Bits. Does not work in SMG2.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: TicoShop
Classes.Notes: A Luma salesman who sells the player a 1-Up Mushroom or a Life Mushroom for Star Bits. If the player gives them the requested Star Bits, it will transform into the requested item.

Obj_arg0.Name: Requested Star Bits
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of requested Star Bits. Default is 30.

Obj_arg7.Name: Special Talking Camera?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will use the camera with the name 独自会話 when talked to.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: If Obj_arg7 is set, it will use 独自会話 when talked to.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: Its dialogue sequence is part of SceneCommonMessage, meaning that there is no need to set it up individually.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Synchronize and hide Star Bits counter

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: TicoShopDice
Classes.Notes: A Luma salesman who sells the player 1-Up Chance Cubes. It can request either Star Bits or Coins. The LuckyDice objects it transforms into have to be linked to it. If the player gives them the requested items, it will transform and disappear.

Obj_arg0.Name: Requested Item Count
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of requested items. Default is 30.

Obj_arg7.Name: Requests Coins?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, it will request Coins instead of Star Bits.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: Its dialogue sequence is part of SceneCommonMessage, meaning that there is no need to set it up individually.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: TimeAttackClock
Classes.Notes: A large collectable clock that adds ten seconds to the Comet timer when collected by the player.

Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies whether shadow calculation will be enabled or disabled.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: TimerSwitch
Classes.Notes: A controller that activates SW_A once the specified number of frames have elapsed. SW_B needs to be triggered in order for it to start counting down the frames. The countdown will reset when SW_B gets activated again.

Obj_arg0.Name: Wait Frames
Obj_arg0.Description: The time in frames to be elapsed before SW_A gets activated or deactivated.

Obj_arg1.Name: Negate Output?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, SW_A will be deactivated instead of getting activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated or deactivated if SW_B is activated and the targeted time has elapsed.

SW_B.Description: If activated, the frames will be counted down.

Classes.Name: Togepin
Classes.Notes: A bowling pin enemy that can be defeated with the Rock power-up. If the player is using the Rock power-up, it will tremble in fear. Once defeated, it drops three Star Bits. It always connects to the collision below it.

SW_A.Description: If activated, it will hide forever.

Classes.Name: TogepinAttackFoulArea
Classes.Notes: If the player enters this area, any TogepinScorer will detect this as a foul. If this happens, the player needs to get out of the area to make the mini-game resume. This area has no effect if the player is rolling around using the Rock power-up.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: TogepinAttackMan
Classes.Notes: The monkey NPC who will prompt the player to play a scoring mini-game where one has to defeat Pinheads with the Rock power-up. The mini-game controller (TogepinScorer) needs to be linked to it. It will register a Power Star, however, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. A complex dialogue with flow nodes needs to be set up as well.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_B.Description: Activated or deactivated depending on the used event flow node.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Gets spawned after triggering its EventFunc.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is TogepinAttackMan%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

EventFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for EventFunc event flow nodes.

Values.Notes: Replace number variable with player's score
Replace number variable with minimum score
Replace number variable with high score

AnimeFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for AnimeFunc event flow nodes.

BranchFunc.Description: Object-specific behavior for BranchFunc branch flow nodes.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: TogepinScorer
Classes.Notes: A controller for The Chimp's Bowling Challenge which sets up the mini-game whereas the individual Pinheads need to be linked to it. The controller itself needs to be linked to a TogepinAttackMan instance. The player needs to score 5000 points in order to win.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the mini-game starts and deactivated again when it ends.

SW_B.Description: Gets activated when the player is inside a TogepinAttackFoulArea.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Classes.Name: Togezo
Classes.Notes: An enemy that carries a red spiky shell on its back. It can be defeated using most of the player's attacks, explosions, electricity, and some other objects such as Stretch Plants. However, touching its spikes will damage the player.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted, eaten and shot by Yoshi.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: Tongari
Classes.Notes: An undefeatable enemy that carries a white cone-shaped shell with spikes on its back. It moves on a set path. Tongari turns around while moving and creates bubble particles when hit; Tongari2D always faces sideways and creates smoke clouds when hit.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 2.

Obj_arg1.Name: Use Collision Mesh?
Obj_arg1.Description: If enabled, it will also load its collision mesh.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: TowerModeCylinder
Classes.Notes: An area that restricts the player's movement around a cylinder while the player is inside it.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: TransformFaceTicoBabyDemoObj
Classes.Notes: Creates and registers the Young Master Luma model that appears during the cutscene where Starship Mario gets created. Young Master Luma's model will be registered under the name ベビチコ[顔惑星変化用]. The model will be hidden unless requested to appear through the cutscene.

DemoCast.Description: Takes part in the cutscene named マリオ顔惑星変化.

Classes.Name: Trapeze
Classes.Notes: A swing that the player can swing across by grabbing onto it. The player can jump off it at any given time. scale_y specifies the length of the swing.

Obj_arg0.Name: Additional Shadow Length
Obj_arg0.Description: How much to add to the shadow's length. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Shadow Cut Length
Obj_arg1.Description: How much to subtract from the shadow's length. Default is 0.

Camera.Description: Used when climbing on and swinging on the swing.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: TreasureBoxCracked
Classes.Notes: A treasure chest that can be opened through various means, for example Koopa Shells. It can contain various different items or no item at all. The object's suffix determines what item to use: AirBubble creates an Air Bubble, Coin creates a single Coin, YellowChip creates a Star Chip, BlueChip creates a Blue Star Chip, KinokoOneUp creates a 1-Up Mushroom, KinokoLifeUp creates a Life Mushroom and Power Star creates a Power Star. However, all items will generate a 1-Up Mushroom in SMG2. The object's prefix also determines what model to load. Aside from Koopa Shells, it can also be opened through various other means (Obj_arg2).

Obj_arg0.Name: SW_A Delay / Chip Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: If the object is the Empty variant, this specifies how long it takes to activate SW_A after opening the chest. Default is 5. If the object is a YellowChip or BlueChip variant, this specifies the group ID that the Chip object belongs to.

Obj_arg2.Name: Unlock Requirement
Obj_arg2.Description: Determines the object required to open the chest.

Obj_arg3.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg3.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. -1 will look for the first scenario entry.

SW_DEAD.Description: Gets activated after the chest opening animation has ended.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after successfully opening the chest.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

Classes.Name: TreasureSpot
Classes.Notes: A marked spot that reveals a Coin when hit with a Star Bit.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: TrickRabbit
Classes.Notes: The bunny NPC that runs away from the player after talking to it. If it runs away from the player directly after talking to it, a cutscene will play as long as the points it jumps on have Point_arg7 set to -2. When the player catches it, it spawns a Power Star. This requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Point_arg0.Name: Jump
Point_arg0.Description: Whether it jumps at this point or not. Default is -1.

Point_arg1.Name: Jump Start Time
Point_arg1.Description: The delay before it starts jumping. Default is 20.

Point_arg2.Name: Jump Time
Point_arg2.Description: How long it takes to perform a full jump. Default depends on the distance between the points.

Point_arg3.Name: Jump Height
Point_arg3.Description: How many units it jumps up. Default is 100.

Point_arg7.Name: Selectability
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether it can move to this point or not. Default is -1.

Values.Notes: Accessible only during first 20 seconds after intro
Accessible only 20 seconds after the intro

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on. The subpaths it moves on have to be linked to the main path using Path_ID. However, the control points of all paths will be ignored, meaning that the path segments are always linear.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after catching it.

Camera.Description: Used when it runs away from the player after talking to it.

Message.Description: The text dialogue's label format is TrickRabbit%03d, where %03d is the text message ID.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: Tsukidashikun
Classes.Notes: A large stone block obstacle that periodically moves back and forth on a path.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames it waits before it moves again. Default is 120.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: TubeSlider
Classes.Notes: A controller that sets up a tubular slide section. Its path lays out the shape and ground of the slide. There is no visual representation of it, so a separate model has to be created. Various specific tube slider objects can be linked to it. The compatible objects will be placed around the tube's path as configured by the many arguments. If placed in BigTree2Galaxy, short jingles will be played when the player reaches the end of the slide.

Obj_arg0.Name: Default Tube Radius
Obj_arg0.Description: The tube's radius to be used when the radius at a specific point hasn't been specified. Default is 500.

Obj_arg1.Name: Default Ground Type
Obj_arg1.Description: The ground type to be used when the ground type at a specific point hasn't been specified. Default is 0.

Obj_arg6.Name: Camera Constraints
Obj_arg6.Description: Specifies what camera constraints to use.

Point_arg0.Name: Tube Radius
Point_arg0.Description: The tube's radius at this point. Default is 500.

Point_arg1.Name: Primary Ground Type
Point_arg1.Description: The ground type to be used between this and the next path point. Default corresponds to setting this to 0.

Point_arg2.Name: Primary Valid Starting Angle
Point_arg2.Description: The angle at which the primary ground begins. Default is 0.

Point_arg3.Name: Primary Valid Degrees
Point_arg3.Description: The angle of primary valid ground that the player can slide on. Goes counter-clockwise. Default is 360.

Point_arg4.Name: Interpolate Arguments?
Point_arg4.Description: If set, the values corresponding to Point_arg2, Point_arg3, Point_arg6, and Point_arg7 will be interpolated at this path segment (the line between this and the next point). This is done by interpolating the respective arguments of this and the next point using the length of the path segment.

Point_arg5.Name: Edge / Ground Type
Point_arg5.Description: If Point_arg6 and Point_arg7 are used, this specifies the ground type of the secondary tube chunk. Otherwise, this specifies whether the player falls off the left and right edges.

Point_arg6.Name: Secondary Valid Starting Angle
Point_arg6.Description: The angle at which the secondary ground begins. Default is 0.

Point_arg7.Name: Secondary Valid Degrees
Point_arg7.Description: The angle of secondary valid ground that the player can slide on. Goes clockwise. Default is 0.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when the player is on the slide; gets deactivated when the player leaves the slide again.

Rail.Description: Defines the tube's shape.

Camera.Description: Used when the player is sliding on this slide.

Classes.Name: TubeSliderCoinCreator
Classes.Notes: A generator that creates Coins (TubeSliderCoinCreator) or Purple Coins (TubeSliderCoinCreatorPurple) and lays them out on a tube slide. The line can be straight, twisted or a sine wave. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Coins
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be spawned. Default is 1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Edge Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: The offset from the tube's edge at which the Coins should be placed. Default is 0.

Obj_arg2.Name: Coin Spacing
Obj_arg2.Description: The distance between each Coin. Default is 500.

Obj_arg3.Name: Starting Angle
Obj_arg3.Description: The angle around the tube slide from which the Coins will be placed.

Obj_arg4.Name: Twist Angle / Sine Amplitude
Obj_arg4.Description: The amount of degrees it twists around counterclockwise. However, if Obj_arg5 is set, this specifies the sine wave's amplitude. Default is 0.

Obj_arg5.Name: Enable Sine Wave
Obj_arg5.Description: If set to 1, Obj_arg4 specifies the amplitude for sine wave placement. Default is 0.

Obj_arg6.Name: Sine Phase Shift
Obj_arg6.Description: The sine wave's phase shift in degrees. Default is 0. Requires Obj_arg5 to be set to 1.

Obj_arg7.Name: Sine Cycle Degrees
Obj_arg7.Description: The number of periods multiplied by 360. Default is 360, which corresponds to one full sine period. Requires Obj_arg5 to be set to 1.

Classes.Name: TubeSliderCrystal
Classes.Notes: An unfinished crystal cage intended for tube slides. It also loads the StarPieceDummy model as well as a Break model, however, the latter never appears. The model files are missing, though. It is clearly unfinished, seeing that it doesn't emit particles or sound effects either. When touched, the player receives eight Star Bits. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance.

Obj_arg0.Name: Initial Angle
Obj_arg0.Description: The angle around the tube slide at which the object gets positioned initially.

Obj_arg1.Name: Edge Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: The offset from the tube's edge at which the object should be placed. Default is 0.

Classes.Name: TubeSliderDamageObj
Classes.Notes: A generator that creates Spiky Plants and lays them out on a tube slide. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance. When configuring the object, one has to be careful with the settings because some Spiky Plants may not get positioned correctly.

Obj_arg0.Name: Broken Variant Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what model to load. Since the model TubeSliderFire has been removed, using this setting without a proper model will crash the game. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Width
Obj_arg1.Description: The number of Spiky Plant lines. Should be greater than or equal to 1. Default is 1.

Obj_arg2.Name: Length
Obj_arg2.Description: The number of Spiky Plant rows. Should be greater than or equal to 1. Default is 1.

Obj_arg3.Name: Edge Offset
Obj_arg3.Description: The offset from the tube's edge at which the objects should be placed. Default is 0.

Obj_arg4.Name: Row Distance
Obj_arg4.Description: The distance between the rows. Default is 500.

Obj_arg5.Name: Starting Angle
Obj_arg5.Description: The angle around the tube slide from which the objects will be placed. Default is 180.

Obj_arg6.Name: Valid Degrees
Obj_arg6.Description: The degrees of the tube segment that the objects occupy. Default is 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: Twist Angle
Obj_arg7.Description: The amount of degrees it twists around counterclockwise. Default is 0.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: TubeSliderEnemy
Classes.Notes: A Spiny variant for tube slide sections. It starts to walk when its SW_A gets activated. After walking for 10 seconds, it will disappear. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it moves. Default is 3.

Obj_arg5.Name: Initial Angle
Obj_arg5.Description: The angle around the tube slide at which the object gets positioned initially.

SW_A.Description: Starts walking once this switch is activated.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: TubeSliderJumpStep
Classes.Notes: An unfinished trampoline intended for tube slides that would bounce off the player when touched. The model files are missing, though. It needs to be linked to a proper TubeSlider instance.

Obj_arg0.Name: Initial Angle
Obj_arg0.Description: The angle around the tube slide at which the object gets positioned initially. Default is 180.

Obj_arg1.Name: Edge Offset
Obj_arg1.Description: The offset from the tube's edge at which the object should be placed. Default is 0.

Classes.Name: TwoLegs
Classes.Notes: A robotic boss that can stomp the player. Furthermore, it may launch Diggas (TwoLegsBullet) to attack the player. The Diggas have to be placed and linked to it. After hitting the glass cage three times with the Spin Drill, it will be defeated which makes the caged Power Star appear. However, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. If SW_A is not used, the boss battle will start immediately.

SW_A.Description: If used, the boss battle will start once this switch gets activated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

NamePos.Description: Additional placements that can be freely placed.

Values.Value: 二脚ボス爆発デモ後座標

Classes.Name: TwoLegsBullet
Classes.Notes: A Digga variant for the boss battle against Digga-Leg that moves on a set path, however, the game randomly decides in what path direction it moves. It needs to be linked to a proper TwoLegs instance. It damages the player upon contact, and it can be defeated by stomping, drilling or Ground Pounding it.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: TypicalDoor
Classes.Notes: A pair of closed doors that can be opened by activating SW_B.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: Makes the doors open once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. The doors open if the 扉開く cutscene part executes.

Classes.Name: TypicalDoorOpen
Classes.Notes: A pair of opened doors that can be closed by activating SW_B.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: Makes the doors close once activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. The doors open if the 扉開く cutscene part executes.

Classes.Name: UFOKinoko
Classes.Notes: A mushroom-shaped spaceship that acts as a platform. It can rotate and move on a path as well, although the latter needs to be enabled through specific means.

Obj_arg0.Name: Color Frame
Obj_arg0.Description: The color frame to be used

Obj_arg7.Name: Disable LOD Control?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, the LOD controller will be disabled.

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed. However, this also requires ShadowType to be set to 1.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point
Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

ShadowType.Name: Enable Indicator Dots
ShadowType.Description: Due to some strange logic, this needs to be set to 1 in order to activate the indicator dots.

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: Causes the platform to start moving on the path once activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on when SW_B or its cutscene functor action gets activated.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. It can use a special cutscene functor action under the name ＵＦＯキノコ登場 that will cause it to start moving on its path.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: UFOShapePassThroughPlanet
Classes.Notes: A generic planet with a model and optional collision whose execution will not be paused during cutscenes. The normal collision mesh has the same name as the object itself. However, it also supports WaterSurface and MoveLimit collision meshes. If the model has a joint named Move, the collision will be set to follow that joint. Furthermore, it can also use particle effects and sounds. Planets support optional Water, Indirect, Bloom, Low and Middle models as well as fur maps.

Obj_arg0.Name: Useless
Obj_arg0.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg1.Name: Sphere Clipping Radius
Obj_arg1.Description: The spherical clipping radius. If this setting is 0 or less, the model's bounding radius will be used. This is the default behavior.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: Unbaba
Classes.Notes: A large lava enemy that rises up to attack the player. It cannot be defeated by any means, and it remains at a fixed position. Usually, it creates a red indicator volume that is rendered when it attacks, although this effect is hard to notice.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rise Height
Obj_arg0.Description: How far up it rises. Default is 500.

Obj_arg1.Name: Reappear Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes before it returns to its initial position. Default is 20.

Obj_arg2.Name: Rise Delay
Obj_arg2.Description: The time in frames it takes before it starts to rise up. Default is 30.

Obj_arg3.Name: Hide Indicator Volume?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the red indicator volume won't be rendered when it attacks.

SW_A.Description: If used, it will only attack when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: UnbabaSlim
Classes.Notes: A large rotating lava enemy that cannot be defeated by any means. Usually, it creates a red indicator volume that is rendered when it attacks, although this effect is hard to notice.

RotateSpeed.Name: Rotation Speed / Time
RotateSpeed.Description: How fast the object rotates. If RotateAccelType is set to 2, this specifies the time in frames it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

RotateAngle.Name: Rotation Angle
RotateAngle.Description: How many degrees it rotates. If RotateAccelType is not 2, 0 equals 360 which means it will rotate indefinitely.

RotateAxis.Name: Rotation Axis
RotateAxis.Description: The object's axis to rotate around.

RotateAccelType.Name: Rotation Speed Type
RotateAccelType.Description: Decides whether RotateSpeed specifies the rotation speed, acceleration, or the time it takes to rotate to the specified angle.

Values.Notes: RotateSpeed specifies time until desired angle

RotateStopTime.Name: Restart Delay
RotateStopTime.Description: The time in frames it takes to restart rotation after stopping.

RotateType.Name: Rotation Type
RotateType.Description: Specifies how the object should continue rotating after reaching the targeted angle.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will move if and only if this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The rotation speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

Rail.Description: Registered but never used.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: Unizo
Classes.Notes: An urchin-like enemy that rolls around and damages the player with its spikes. It can be defeated with fireballs, Koopa Shells, the Rock and Rainbow power-ups, and more. Once defeated, it will drop six Star Bits.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

ScoreAttack.Description: This object scores 300 points in The Chimp's challenges.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

SearchTurtle.Description: Red Koopa Shells and Gold Shells home in on this object.

MoveLimitCollision.Description: The collision binder also checks for MoveLimit collision.

Classes.Name: ValveSwitch
Classes.Notes: A green valve that can be screwed out of its base by using a Spin Attack on it. After that, it will activate a switch. It will be connected to the collision below.

Obj_arg0.Name: Reverse Direction?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, is has to be screwed into the ground instead.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after spinning.

Classes.Name: ViewGroupCtrlArea
Classes.Notes: When entered by the player, compatible objects in the same ViewGroup will render/update if they are in the camera's view.

Obj_arg0.Name: View Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The ViewGroup of objects that should be rendered.

Obj_arg1.Name: LOD Mode
Obj_arg1.Description: Overrides the LOD system by forcing the objects to use the specified LOD mode instead.

Obj_arg2.Name: Disable Shadow Far Clipping?
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, far clipping of all shadows will be disabled while the player is inside this area. Thus, it temporarily overwrites the settings provided by a ShadowFarClipCtrlArea or a galaxy's ShadowControllerParam file.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: VsOtaRockTankIcePlanetFence
Classes.Notes: A very simple object with a model and optional collision. It has no special capabilities.

Classes.Name: WanwanCreator
Classes.Notes: A spawner that creates rolling Chomps that move on a set path. The Chomps can be destroyed with the Rainbow power-up, Stretch Plants and explosions. Gold Chomps will spawn a Power Star when defeated. However, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry. In SMG2, a KeySwitch can be linked to WanwanRollingMini that will appear when defeating it.

Obj_arg0.Name: Rolling Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The rate at which it rolls. Default is 10.

Obj_arg1.Name: Spawn Delay
Obj_arg1.Description: The delay in seconds between the spawns. If non-positive, only one instance will spawn. Default is -1.

Obj_arg3.Name: Path Roll Time
Obj_arg3.Description: The time in frames that it rolls on the path before falling down. Default is 45.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 1000.

Obj_arg5.Name: Decelerate When Attacked?
Obj_arg5.Description: If set, it will decelerate and accelerate again when it successfully damaged an object, such as the player.

Obj_arg6.Name: Use Portal?
Obj_arg6.Description: If set, the Chomps will emerge from a large black portal.

Obj_arg7.Name: Invalid Collision Binder Time
Obj_arg7.Description: The time in frames that the collision binder will be kept invalidated when it appears. Default is 45.

Point_arg0.Name: Fall Type
Point_arg0.Description: Specifies how it rolls at this point.

Point_arg1.Name: Path Movement Type
Point_arg1.Description: Specifies how the movement is affected by the path.

Values.Notes: Moves along path starting from this point

Point_arg2.Name: Follow Tangent?
Point_arg2.Description: If set, it will follow the path's tangent until this point has been reached.

SW_APPEAR.Description: The Chomps will appear when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Stops spawning more Chomps once activated.

Rail.Description: The path that the Chomps roll on.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: WanwanGoal
Classes.Notes: A goal that Chomps can roll into. It will cause different effects depending on the type of Chomp that rolls into it.

SW_A.Description: Registered but never used.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: WanwanLiftUpStep
Classes.Notes: A map object with a model and optional collision that usually moves on a set path. Unlike other variants, it emits the effect SwitchStartA or SwitchStartB when SW_B is activated and SwitchEndA or SwitchEndB when SW_B is deactivated again. It comes with a huge set of parameters, configurations and optional sound effects. The sound names are self-explanatory: RailMoverStop, RailMoverWaitStart, RailMoverWaitStartMove, RailMoverRestartAtEnd, RailMoverWaiting, RailMoverMoveStart, RailMoverMoveLoop, RailMoverSignStart, RailMoverSignLoop, RailMoverStopAtPoint, RailMoverStopAtPointAfter, RailMoverStopAtPointLoop, RailMoverStopAtEnd, RailMoverStopAtEndAfter, RailMoverStopAtEndLoop, and RailMoverStopAtEndWithPlayerOn. Furthermore, it also supports the optional animations Move and RailMoveSign; the latter would be used when SignMotionType is set to a value representing the shaking behavior. Lastly, it can also use the stage effects Start, Moving, and Stop.

Obj_arg0.Name: Switch Particles Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies what particles to emit when SW_B is activated or deactivated. Default corresponds to setting it to 0.

Path_arg0.Name: Pose Type
Path_arg0.Description: The object's pose while moving on the path.

Values.Notes: Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)
Rotation affected by normal gravity (front is path direction, up is rough negated gravity)
Rotation affected by shadow gravity (front is rough path direction, up is negated gravity)

Path_arg1.Name: Movement Type
Path_arg1.Description: How the object behaves once it reaches the last path point.

Path_arg2.Name: Indicator Dots Type
Path_arg2.Description: Specifies whether the orange indicator dots should be used and how they are displayed.

Values.Notes: Draw dots but disappear one by one when passed by
Use bigger dots for path points
Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point
Moves once stepped on, needs to be stepped on again when it reaches the last point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_B.Description: If used, the object won't move until this switch gets activated. When activated or deactivated, special particle effects will be emitted.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The path that it moves on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: WanwanSearch
Classes.Notes: A silver, aggressive version of a Chomp that rolls around freely. It can be defeated with the Rainbow power-up, Stretch Plants and many other objects. Curiously, it is compatible with Chomp Hole (WanwanGoal), although the Chomp won't break apart.

Obj_arg0.Name: Destroy in DeathArea?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will be destroyed when it enters a DeathArea. Otherwise, it will just warp back to its initial position.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when it rolls into a Chomp Hole.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and frozen by player 2.

Classes.Name: WarpCube
Classes.Notes: An area that teleports the player to another linked WarpCube instance. Function-wise, it is similar to WarpPod. Unlike many other areas, it renders a green circle.

Obj_arg0.Name: Camera ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The camera ID used to retrieve the proper camera configuration.

Group.Description: Links two WarpCube instances.

Camera.Description: Used when the player teleports towards this object.

Classes.Name: WarpPod
Classes.Notes: A warp pad that teleports the player between this and another linked instance. It is also possible to hide the model entirely. In SMG1, some teleporters are unlocked using Grand Stars, however, this functionality is deprecated in SMG2. Furthermore, the colored paths do not exist in SMG2 anymore.

Obj_arg0.Name: Camera ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The camera ID used to retrieve the proper camera configuration.

Obj_arg1.Name: Visibility
Obj_arg1.Description: Can be used to hide the model.

Obj_arg2.Name: Useless
Obj_arg2.Description: Read but never used for anything.

Obj_arg3.Name: Paired Activation
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies if the teleporter can be used already of if the paired teleporter needs to be activated first.

Values.Notes: Can be used without further requirements
Paired teleporter needs to be activated first

Obj_arg4.Name: Required Grand Stars
Obj_arg4.Description: The number of Grand Stars required for activation. Deprecated in SMG2.

Obj_arg5.Name: Activation Time
Obj_arg5.Description: The time in frames it takes for the activation camera cutscene to finish when the teleporter activates for the first time.

Obj_arg6.Name: Color
Obj_arg6.Description: The color to be used for the glow effect and path. Default corresponds to setting it to 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: Appearance
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies if the path should emerge from this teleporter when the object appears.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Links two WarpPod instances.

Camera.Description: Used when the player teleports towards this object.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Classes.Name: WatchTowerRotateStep
Classes.Notes: A large rotating windmill with four platforms that move along with the windmill's frame. If registered to a cutscene, it will not move until its special cutscene nerve action gets triggered.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. Its cutscene nerve action will make it start moving.

Classes.Name: WaterArea
Classes.Notes: An area consisting of an invisible body of water that the player can swim in. Several other objects can interact with the water as well. It is not compatible with hemispherical volumes.

Obj_arg0.Name: Push Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: The speed to push the player when inside this area. Doesn't affect swimming on the water surface and doesn't work for spherical or hemispherical areas. For cube-shaped areas, the player will be pushed along the area's rotated Z axis. In cylindrical areas, however, the player will be pushed along the rotated Y axis.

Obj_arg1.Name: Water Type
Obj_arg1.Description: What kind of water this area holds. Cold water periodically damages the player.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: WaterFortressRain
Classes.Notes: Creates a rain effect. Requires an instance of TimeStopScreenEffect in the current stage. This can be created by a HipDropTimerSwitch with Obj_arg2 set to 2. If TimeStopScreenEffect becomes active, it will use slower particles instead.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

Classes.Name: WaterLeakPipe
Classes.Notes: A long pipe with a splashing water spout on the top. If the player touches the spout while using the Ice power-up, an ice platform appears. The player can stand on the platform while the power-up is active. If the player goes off the platform or looses their power-up, the platform disappears again. This object does not come with its own collision model.

Obj_arg0.Name: Pipe Height
Obj_arg0.Description: The pipe's length. Default is 500.

Classes.Name: WaterPlant
Classes.Notes: A group of decorative seaweed that can appear in many shapes. The seaweed attach to the nearest collision below them. If no collision is available, the individual plant may be placed at the origin of the galaxy.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Seaweed
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of seaweed to be placed. Default is 16.

Obj_arg1.Name: Placement Range
Obj_arg1.Description: The range in which the seaweed will be placed. Default is 500.

Obj_arg3.Name: Texture Frame
Obj_arg3.Description: The texture frame to be used. Default corresponds to setting it to 0.

Classes.Name: WaterPressure
Classes.Notes: A blue cannon that periodically shoots bubbles that trap the player inside upon contact. It cannot be destroyed through any means. The cannon can be set to rotate towards the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Cannon Rotation
Obj_arg0.Description: The rotation of the cannon in degrees. Default is 0.

Obj_arg1.Name: Wait Time
Obj_arg1.Description: The time in frames before it starts shooting again. Default is 300.

Obj_arg2.Name: Bubble Speed
Obj_arg2.Description: The movement speed of an individual bubble. Default is 30.

Obj_arg3.Name: Shot Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies how the object shoots bubbles and whether they are affected by gravity or not. Default corresponds to setting it to 0.

Obj_arg7.Name: Disable Popping?
Obj_arg7.Description: If set, the player can't pop the bubble by themself.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If used, the cannon will be rotated into its shooting position once this switch gets activated. It will be able to shoot bubbles in this state. Once the switch deactivates again, it enters its resting position again.

SW_B.Description: If used, it will only be able to shoot bubbles while this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: Animations, velocity and update rates are adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Group.Description: Groups several other WaterPressure instances. The one with the longest wait time becomes the "group leader". All instances will start shooting a bubble once the group leader is ready.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Camera.Description: Used when the player is trapped inside a bubble.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Player2Targetable.Description: The bubbles can be targeted, frozen and popped (SMG2 only) by player 2.

Classes.Name: WaterStream
Classes.Notes: An invisible water current that pushes compatible objects such as the player along a set path. The width and flow speed of the current can be adjusted.

Obj_arg3.Name: Affected By Gravity?
Obj_arg3.Description: If set, the ring's shape will be affected by gravity.

Obj_arg4.Name: Don't Push Into End?
Obj_arg4.Description: If set, objects won't be forcibly pushed into the last path point, however, they will still get pushed towards the end.

Point_arg0.Name: Flow Speed
Point_arg0.Description: The factor used to scale the flow speed. Default is 100.

Point_arg1.Name: Width Scale
Point_arg1.Description: The factor used to scale the current's width. Default is 12.

Rail.Description: The path that lays out the current's shape.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: WhiteSnowTree
Classes.Notes: A very simple object with a model and optional collision. It has no special capabilities.

Classes.Name: WingBlock
Classes.Notes: A winged ? Block that spawns items when hit. WingBlockCoin grants a single Coin whereas WingBlockStarPiece grants eight Star Bits when hit. It can move on a path or remain stationary.

Obj_arg0.Name: Movement Speed
Obj_arg0.Description: Sets the rate at which it moves on the path. Default is 4.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: The optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and opened by player 2.

Classes.Name: WireCoverCage
Classes.Notes: A generic map object with a model and collision that can use a different collision mesh if enabled.

Obj_arg0.Name: Use Tighter Collision?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, it will use a different collision mesh that is a bit tighter.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_DEAD.Description: Can be activated when the object is killed through a cutscene action.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene.

Classes.Name: WoodBox
Classes.Notes: A wooden box that can be destroyed through most of the player and enemy attacks. It can spawn various different items when destroyed.

Obj_arg0.Name: Coin Count
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of Coins to be spawned when destroyed. Default 1.

Obj_arg1.Name: Remnants Type
Obj_arg1.Description: Can be used to hide the broken remnants when destroyed.

Obj_arg2.Name: Star Bit Count
Obj_arg2.Description: The number of Star Bits to be spawned when destroyed. Default 0.

Obj_arg3.Name: Riddle SFX Type
Obj_arg3.Description: If enabled, will play a jingle when broken.

Obj_arg4.Name: 1-Up Type
Obj_arg4.Description: Can be used to specify whether a 1-Up Mushroom should be spawned or not.

Obj_arg7.Name: Power Star ID
Obj_arg7.Description: The scenario ID of the Power Star to be spawned. -1 does not register a Power Star.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together. The limit of objects is 32 in SMG1 and 96 in SMG2.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after destroying it. Requires Obj_arg7 to be set to a proper Power Star ID.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

Classes.Name: WoodLogBridge
Classes.Notes: A suspension bridge consisting of a variable amount of wood logs. It bounces when Ground Pounded by the player.

Obj_arg0.Name: Number of Logs
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of logs. Default is 32.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: WorldMapAccessPanel
Classes.Notes: A panel switch that will open the World Map screen when stepped on.

Obj_arg0.Name: Next World ID
Obj_arg0.Description: What World the player will be in after activating the panel.

Obj_arg1.Name: Next World Point
Obj_arg1.Description: What point on the World Map the player will be at after activating the panel. If set to -1, the player's current point on the World Map will be retained.

SW_A.Description: If used, it won't access the World Map. Instead, it triggers the cutscene マリオ顔惑星発進デモ起動 which is used when entering the World Map screen for the first time. After activating the panel, this switch will be activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the player enters the World Map.

DemoCast.Description: Tries to register to the cutscenes マリオ顔惑星変化 and ワールドマップからの開始. If registered to the former, it will be deactivated initially. For the latter, it can use a special cutscene functor that causes the screen to fade white. Furthermore, it may also use a special cutscene nerve meant to be used when the player returns from a World Map.

Classes.Name: WorldMapModel
Classes.Notes: A decorative background model that is meant to be placed around World Maps. Most objects can be linked to it using GeneratorId.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: WorldMapSky
Classes.Notes: A decorative background object that loads a different model depending on the World the player has currently selected. It follows the camera's position, so it's not possible for the player to reach the end of the model, unlike atmosphere objects. Furthermore, the models uss a projection map matrix.

Obj_arg0.Name: Mirror Reflection Type
Obj_arg0.Description: Specifies whether to use a reflection model or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Plays the "Change" animation if activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: WorldWarpPoint
Classes.Notes: A decorative portal from the World Map that appears depending on the currently selected point on the World Map. If the object is called WorldWarpPointEntrance, it will appear only if the player is near an entrance portal on the World Map; if the object is called WorldWarpPointExit, it will appear only if the player is near an exit portal on the World Map.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

DemoCast.Description: Registers to the cutscenes グランドスター帰還 and グランドスター帰還[ワールド２以降] which are used when the player returns to the Starship Mario after collecting a Grand Star. It can use a special cutscene nerve action that will start its "Next" animation.

Classes.Name: YellowChip
Classes.Notes: A collectable yellow chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a YellowChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn another object, for example a Launch Star. It's usually stationary, but it can move on a path as well.

Obj_arg0.Name: Yellow Chip Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object, the other Yellow Star Chips and their controller.

Obj_arg2.Name: Shadow Calculation
Obj_arg2.Description: If set, the shadow's drop direction will use the object's gravity vector instead of calculating the shadow direction once.

Obj_arg3.Name: Inside Bubble?
Obj_arg3.Description: If true, the chip will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

Obj_arg4.Name: Shadow Length
Obj_arg4.Description: Sets the shadow drop length. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg5.Name: Shadow Type
Obj_arg5.Description: Specifies the shadow model type.

Values.Notes: Start at nearest position on path

Path_arg5.Name: Snapping Speed
Path_arg5.Description: If used, the object stays at its original position and moves to its actual position on the path. This setting specifies how fast the object snaps back into its original position. The higher the value is, the slower it moves.

Point_arg0.Name: Movement Speed / Time
Point_arg0.Description: The movement speed the object has starting from this point. If Point_arg7 is set to 1, this specifies the time in frames it takes to reach the next point.

Point_arg1.Name: Acceleration Time
Point_arg1.Description: The time in frames it takes for the object to reach the movement speed set at this point.

Point_arg5.Name: Stop Time
Point_arg5.Description: The time in frames the object waits at this point before it continues moving again.

Point_arg7.Name: Speed Type
Point_arg7.Description: Decides whether Point_arg0 specifies the movement speed or the time it takes to reach the next point.

Values.Notes: Point_arg0 specifies time until next point

SignMotionType.Name: Shake Start Type
SignMotionType.Description: Specifies whether the object will shake before it starts moving or not.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_PARAM.Description: The path movement speed is adjusted with ParamScale while this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Rail.Description: Specifies the optional path that it can move on.

ClippingGroup.Description: Objects in this group are always clipped together.

Classes.Name: YellowChipGroup
Classes.Notes: Controls a group of Star Chips (YellowChip) and activates SW_A once all of them have been collected. It is recommended to have five Yellow Star Chips per group. The group for this object and the individual Yellow Star Chips has to be specified using Obj_arg0. This controller is also responsible for displaying the counter layout at the top of the screen.

Obj_arg0.Name: Yellow Chip Group ID
Obj_arg0.Description: The group ID of this object and its Yellow Star Chips.

Obj_arg1.Name: Time Limit
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies how long it takes before the Yellow Star Chips will disappear after activating its SW_APPEAR. Default is -1, which makes the objects appear indefinitely.

Obj_arg2.Name: Counter Display Range
Obj_arg2.Description: Specifies the range from this object that the player has to be within for the counter layout to be displayed. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg3.Name: Reactivation Type
Obj_arg3.Description: Specifies what to do with the individual chips after reloading the scene, for example after a death.

Values.Notes: Player has to collect items again after reloading the scene
Destroys chips after reloading the scene, SW_A won't be activated

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated when all linked Yellow Star Chips have been collected.

Classes.Name: YoshiBlock
Classes.Notes: A glitchy block that can be dashed into with Dash Yoshi which will cause them to disappear after a few seconds. It loads the texture from YoshiBlock.arc/YoshiBlock/YoshiBlockTex.bti, although this file does not exist anymore. For some reason, it can't be seen in first-person view or during intro camera cutscenes.

Classes.Name: YoshiCapture
Classes.Notes: A flower which Yoshi can grab with his tongue to swing himself in its direction. By default, the player can use it from any direction to move in any direction, but this can be restricted.

Obj_arg0.Name: Fixed Rotation
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, the rotation of the flower will be fixed.

Obj_arg1.Name: Invalidate Shadow?
Obj_arg1.Description: If set, its shadow will be invalidated.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and licked by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: YoshiCaptureGuidanceArea
Classes.Notes: If the player is riding Yoshi when inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Yoshi Grapples.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: YoshiEatGuidanceArea
Classes.Notes: If the player is riding Yoshi when inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to eat items with Yoshi. If Obj_arg0 is set, it will explain how to shoot projectiles with Yoshi instead, provided that he is carrying a projectile in his mouth.

Obj_arg0.Name: Projectile Tutorial?
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, this will explain how to shoot projectiles with Yoshi instead.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: Gets activated after displaying the tutorial once.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: YoshiEgg
Classes.Notes: An egg that can be cracked open to reveal Yoshi, the player's rideable dinosaur pal.

Obj_arg0.Name: Nest Type
Obj_arg0.Description: If set, only the nest will be shown at the start of the level. If another Yoshi returns to its egg, this nest will become available to use as a respawn point for Yoshi. This setting will be ignored if SW_APPEAR is used.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_A.Description: If set, the player will be unable to break open the egg until the switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Camera.Description: Used when the egg appears through SW_APPEAR.

DemoCast.Description: Can take part in a cutscene. It can use a special cutscene functor action which displays the explanation text for Yoshi when triggered.

MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.Description: Can be registered to a Starship Mario object appearance event.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2. Yoshi can be targeted and frozen.

Classes.Name: YoshiFruit
Classes.Notes: A fruit that can be eaten by Yoshi to reveal a Star Bit. Once ten of them have been eaten, the player receives a 1-Up. Can be destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and swung by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: YoshiFruitBig
Classes.Notes: A big fruit that can be eaten by Yoshi to reveal six Star Bits.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and swung by player 2.

YoshiTargetable.Description: Can be targeted and eaten by Yoshi.

Classes.Name: YoshiSendOffArea
Classes.Notes: If Yoshi is inside this area after the player dismounts him, he will play a special animation where he waves the player goodbye.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

Classes.Name: Yukkina
Classes.Notes: A snow boss that attacks the player by rolling into them. Its red nose can only be hit using Spin Attacks. After hitting it three times, it will be defeated which makes a Power Star appear. However, this requires a properly configured Scenario entry.

Obj_arg7.Name: Camera Register Index
Obj_arg7.Description: Specifies the starting index of the vector register camera.

SW_APPEAR.Description: Appears when this switch is activated.

AppearPowerStar.Description: Spawned after defeating it.

LinkNamePos.Description: Additional placements that need to be linked to the object.

Values.Notes: Player's position during the intro and ending cutscenes

Camera.Description: オープニングデモスキップ is used when skipping the intro cutscene.

BaseMtxFollowTarget.Description: Can be followed by another BaseMtxFollower object.

Classes.Name: YukkinaGroundSnow
Classes.Notes: A destroyable snow spike object that spawns a Coin after hitting it a set amount of times. When destroyed, the player has to walk away from it so that it can respawn.

Obj_arg0.Name: Hits Needed For Coin
Obj_arg0.Description: The number of required hits for it to spawn a Coin. The actual number of required hits will be Obj_arg0 % 4. Default is 0.

Player2Targetable.Description: Can be targeted and destroyed by player 2.

Classes.Name: ZeroGravityBox
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards collision triangles. This variant uses a box range and ignores the Range setting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The minimum distance used for calculating gravity speed. Default is 2000.

Obj_arg1.Name: Base Distance Axis
Obj_arg1.Description: Specifies the axis to use for calculating the distance from the requesting object to this area. Default is -1.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: ZeroGravityCylinder
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards collision triangles. This variant uses a cylindrical range and ignores the Range setting.

Obj_arg0.Name: Base Distance
Obj_arg0.Description: The minimum distance used for calculating the gravity speed. Default is 2000.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Classes.Name: ZeroGravitySphere
Classes.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards collision triangles. This variant uses a spherical range.

SW_A.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is activated.

SW_B.Description: If used, the gravity will be activated when this switch is not activated.

SW_AWAKE.Description: Enables rendering and resumes updates when this switch is active.

DemoSimpleCast.Description: Continues movement during cutscenes, NPC conversations, etc.

Objects.Name: Rightside Down -- Blank Moving Wood Platform
Objects.Notes: A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a blank surface.

Objects.Name: Rightside Down -- Checkered Moving Wood Platform
Objects.Notes: A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a checker patterned surface.

Objects.Name: Rightside Down -- Intro Planet
Objects.Notes: The decorative building blocks planet that can be seen at the beginning of Rightside Down Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Air Bubble
Objects.Notes: A bubble that restores the player's air when collected underwater.

Objects.Name: Air Bubble Generator
Objects.Notes: A nozzle that periodically generates air bubbles.

Objects.Name: Clockwork Ruins -- Luma Cage
Objects.Notes: The red metal cage from Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Underwater Planet
Objects.Notes: The large planet found in the 2D underwater section from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Sea Mine Planet
Objects.Notes: The large planet found in Cosmic Cove Galaxy's 2D section that features Jammyfish and Sea Mines.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Moving Gate
Objects.Notes: A moving metal gate from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Collision Push Movement Area [Sphere]
Objects.Notes: Moves compatible objects if they are on AreaMove collision triangles.

Objects.Name: Arrow Sign
Objects.Notes: A large arrow-shaped sign with a red outline.

Objects.Name: Arrow Switch
Objects.Notes: An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered.

Objects.Name: Multi-Use Arrow Switch
Objects.Notes: An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered. Can be triggered multiple times.

Objects.Name: Multi-Use Arrow Switch Target
Objects.Notes: A target that triggers a switch based off of the state of the ArrowSwitchMulti that it belongs to.

Objects.Name: Generic Space Junk Block [Unused]
Objects.Notes: A Space Junk block that retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo. However, no more models exist for this object.

Objects.Name: Blue Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A square-shaped Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Green Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A long Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Purple Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A tall Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Orange Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: An octagonal Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Red Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A triangular Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Small Icy Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A small square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Very Tall Icy Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A very tall square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Tall Icy Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A tall square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Narrow Icy Space Junk Block
