Objects.Notes: A narrow square-shaped icy version of a Space Junk Block.

Objects.Name: Timed Space Junk Block
Objects.Notes: A long rectangular transparent Space Junk Block; used in Bowser's Galaxy Reactor.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Silver Star Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet at the start of the Silver Star section in the first mission of Space Junk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Large Decorative Asteroids
Objects.Notes: A group of many large asteroids that serve as decoration.

Objects.Name: Small Decorative Asteroids
Objects.Notes: A group of many small asteroids that serve as decoration.

Objects.Name: 8-Bit Mario/Luigi Planet Parts
Objects.Notes: The lava, swamp platforms and large brick platform that serve as the basis of the 8-Bit Mario/Luigi planet from Toy Time Galaxy and Mario Squared Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Toy Time -- Yellow Rotating Platform
Objects.Notes: A yellow rotating platform used on the 8-Bit Mario planet in Toy Time Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Medium Decorative Asteroids
Objects.Notes: A group of many medium-sized asteroids that serve as decoration.

Objects.Name: Lush Decorative Asteroids
Objects.Notes: A group of many lush asteroids that serve as decoration.

Objects.Name: Moving Asteroid Cluster
Objects.Notes: A group of many small asteroids that can move on a path.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Grassy Region
Objects.Notes: The section of the Comet Observatory where the Terrace and the Fountain are located.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Library Region
Objects.Notes: The section of the Comet Observatory where the Kitchen and the Bedroom are located.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Upper Region
Objects.Notes: The section of the Comet Observatory where the Engine Room and the Garden are located.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Big Slope
Objects.Notes: The big slope found below the Engine Room in the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Beacon Holder
Objects.Notes: The two cones that hold the Beacon in place in the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Peak
Objects.Notes: The top of the Comet Observatory where a 1-Up can be found.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Kitchen Steps
Objects.Notes: The steps that lead up to the Kitchen in the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory Change Stage Area [Cube]
Objects.Notes: An area that will exit the current scene and start another one. For example, this is used to go to the different Domes on the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Gateway Planet
Objects.Notes: The small planet from the Comet Observatory that leads to Gateway Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory Beacon
Objects.Notes: The glowing Beacon that serves as the engine of the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory Star Countdown
Objects.Notes: The number located at the start of the Comet Observatory that counts down the amount of stars you need to finish the game.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Beacon Ring
Objects.Notes: The red-purple ring found around the Beacon in the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Decorative Gears
Objects.Notes: The rotating gears found inside the glass of the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Dome -- Interior
Objects.Notes: The interior of a Dome.

Objects.Name: Level Select Asteroids
Objects.Notes: A group of many rotating asteroids that are found in the galaxy select of the Domes.

Objects.Name: Level Select Pull Star
Objects.Notes: A variation of the Pull Star that takes you to the galaxy select within Domes.

Objects.Name: Level Select Comet
Objects.Notes: The decoration used when a galaxy in the galaxy select has a Comet.

Objects.Name: Level Select Miniature Comet Observatory
Objects.Notes: A small version of the Comet Observatory that can be seen when the player flies to a galaxy in a Dome.

Objects.Name: Level Select Fly-Out Cutscene
Objects.Notes: Sets up the cutscene for when the player flies to a galaxy in a Dome.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Dome
Objects.Notes: The entrances to the several Domes in the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Level Select Controller
Objects.Notes: A controller for the galaxy select in the Domes.

Objects.Name: Dome Sky
Objects.Notes: The starry ocean sky models used in the Domes.

Objects.Name: Bigmouth Sky
Objects.Notes: The starry ocean sky model from Bigmouth Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Library Exterior
Objects.Notes: The exterior of the Comet Observatory's library.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory Map Screen
Objects.Notes: A huge screen that displays the map of the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Show Comet Observatory Labels Area [Cylinder]
Objects.Notes: Displays the labels for the different parts of the Comet Observatory. Requires an actual AstroOverlookObj placed in the stage.

Objects.Name: Show Comet Observatory Labels Controller
Objects.Notes: A controller that will show the name labels for the different parts of the Comet Observatory if the player stands inside an AstroOverlookAreaCylinder.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Garage
Objects.Notes: The garage section in which the Toad Brigade's Starshroom is parked.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Library Interior
Objects.Notes: The interior of the Comet Observatory's Library.

Objects.Name: Comet Observatory -- Green Rotating Platforms

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Room
Objects.Notes: The power-up display room used on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Room Wall
Objects.Notes: A wall used for the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Chance Cube
Objects.Notes: A die block that can spawn either ten Coins, a Goomba or a 1-Up Mushroom.

Objects.Name: Spin Drill
Objects.Notes: A drill power-up that allows the player to dig through certain dirt upon spinning.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Room Door
Objects.Notes: The door that warps the player to the power-up display room on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Power-Up Display Case
Objects.Notes: A display case for the power-up display room used on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Jammyfish
Objects.Notes: A small white jellyfish that can be defeated with a spin attack.

Objects.Name: Jellyfish
Objects.Notes: A big blue jellyfish that causes electrical damage to the player if they touch it.

Objects.Name: Koopa Shell
Objects.Notes: A Koopa shell; can be carried around, thrown and ridden underwater.

Objects.Name: Boulder Bowl -- Crystal Planet
Objects.Notes: The small orange crystal planet used near the end of the first mission of Boulder Bowl Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Bowser Land Mine
Objects.Notes: A land mine with Bowser's emblem on the trigger that charges and explodes upon contact. It regenerates after a few seconds.

Objects.Name: Battlerock -- Colorful Molecule Planet
Objects.Notes: The multicolored molecule-like planet.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Megahammer Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where Megahammer is fought in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Megahammer Planet Platform
Objects.Notes: A long yellow platform that can be destroyed if it is hit by Megahammer.

Objects.Name: Lakitu
Objects.Notes: A Koopa that sits on a cloud and throws Spinys at the player.

Objects.Name: Dusty Dune -- Large Quicksand Planet
Objects.Notes: The large quicksand planet seen in the background of Dusty Dune Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Jump Beamer
Objects.Notes: A robot-like enemy that emits electrical rings. Its head can be used as a spring.

Objects.Name: Battlerock -- Jump Beamer Interior Section
Objects.Notes: The large interior section with a Jump Beamer that leads outside.

Objects.Name: Swing Pole
Objects.Notes: A pole that can be swung from and jumped off of; used in Deep Dark Galaxy and Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Jump Guarder
Objects.Notes: A stationary green robot enemy that launches several Topminis when the player comes near it. The head can be bounced off by the player.

Objects.Name: Star Ball Launcher
Objects.Notes: A hole that launches a Star Ball along a path.

Objects.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Paintbrush Planet Star Ball Launcher
Objects.Notes: The Star Ball launcher used on the second planet of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Disk Planet Star Ball Launcher
Objects.Notes: The Star Ball launcher used on the third planet of Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Spoing
Objects.Notes: A fuzzy jumping spider enemy used in a few galaxies, such as Space Junk Galaxy and Tall Trunks Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Ground Pound Spring
Objects.Notes: A spring that bounces the player into the air when Ground Pounding it.

Objects.Name: Jump Spring
Objects.Notes: A blue spring that bounces the player into the air when jumping on it.

Objects.Name: Jack O' Goomba
Objects.Notes: A Goomba with a pumpkin mask on its head; used in ghost-themed galaxies, such as Ghostly Galaxy and Flash Black Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Fireball Magikoopa
Objects.Notes: A Magikoopa that casts fireballs.

Objects.Name: Mini Goomba Magikoopa
Objects.Notes: A Magikoopa that casts Mini Goombas.

Objects.Name: Li'l Cinder Magikoopa
Objects.Notes: A Magikoopa that casts Li'l Cinders.

Objects.Name: Deep Dark -- Ghost Ship
Objects.Notes: The ghost ship seen inside the cave of Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Kamella's Airship
Objects.Notes: The purple airship where Kamella is fought in Space Junk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Blue Crabber
Objects.Notes: A blue crab enemy that runs away from the player. Drops a 1-Up when defeated.

Objects.Name: Red Crabber
Objects.Notes: A red crab enemy that runs towards the player. Drops Star Bits when defeated.

Objects.Name: Slurple
Objects.Notes: A small blue enemy that will stick onto player if they get near it. If the enemy is not defeated, it will begin to damage the player.

Objects.Name: Dry Bones
Objects.Notes: A dead skeleton of a Koopa Troopa.

Objects.Name: Key
Objects.Notes: A key that activates a switch when collected.

Objects.Name: Kick Rock
Objects.Notes: A small rock that will spawn either a Coin or a Star Bit when kicked.

Objects.Name: Double Bullet Bill Blaster
Objects.Notes: A pair of opposite-facing cannons. The Bullet Bills have to be added as a separate object.

Objects.Name: Cannon Blaster
Objects.Notes: A cannon that periodically shoots a force that will damage the player.

Objects.Name: Triple Bullet Bill Blaster
Objects.Notes: An unused set of three cannons that shoot Bullet Bills. Also features a large hole that fits a Chomp. The enemies have to be added as separate objects.

Objects.Name: Bullet Bill Undergrunt Gunner
Objects.Notes: An Undergrunt Gunner that shoots Bullet Bills.

Objects.Name: Rollodillo
Objects.Notes: The armadillo boss fought at the end of Boulder Bowl Galaxy's first mission.

Objects.Name: 1-Up Mushroom Picture
Objects.Notes: A picture of a 1-Up Mushroom.

Objects.Name: Honeyhive -- Light Wood Mushroom Planet
Objects.Notes: A light wood mushroom-shaped planet.

Objects.Name: Honeyhive -- Dark Wood Mushroom Planet
Objects.Notes: A dark wood mushroom-shaped planet.

Objects.Name: Toad
Objects.Notes: A generic Toad NPC.

Objects.Name: Toad [Comet Observatory]
Objects.Notes: A special Toad NPC variant for the Comet Observatory. This object is also required for a functional Mailtoad.

Objects.Name: Banktoad
Objects.Notes: A special Toad NPC that allows the player to deposit and withdraw Star Bits.

Objects.Name: Mail Toad
Objects.Notes: A special Toad NPC that delivers letters to the player.

Objects.Name: Underwater Mine
Objects.Notes: A stationary mine used in Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Moving Underwater Mine
Objects.Notes: A moving underwater mine used in Deep Dark Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Lava Lair]
Objects.Notes: The Bowser boss fought at the end of Bowser's Lava Lair.

Objects.Name: Decorative Falling Crystal
Objects.Notes: A crystal cage that falls from the sky during Bowser's attack in the opening storybook level.

Objects.Name: Peach's Castle -- Decorative Bowser Portal
Objects.Notes: The large portal that Bowser disappears through during the intro sequence at Peach's Castle.

Objects.Name: Lava Lair -- Bowser Battle Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where Bowser is fought in Bowser's Lava Lair.

Objects.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Bowser Battle Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where Bowser is fought in Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Bowser Battle Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where Bowser is fought in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Green Plate
Objects.Notes: A standalone version of the green metal plates seen during the boss battles against Bowser. They release a Coin when smashed by Bowser.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Bronze Plate
Objects.Notes: A standalone version of the bronze plates seen during the boss battles against Bowser. They release Star Bits when smashed by Bowser.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Small Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser galaxies. It breaks after a set amount of time.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Large Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A large green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser galaxies. It breaks after a set amount of time.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Curved Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A green and white turning platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser galaxies. It breaks after a set amount of time.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Appearing Curved Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A green and white turning platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser galaxies. It appears after a set amount of time.

Objects.Name: Bowser Fight Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used during the fights against Bowser in Bowser's Lava Lair, Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet and Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Lava Sphere
Objects.Notes: A large decorative sphere of lava.

Objects.Name: Lava Lair -- Tower with Torch
Objects.Notes: A background tower with a torch used in Bowser's Lava Lair.

Objects.Name: Bowser's Throne
Objects.Notes: The planet where Bowser waits for the player before battling them. The throne has no actual collision.

Objects.Name: Final Bowser Battle Position
Objects.Notes: Marks the position of the final boss fight against Bowser in Bowser's Galaxy Generator that takes place in the sky.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Grand Star Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where the player finds both Princess Peach and the final Grand Star; used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Boomsday Machine
Objects.Notes: The large tank boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Boom Bunker -- Dark Cloud Platform
Objects.Notes: A dark cloud platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker as well as Cloudy Court Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Fiery Flotilla -- Castle Gate
Objects.Notes: The large gate used in Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla.

Objects.Name: Fiery Flotilla -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla.

Objects.Name: Boom Bunker -- Boomsday Machine Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where the Boomsday Machine is fought in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Boomsday Machine Fan
Objects.Notes: A large metal fan used during the Boomsday Machine battle in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Airship Armada -- Large Cannon Airship
Objects.Notes: A large airship with rows of several cannons on the sides.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Launch Star Platforms
Objects.Notes: The set of platforms where the Launch Star to the Megahammer planet in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet is found.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Asteroid Planet
Objects.Notes: An asteroid-like planet seen in the background of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Yellow Moving Platform
Objects.Notes: A striped yellow moving platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Yellow Moving Platform for Generator
Objects.Notes: A dummy object that represents an individual platform generated by a KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator.

Objects.Name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator
Objects.Notes: An object that generates the yellow platforms used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Starting Platforms
Objects.Notes: The set of platforms used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- Checkpoint Platform
Objects.Notes: A single platform used near the checkpoint of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Boom Bunker Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Airship Armada -- Airship
Objects.Notes: A generic airship with a small wood pedestal on the stern.

Objects.Name: Megahammer
Objects.Notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Boom Bunker -- Destroyed Megahammer Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Bowser Jr.'s Airship
Objects.Notes: A small airship steered by Bowser Jr. himself, which is the boss of Bowser Jr.'s Airship Armada.

Objects.Name: Airship Armada -- Airship Platform
Objects.Notes: A small moving airship-styled platform.

Objects.Name: Airship Armada -- Decorative Path Marker
Objects.Notes: A line of tiny decorative orange dots that serve as a visual marker of the moving airship platform's path.

Objects.Name: Bowser Jr. Statue
Objects.Notes: A destroyable statue of Bowser Jr.

Objects.Name: Final Bowser Fight Sky
Objects.Notes: The vortex sky used during the final fight against Bowser in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Lava Lair -- Moving Wood Platform
Objects.Notes: A wooden platform where a ground pound switch is found in Bowser's Lava Lair.

Objects.Name: Lava Lair -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser's Lava Lair.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Gravity Gauntlet]
Objects.Notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Meteors Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where some meteors and the large Bowser door are found at the end of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Moving Wood Platform
Objects.Notes: A moving wood platform used near the start of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Galaxy Generator]
Objects.Notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Stone Seesaw Platform
Objects.Notes: A stone seesaw platform used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Tiny Bowser
Objects.Notes: A tiny version of Bowser used in the end credits.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Power-Up Switch Holder
Objects.Notes: A controller for Bowser battles that activates several switches depending on Bowser's current power-up state.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Reset Appearance Controller
Objects.Notes: A controller that causes Bowser's model to appear if it's not appeared yet.

Objects.Name: Red Bowser Door
Objects.Notes: The large red door with three chained seals that is found at the end of Bowser galaxies.

Objects.Name: Purple Bowser Door
Objects.Notes: The large purple door with a large seal that is found midway through Bowser's Lava Lair.

Objects.Name: Generic Airship
Objects.Notes: A generic airship that is used in Space Junk Galaxy, Bowser's Airship Armada and Fleet Glide Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Triple Propeller Airship
Objects.Notes: A standard airship with three propellers on top.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Airship with Interior
Objects.Notes: An airship with an interior room below deck.

Objects.Name: Airship Armada -- Bowser Jr. Battle Airship
Objects.Notes: The airship where the player fights Bowser Jr.'s Airship.

Objects.Name: Peach's Castle -- Airship
Objects.Notes: A decorative airship with rows of cannons on the sides.

Objects.Name: Airship Manhole
Objects.Notes: A manhole found on certain airships.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Airship Seesaw Bridge
Objects.Notes: A seesaw-like bridge used on one of the airships in the second mission.

Objects.Name: Bowser Statue
Objects.Notes: A destroyable statue of Bowser.

Objects.Name: Turning Bowser Statue
Objects.Notes: A statue of Bowser that can turn around. The actual laser is created using an ElectricRail object.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle General Switch Holder
Objects.Notes: A controller for Bowser battles that handles the switch for activating the battle, the switches that get activated during a phase change and the switch that gets activated when defeating Bowser.

Objects.Name: Bowser Battle Appearance Switch Holder
Objects.Notes: A controller for Bowser battles that handles the switches that make Bowser appear.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Star Reactor]
Objects.Notes: The first Bowser battle, which takes place on a glass planet with a green metal frame.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Bowser Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: The tower planet with three smaller towers and several slim ones arranged on a stone brick ring, on which Bowser awaits the player for battle.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Moving Red Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small moving red square metal platform.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Moving Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: A small moving square stone platform.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Gravity Panel Planet
Objects.Notes: A castle-styled 2D gravity panel planet with some red carpet platforms.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Moving Green Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small moving and rotating green square metal platform.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Moving Yellow Gravity Ramp Platform
Objects.Notes: A small moving and rotating yellow square metal platform with a slight gravity ramp on one edge.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Spiral Road Pipe Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet featuring the head of a large green pipe as an archway and a spiraling road of colored blocks.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor -- Red Carpet Stairway
Objects.Notes: A stone stairway with red carpet.

Objects.Name: Star Reactor Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Star Reactor, Bowser's Lava Lair and Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Dark Matter Plant]
Objects.Notes: The second Bowser battle, which takes place on a bronze mesh planet with a stone brick frame.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving 2D Long Blue Platform
Objects.Notes: A long metallic moving blue platform with red edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving 2D Slim Green Platform
Objects.Notes: A slim metallic moving green platform with blue edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving 2D T-Shaped Purple Platform
Objects.Notes: A T-shaped metallic moving purple platform with red edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving 2D Cross-Shaped White Platform
Objects.Notes: A cross-shaped metallic moving white platform with yellow edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving 2D L-Shaped Yellow Platform
Objects.Notes: An L-shaped metallic moving yellow platform with red edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving 2D Yellow Platform
Objects.Notes: A metallic moving yellow platform with red edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- 2D Decorative Path Markers
Objects.Notes: Several lines of tiny decorative crystals that serve as a visual marker of the moving platform paths.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Dark Matter Clipping Hole
Objects.Notes: A small cube that is used to indicate a hole of Dark Matter.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Dark Matter [Two Cubes]
Objects.Notes: A pair of cubes of Dark Matter arranged diagonally.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Dark Matter [Cylinder]
Objects.Notes: A large cylinder of Dark Matter with a quarter of its outer circle missing.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Dark Matter [Long Rectangle with Cube]
Objects.Notes: A very long rectangle of Dark Matter with a small cube of dark matter attached diagonally on one end.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Dark Matter [Cube]
Objects.Notes: A large cube of Dark Matter.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Dark Matter [Slim Rectangle]
Objects.Notes: An unused long and slim rectangle of Dark Matter.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Triple Moving Pink Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of three long checkered pink moving platforms arranged in an ascending diagonal formation.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Triple Moving Bright Dark Matter
Objects.Notes: A set of three moving long bright Dark Matter rectangles arranged in an ascending diagonal formation.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Holed Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: A big square stone platform with a circular hole in the center.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- L-Shaped Green Carpet Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: An L-shaped stone platform with a green carpet.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Long Rounded Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: An unused long stone platform with round edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Green Carpet Stone Balcony
Objects.Notes: A big square stone balcony platform with a dark brick wall and a small green carpet staircase leading up into it.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- L-Shaped Green Carpet Ramp Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: An L-shaped stone platform with green carpet leading to a small gravity ramp.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- C-Shaped Green Carpet Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: An inwards C-shaped stone platform with a green carpet.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Green Carpet Step Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: A stone platform with a step and a green carpet.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Bowser Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: The short tower planet surrounded by four slim towers, on which Bowser awaits the player for battle.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Large Gravity Panel Planet
Objects.Notes: A large castle-styled 2D gravity switching planet with large blobs of dark matter.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Small Gravity Panel Planet
Objects.Notes: A small castle-styled 2D gravity switching planet with green carpet through the floor.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Rotating Pink & Yellow Metal Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of four curved pink and yellow metal platforms arranged on a circle.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Curved Moving Yellow & Red Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small curved moving yellow square metal platform with red metal edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving Yellow & Blue Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small moving yellow square metal platform with blue metal edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving Curved Dark Matter
Objects.Notes: A moving curved Dark Matter square.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Moving Dark Matter
Objects.Notes: A moving Dark Matter square.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Solid Large Stair Platform
Objects.Notes:
A large green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser galaxies. 

Unlike the other Bowser Battle Stair Platform objects this one does not break after a set amount of time.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Revolving Yellow & Green Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small revolving yellow square metal platform with green metal edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Curved Revolving Yellow & Green Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small curved revolving yellow square metal platform with green metal edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Curved Moving Yellow & Green Metal Platform
Objects.Notes: A small curved moving yellow square metal platform with green metal edges.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant -- Circular Green Carpet Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: A circular stone platform with a green carpet going outwards of it.

Objects.Name: Dark Matter Plant Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used in Bowser's Dark Matter Plant.

Objects.Name: Bowser [Galaxy Reactor]
Objects.Notes: The final Bowser battle, which takes place across three different planets.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Circular Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A large green and white circular platform with a connector platform extending outwards that makes up the beginning of the long stairs. Unlike other stair platforms, this one does not break.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Bowser Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: The tower planet with rows of slim towers on the sides, on which Bowser awaits the player for battle.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Castle Wall Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet made out of stone floors and ruined dark brick walls featuring a high tower.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Lava Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: A large hollow tower planet with inner walls of lava and many stone platforms, Bullet Bill cannons and Banzai Bill cannons.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Dry Ice Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet entirely of deadly dry ice with a large snowy rock column.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Colossal Hollow Lava Planet Interior
Objects.Notes: A standalone variant of the colossal lava planet's interior.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Colossal Hollow Lava Planet Exterior
Objects.Notes: A standalone version of the galaxy-sized hollow spherical lava planet with holes.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Gravity Panel Wall
Objects.Notes: A blue and pink gravity panel wall seen in the Space Junk blocks section.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Small Rotating Sand Brick Circle
Objects.Notes: A small rotating circle of sand brick blocks.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Large Rotating Sand Brick Circle
Objects.Notes: A large rotating circle of sand brick blocks arranged in a zigzag-like pattern.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Rotating Molten Tar Disk
Objects.Notes: A dark rotating disk of molten tar.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Rotating Green Metal Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of three bent green metal platforms arranged on a circle facing inwards.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Reactor -- Quicksand Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet entirely of deadly quicksand featuring a few sandy platforms.

Objects.Name: Flipbug
Objects.Notes: A small bug-like enemy that attacks the player in Bee form and runs away from the player under normal conditions.

Objects.Name: Goomba
Objects.Notes: The infamous Goomba enemy that appeared in most Mario games since 1985.

Objects.Name: Big Goomba
Objects.Notes: A big Goomba that appears in Gateway Galaxy and the Supermassive Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Fluffy Bluff -- Circular Fence
Objects.Notes: A circular fence that is used in The Chimp's challenge in Fluffy Buff Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Mini Goomba
Objects.Notes: A small round Goomba that drops one Coin when jumped on and a Star Bit if spun (always a Coin in SMG1).

Objects.Name: Long Chain
Objects.Notes: A long chain of configurable length.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Small Sinking Platform
Objects.Notes: A small platform that sinks into the lava in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Tide Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used for the secret Star mission.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Tide
Objects.Notes: The lava tide that periodically shrinks and rises.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Large Sinking Platform
Objects.Notes: A large platform that sinks into the lava in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- Star Chip Cube Planet
Objects.Notes: The small cube planet that appears on the third star in the Dreadnought Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Battlerock -- Topmaniac's Planet
Objects.Notes: The large UFO planet where Topmaniac is fought in Battlerock Galaxy and Dreadnought Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- UFO Planet
Objects.Notes: The UFO planet used at the start of the third mission of Dreadnought Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Destroyed UFO
Objects.Notes: A destroyed UFO used in the background of the first mission.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Bridge Segment
Objects.Notes: A small bridge segment that collapses when stepped on.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Gem Boulder
Objects.Notes: A large collapsing boulder consisting of many red gems.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Round Tipping Platform
Objects.Notes: A round tipping rock platform used at the start of the Lava Spire section.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Long Tipping Platform
Objects.Notes: A long tipping rock platform used at the start of the Lava Spire section.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Tipping Stair Platform
Objects.Notes: A tipping rock stair platform used at the start of the Lava Spire section.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Wide Tipping Platform
Objects.Notes: A wide tipping rock platform used at the start of the Lava Spire section.

Objects.Notes: The planet where you dodge Lava Bubbles and Cheep Cheeps in Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Notes: The C-shaped planet with several falling meteors and Thwomps.

Objects.Notes: The planet with Banzai Bills and the Spin Drill used in Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Notes: A set of columns used on the Lava Spire planet.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Lava Spire Rock Columns B
Objects.Notes: A set of columns used on the Lava Spire planet.

Objects.Notes: A trapezoid-shaped platform that sinks when the player stands on it.

Objects.Notes: A tall blue platform that sinks when stepped on.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Blue Sinking Platform
Objects.Notes: A blue platform that sinks when stepped on.

Objects.Notes: The first planet of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Name: Galaxy Generator -- Starting Planet Rotating Platform
Objects.Notes: The rotating platform used on the first planet of Bowser's Galaxy Generator.

Objects.Notes: A lava geyser used in lava-themed galaxies.

Objects.Name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Long Slanted Sinking Platform
Objects.Notes: The long green sinking platform used on the starting planet.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet featuring the tall volcano and several lava ponds.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Sinking Seesaw Platform
Objects.Notes: A pair of two purple sinking platforms that are connected by a huge stone block.

Objects.Notes: An effect consisting of falling volcano rocks that is used inside Melty Molten Galaxy's volcano.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Volcano Eruption
Objects.Notes: The volcano eruption effect used in Melty Molten Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- Rising Volcano Lava
Objects.Notes: The rising lava used inside the volcano.

Objects.Notes: The large lava sphere planet.

Objects.Name: Melty Molten -- J-Shaped Planet
Objects.Notes: The large J-shaped planet that features the Bullet Bill cannons.

Objects.Name: Underwater Plant
Objects.Notes:
A decorative plant for underwater sections. There is only one shape model, so ShapeModelNo has to be set to 0. The available texture frames are:
- 0 Lime
- 1 Red
- 2 Wavy, green
- 3 Orange
- 4 Smooth, green

Objects.Name: Spawn Point

Objects.Notes: An area that restricts movement to a 2D plane when entered.

A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:

- 3 White
1 Short Bush
2 Mushrooms
3 Clover
4 Dead Bush
5 Red Flower
- 0 Red
- 1 White
6 Bubbly Flower
7 Yellow Flower
- 0 Blue
- 1 Yellow
8 Tall Bush

Objects.Notes:
A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:
0 Tulips
- 0 Pink
- 1 Yellow
- 2 Purple
3 Lily of the Valley

Objects.Name: Decorative Plant C
Objects.Notes:
A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:
0 Cosmos
1 Round Bush
- 0 Pink
- 1 Red
- 2 White

Objects.Name: Decorative Plant D
Objects.Notes:
A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different plants. The following shape IDs and colors are available:
1 Lily
- 0 Red
- 1 Pink
- 2 Yellow
- 3 White
2 Sunflower

Objects.Name: Space Mine
Objects.Notes: A space mine that explodes upon contact.

Objects.Name: Space Mine Line Marker
Objects.Notes: A red marker that is used to highlight the movement of a Space Mine.

Objects.Name: Space Mine Circle Marker
Objects.Notes: A red marker that is used to highlight the movement of a Space Mine.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Decorative Disk-Shaped Rock
Objects.Notes: A decorative disk-shaped rock from the Pull Stars section.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Decorative L-Shaped Rock
Objects.Notes: A decorative L-shaped rock from the Pull Stars section.

Objects.Name: Destroyable Yellow Moving Platform
Objects.Notes: A thick yellow moving platform from Dreadnought Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy. It can break apart after being hit by an enemy's explosion.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Long Decorative Rock
Objects.Notes: A long decorative rock that is placed around the Pull Stars section in Space Junk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Short Decorative Rock
Objects.Notes: A long decorative rock that is placed around the Pull Stars section in Space Junk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Bright Spherical Atmosphere
Objects.Notes: A bright spherical atmosphere that surrounds planets in Gateway Galaxy and Drip Drop Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Boom Bunker -- Red Rotating Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of red rotating platforms used on the cloud Ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Boom Bunker -- Blue Rotating Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of blue rotating platforms used on the cloud Ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

Objects.Name: Spherical Bonus Room
Objects.Notes: A colorful spherical bonus room.

Objects.Name: Star Ball Boost Rail
Objects.Notes: An invisible rail for the Star Ball that boosts its rolling speed. It also causes the player to roll on the Star Ball.

Objects.Name: Spherical Item Selector
Objects.Notes: A handler which controls the selection of spherical items, like Dome warps or file select profiles.

Objects.Name: Tarantox Sling Pod
Objects.Notes: A variant of the Sling Pod used on Tarantox's planet in Space Junk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Tarantox Coin
Objects.Notes: A Coin trapped in Tarantox's web that can be released by pointing at it.

Objects.Name: Tarantox Stone Block
Objects.Notes: A destroyable stone block that appears on Tarantox's planet as well as the beach in Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Cloud Flower Platform [Unusable]
Objects.Notes: A single cloud platform created by the Cloud power-up. Does nothing when placed directly, though.

Objects.Name: Cloud Direction Controller Area
Objects.Notes: This area controls and sets the facing direction of Cloud Flower platforms created inside it.

Objects.Name: Cloud Flower
Objects.Notes: A Cloud Flower that turns the player into a Cloud character, which allows them to create up to three temporary cloud platforms.

Objects.Name: Cloud Flower [Duplicate]
Objects.Notes: An unused duplicate of the Cloud Flower object.

Objects.Name: Sling Star
Objects.Notes: A small star-shaped ring that slings the player upwards or from one place to another.

Objects.Name: Supermassive -- Large Pipe Planet
Objects.Notes: The large green pipe planet used in Supermassive Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Spin Tutorial Area
Objects.Notes: An area that tells the player how to use the Spin Attack when entered.

Objects.Name: Spin Tutorial Area [Cube]
Objects.Notes: An area that tells the player how to use the Spin Attack when entered.

Objects.Name: Lever Switch
Objects.Notes: A small blue switch that activates a switch when flipped over.

Objects.Name: Lockable Lever Switch
Objects.Notes: A variant of SpinLeverSwitch that automatically flips over and locks irreversibly in the activated position if its SW_B gets activated, making it unusable. See Fiery Flotilla's starting planet for an example use case and setup.

Objects.Name: Spinning ? Box
Objects.Notes: A colorful flat box that slides on the ground. It releases three Star Bits when destroyed.

Objects.Name: Spin Switch Area
Objects.Notes: An area that toggles a switch when the player uses the Spin Attack inside this area.

Objects.Name: Splashing Coins ? Block
Objects.Notes: A ? Block that drops some Coins when hit.

Objects.Name: Splashing Star Bits ? Block
Objects.Notes: A ? Block that drops Star Bits when hit.

Objects.Name: Fill Blue Matter Splatter Surface Controller [Broken]
Objects.Notes: A broken controller that would have rendered Matter Splatter surfaces with a dark blueish overlay. Does not work because its rendering is not enabled.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- Water Jet Effect
Objects.Notes: A water jet effect used on the rising water planet.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- Floating Grass Stairs
Objects.Notes: A floating grass stairs platform used on the rising water planet.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- Floating Grass Platform
Objects.Notes: A floating grass platform used on the rising water planet.

Objects.Name: Dreadnought -- Rising Water Planet
Objects.Notes: The spherical metal planet that features several tower-like structures.

Objects.Name: Ending Credits -- Decorative Comet
Objects.Notes: A comet that appears near the end of the game's ending credits.

Objects.Name: Ending Credits -- Decorative Starship Mario
Objects.Notes: A decorative image of Starship Mario that appears during the game's ending credits.

Objects.Name: Credits Sequence Object Holder
Objects.Notes: A holder that creates and registers several objects that appear during the credits sequence as well as the scrolling text.

Objects.Name: Credits Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used in the credits that consists of several overlapped sky models.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Water Splash Effect
Objects.Notes: A splashing water effect that appears during the second mission of Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Main Planet
Objects.Notes: The main planet used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Cove -- Waterfall Splashes Effect [Duplicate]
Objects.Notes: A standalone duplicate of the waterfall splash effects seen on Cosmic Cove Galaxy's main planet.

Objects.Name: "StardustHillPlanet"
Objects.Notes: An unused hemispherical grass planet that can be seen in the level selection model for Good Egg Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Large Crystal Planet
Objects.Notes: The big crystal planet found near the start.

Objects.Name: "StarDustStar" [Unused]
Objects.Notes: A strange unfinished planet with several hills, including a question mark-shaped one.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The rectangular disk-shaped planet used at the start of the first mission.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Stone Platform with Pedestal
Objects.Notes: The stone platform with a small pedestal that is used in the second mission.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: The small stone platform that is used in the second mission.

Objects.Name: Good Egg -- Yoshi Egg Planet
Objects.Notes: The large Yoshi egg-like planet.

Objects.Name: Good Egg -- Pear Planet
Objects.Notes: The green pear-shaped planet.

Objects.Name: Good Egg -- Large Boulders Planet
Objects.Notes: The red rock planet that features rolling boulders.

Objects.Name: Good Egg -- Tall Grass Tower Planet
Objects.Notes: The tall grass tower planet that is created by the Hungry Luma.

Objects.Name: Good Egg -- Large Star Planet
Objects.Notes: The large star-shaped planet.

Objects.Name: Star List Sign
Objects.Notes: The sign that displays the Star List on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: "StarManFort" [Unused]
Objects.Notes: The infamous unused large fortress planet that was scrapped during development.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Decorative Star Bits Planet
Objects.Notes: A small decorative planet where some Star Bits appear.

Objects.Name: Star Bit
Objects.Notes: The game's main collectible, aside from Coins.

Objects.Name: Blue Star Bit Crystal
Objects.Notes: A large blue crystal that is used on Launch Star paths. In SMG2, it breaks once the player touches it.

Objects.Name: Breaking Star Bit Cluster Effect
Objects.Notes: An effect that consists of many blue crystals particles.

Objects.Name: Rock Mushroom Star Bit Crystal
Objects.Notes: A small blue crystal that releases some Star Bits or Coins when broken using the Rock power-up; used in Melty Monster Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Moving Star Bit Group
Objects.Notes: Creates a group of Star Bits that move on a set path.

Objects.Name: Star Bit Flower
Objects.Notes: A small flower that reveals its petals and releases a Star Bit when touched.

Objects.Name: Following Star Piece Group
Objects.Notes: Creates a bunch of Star Bits that will move around the player. Usually used during Launch Star flights.

Objects.Name: Star Bit Group
Objects.Notes: Creates a group of Star Bits that are placed in a circle or along a set path.

Objects.Name: Rainbow Star Bit
Objects.Notes: A large rainbow-colored Star Bit which creates a trail of smaller Star Bits while it moves.

Objects.Name: Star Bit Spawn Point
Objects.Notes: An object that spawns several Star Bits when activated.

Objects.Name: Star Bit Volcano Eruption
Objects.Notes: Spawns a bunch of Star Bits when activated. This also creates a volcanic eruption effect.

Objects.Name: Power Star Return Sequence
Objects.Notes: Sets up the sequence and path for when the player returns to the HUB after collecting a Power Star.

Objects.Name: Starry Sky
Objects.Notes: A colorful sky model featuring many stars.

Objects.Name: Toy Time -- Skating Ice Collision
Objects.Notes: An invisible ice collision layer that is used to make skating on the many ice platforms smoother.

Objects.Name: Steam Effect
Objects.Notes: A decorative steam effect that is used in Gateway Galaxy's interior section.

Objects.Name: Mandibug Stack
Objects.Notes: The miniboss fought at the end of the second mission of Honeyhive Galaxy and at the end of the first mission of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Mandibug
Objects.Notes: A purple bug that charges at the player once it spots them.

Objects.Name: Picture Book Text Area
Objects.Notes: Displays some text if entered in a picture book stage.

Objects.Name: Picture Book Warp Area
Objects.Notes: Warps the player to a specific point if entered in a picture book stage.

Objects.Name: Prologue -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet used at the start of the prologue.

Objects.Name: Prologue -- Master Luma Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where Master Luma is located during the prologue.

Objects.Name: Silver Star
Objects.Notes: A Silver Star that is trapped in a bubble. The player usually has to collect five of them to make a Power Star appear.

Objects.Name: Sprangler
Objects.Notes: A spider-like enemy that hangs from a web.

Objects.Name: Used Block
Objects.Notes: A brown Used Block that serves as a platform in several galaxies.

Objects.Name: Used Block [2D]
Objects.Notes: A small Used Block used during SMG2's prologue.

Objects.Name: Starship Mario -- Stump Platform
Objects.Notes: A small tree stump platform used for NPCs that appear on Starship Mario.

Objects.Name: Underwater Steam Effect
Objects.Notes: An effect consisting of hot steam that burn the player upon contact.

Objects.Name: Underwater Volcano Effect
Objects.Notes: An effect consisting of hot steam and clouds that burn the player upon contact.

Objects.Name: Bonefin -- Stone Pillar
Objects.Notes: A large destroyable stone pillar that connects the shell and core of the main planet.

Objects.Name: Bonefin -- Main Planet Core
Objects.Notes: The spherical core that makes up the actual main planet.

Objects.Name: Bonefin -- Main Planet Shell
Objects.Notes: The large spiked "shell" that surrounds the main planet core.

Objects.Name: Bonefin -- Large Shell
Objects.Notes: An unused large destroyable shell that generates air bubbles when destroyed.

Objects.Name: Beach Bowl Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky model used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Tweester
Objects.Notes: A small tornado enemy with googly eyes and a small attraction range. Can defend itself with two spiky rocks as well.

Objects.Name: Deep Dark -- Sunken Ship
Objects.Notes: A sunken ghost ship that appears on Deep Dark Galaxy's seafloor.

Objects.Name: Sunlight Area
Objects.Notes: An unused variant of GlaringLightArea that was meant to work in combination with "Sunshade" collision meshes, such as those provided by SunshadeMapParts.

Objects.Name: Sunlight Area [Cube]
Objects.Notes: An area of "invisible light" that will kill any Boos or remove the Boo power-up from the player when entered.

Objects.Name: Sunset Atmosphere
Objects.Notes: The sunset atmosphere used in Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Generic Sunshade Map Object [Unused]
Objects.Notes: A generic object with a special collision model to protect Boo's and the Boo power-up from sunlight (SunLightArea). It retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo, however, no more models exist for this object.

Objects.Name: Cosmic Spirit
Objects.Notes: The dark blue Cosmic Spirit that aids the player if they die several consecutive times in a specific section of a galaxy.

Objects.Name: Launch Star
Objects.Notes: A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.

Objects.Name: Green Launch Star
Objects.Notes: A green version of the Launch Star which appears after collecting all Green Stars.

Objects.Name: Pink Launch Star
Objects.Notes: A pink version of the Launch Star which appears after a Hungry Luma is fed.

Objects.Name: Co-Star Mode Butterfly
Objects.Notes: A small orange butterfly that appears in Co-Star Mode only.

Objects.Name: Goal Gate

Objects.Notes: A blue checkered arrow sign used in Loopdeeloop Galaxy and Loopdeeswoop Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: A circle-shaped sand planet used in Loopdeeloop Galaxy and Loopdeeswoop Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: A large colored ring that is used around the main courses from Loopdeeloop Galaxy and Loopdeeswoop Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: The starting planet with the colorful tube segments.

Objects.Name: Surfing Challenge -- Winners Podium

Objects.Name: Manta Ray
Objects.Notes: The rideable Manta Ray from the surfing challenges in Loopdeeloop Galaxy and Loopdeeswoop Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Sling Pod Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Bubble Blast Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Grand Finale Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Loopdeeloop Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Loopdeeswoop Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Rolling Gizmo Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A green portal that opens Sand Spiral Galaxy's Star select screen when touched during a Launch Star flight.

Objects.Notes: A huge spoon from Toy Time Galaxy and Sweet Sweet Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: A ball with a Power Star or Purple Coin inside it.

Objects.Notes: A Star Ball which uses a signboard tutorial to explain the Star Ball mechanics.

Objects.Notes: The main planet of Drip Drop Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: A group of Octoboos that move together.

Objects.Notes: The iconic ghost enemy.

Objects.Notes: A Big Boo that is followed by four smaller Boos. They move on a set path.

Objects.Name: Boo with Power Star
Objects.Notes: A variant of a Boo that always spawns a Power Star.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Twisted Haunted Mansion Bridge

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Bumpy Haunted Mansion Bridge
Objects.Notes: A bumpy dark stone bridge to the main entrance of the haunted mansion.

Objects.Name: Ghostly Candlestick
Objects.Notes: A lit candlestick used in Ghostly Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Door
Objects.Notes: A double door of dark wood with a big gilded lock in the middle.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Backdoor
Objects.Notes: A double door of dark wood with a small gilded lock in the middle.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Entrance Door
Objects.Notes: A big double door of dark wood that closes instead of opening.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Broken Ceiling Part
Objects.Notes: A circular broken part of the haunted mansion's inner room ceiling that can be destroyed with a Ground Pound.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Large Swinging Light
Objects.Notes: A large swinging ceiling light which projects a focused light beam.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Small Swinging Light
Objects.Notes: A small swinging ceiling light which projects a focused light beam.

Objects.Notes: A variant of TeresaMansionGatePlanet where the dead trees are on the underside and there are no stone structures.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Exterior
Objects.Notes: The exterior of the haunted mansion.

Objects.Notes: The three interior rooms of the haunted mansion, the lobby, the inner room, and the secret attic.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Top Floor
Objects.Notes: The top floor and roof of the haunted mansion.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Haunted Mansion Lobby
Objects.Notes: A standalone version of the haunted mansion's lobby from TeresaMansionPlanetB but without the staircases.

Objects.Name: Boo Picture
Objects.Notes:
A picture of a Boo or Bomb Boo. The TexChange frame IDs for the different pictures are:
0 Boo
1 Empty
2 Bomb Boo

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Goal Planet
Objects.Notes: The gloomy planet with a crystal ring that serves as the goal planet of the Spooky Sprint against the Spooky Speedster on Ghostly Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Meat Bone
Objects.Notes: The large bone with bouncy meat.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Skull
Objects.Notes: A decorative animated skull.

Objects.Name: Spooky Speedster
Objects.Notes: A large boo with a distinctive outfit that challenges the player for a race.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Long Bone
Objects.Notes: A decorative floating bone.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Rib
Objects.Notes: A decorative animated rib.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Spine
Objects.Notes: A large decorative spine.

Objects.Name: Ghostly -- Spooky Sprint Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The gloomy planet with dead trees where the Spooky Speedster challenges the player.

Objects.Notes: The golden metal hatch from the Boo Box Planet in Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Deep Dark -- Boo Box Light Beam
Objects.Notes: A decorative beam of light that is used in the Boo Box in Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Deep Dark -- Boo Box Planet
Objects.Notes: A large, gilded purple box planet from Deep Dark Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Underwater Boo
Objects.Notes: An underwater variant of a Boo.

Objects.Notes: The three small planets from Sky Station Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: The game's iconic Luma NPC.

Objects.Notes: A variant of a Luma that does not appear until collecting a specific amount of Green Stars.

Objects.Name: Master Luma
Objects.Notes: The apricot baby Luma that grants the player the spin ability.

Objects.Name: Big Luma
Objects.Notes: A huge version of a Luma that appears in Supermassive Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Comet Medal
Objects.Notes: A collectable octagonal-shaped medal with a picture of a Comet on it.

Objects.Name: Prankster Comet Luma
Objects.Notes: The dark purple Luma holding star-shaped wands who can move Prankster Comets around in exchange for some Star Bits.

Objects.Notes: The blue Luma who transforms into the Terrace's Pull Star during the cutscene when the player first enters the dome.

Objects.Notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for Star Bits.

Objects.Name: Hungry Luma [Coins]
Objects.Notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for Coins.

Objects.Name: Hungry Luma [World Map]
Objects.Notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for Star Bits. Appears on the Starship Mario when requested on the World Map.

Objects.Name: Hungry Luma [Galaxies]
Objects.Notes: A pink Luma that is hungry for Star Bits and transforms into a portal to a galaxy accessible from the Comet Observatory.

Objects.Name: Moving Luma
Objects.Notes: A decorative Luma that moves on a path.

Objects.Name: Decorative Luma
Objects.Notes: A decorative Luma used in the cutscene of Rosalina reading to the Lumas in the Library.

Objects.Notes: A large blue Luma that can transform on the spot into either a Life Mushroom or a 1-Up Mushroom after being paid some Star Bits.

Objects.Name: Lumalee Shop [Dices]
Objects.Notes: A blue Luma that can transform on the spot into a 1-Up Chance Cube.

Objects.Notes: A Green Luma who transforms into a Green Launch Star upon player request.

Objects.Name: Plus Clock
Objects.Notes: A stopwatch that adds additional seconds to the Comet timer.

Objects.Name: Timed Coins ? Block
Objects.Notes: A ? Block that gives one Coin every time it is hit. Disappears after some hits and seconds.

Objects.Notes: An area that consists of an invisible body of water.

Objects.Name: Starshine Beach -- Starting Planet
Objects.Notes: The starting planet from Starshine Beach Galaxy. It has a lot of corals.

Objects.Name: Water Current
Objects.Notes: A water current that pushes the player away.

Objects.Name: "Temporary High Model" [WaterTransparentPlanet]
Objects.Notes: An unfinished placeholder model that displays a white cube with the text "Temporary High Model, Please wait..." written on it.

Objects.Name: Gusty Garden -- Miniature Windmill
Objects.Notes: A tiny decorative windmill.

Objects.Name: Decorative Whirlpool
Objects.Notes: A decorative whirlpool that is meant to connect the water surface to an actual WhirlPoolAccelerator.

Objects.Name: Whirlpool
Objects.Notes: A whirlpool of configurable size that spins the player around upon contact underwater.

Objects.Name: Freezy Flake -- Blizzard Planet
Objects.Notes: The blizzard planet from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Epilogue Background Model
Objects.Notes: The background model used during SMG1's epilogue.

Objects.Name: Freezy Flake -- Dead Snow Tree
Objects.Notes: A decorative dead snow tree from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Rolling Green -- Windmill Propeller
Objects.Notes: The big windmill propeller found at the end of Rolling Green Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Rolling Gizmo -- Windmill Propeller
Objects.Notes: The toy windmill propeller found at the end of Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Winged Coin ? Block
Objects.Notes: A winged ? Block which drops a Coin after being hit.

Objects.Name: Winged Star Bits ? Block
Objects.Notes: A winged ? Block which drops some Star Bits after being hit.

Objects.Name: Red Metal Cage
Objects.Notes: A red metal cage that appears in Spin-Dig Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Crate
Objects.Notes: A wooden box that can be destroyed through most attacks. It can spawn various different items.

Objects.Name: Tall Trunk -- Circular Log Planet
Objects.Notes: The final planet from Tall Trunk Galaxy's first star.

Objects.Name: Tall Trunk -- Cylinder Log Planet
Objects.Notes: The cylindrical tree planet from Tall Trunk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Tall Trunk -- Moving Log Platforms
Objects.Notes: A set of moving logs from the cylindrical tree planet from Tall Trunk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Wide Wood Bridge
Objects.Notes: Creates a suspension bridge consisting of long logs.

Objects.Name: Narrow Wood Bridge
Objects.Notes: Creates a suspension bridge consisting of short logs.

Objects.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Thick Falling Wood Piece
Objects.Notes: A thick piece of wood which falls on a set path; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Thin Falling Wood Piece
Objects.Notes: A thin piece of wood which collapses down; used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Decorative Wood Debris with Tools
Objects.Notes: Decorative wood debris from Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Puzzle Plank -- Decorative Wood Debris with Nails
Objects.Notes: Decorative wood debris from Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

Objects.Notes: The background model from World 1.

Objects.Notes: The sky model from World 1.

Objects.Notes: The sky model from World 2.

Objects.Notes: The background model from World 3.

Objects.Notes: The sky model from World 6.

Objects.Notes: The background model from World S.

Objects.Notes: The sky model from World S.

Objects.Name: Starship Panel
Objects.Notes: Pressing on the switch will open the world screen.

Objects.Name: Starship Sky
Objects.Notes: The sky controller used on Starship Mario that uses a different model depending on the currently selected world.

Objects.Name: World Sound Emitter Area [Cube]
Objects.Notes: An area that plays a sound effect if the currently selected world matches the specified world.

Objects.Name: Decorative World Map Entry Portal
Objects.Notes: A decorative portal from the World Map that appears if the player is close to the currently selected world's entry portal.

Objects.Name: Decorative World Map Exit Portal
Objects.Notes: A decorative portal from the World Map that appears if the player is close to the currently selected world's exit portal.

Objects.Name: Gusty Garden -- Apple Planets
Objects.Notes: A group of giant apples that house a giant caterpillar from Gusty Garden Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Star Chip
Objects.Notes: A collectable yellow chip. Usually, five of them have to be collected.

Objects.Name: Star Chip Group
Objects.Notes: Controls a collection of Star Chips and activates something once all are collected.

Objects.Name: Dash Yoshi Block [Broken]
Objects.Notes: A block that can be dashed into with Dash Yoshi. Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Small Dirt Planet
Objects.Notes: A small spherical dirt planet with some decorative rocks.

Objects.Name: Grapple Flower
Objects.Notes: A flower which Yoshi can grab with his tongue to swing himself in its direction.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Climbing Planet
Objects.Notes: The final planet from Yoshi Star Galaxy's first star.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Grapple Explanation Area
Objects.Notes: An area which shows the player how to use Yoshi Grapple Flowers.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Tiny Dirt Planet
Objects.Notes: A tiny spherical dirt planet with a small decorative fossil.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Main Planet
Objects.Notes: The main planet of Yoshi Star Galaxy, featuring the huge volcano.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Stepped Mountain Planet
Objects.Notes: A tall stepped mountain planet. A similar version of this can be found in Good Egg Galaxy from SMG1.

Objects.Name: Haunty Halls -- Bulb Berry Planet Solids
Objects.Notes: The solid platforms of Haunty Halls Galaxy's bulb berry section.

Objects.Name: Haunty Halls -- Bulb Berry Planet Platforms
Objects.Notes: The invisible parts of the bulb berry planet from Haunty Halls Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Tongue Explanation Area
Objects.Notes: An area which shows the player how to use Yoshi's tongue.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Egg
Objects.Notes: An egg that hatches into Yoshi if destroyed.

Objects.Name: Magic Cage
Objects.Notes: A magical cage created by a Magikoopa. It holds the Yoshi Egg in Yoshi Star Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Stone Platform
Objects.Notes: The small stone platform where the player finds the Yoshi Egg in Yoshi Star Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Pink Fruit
Objects.Notes: A pink fruit which can be eaten by Yoshi.

Objects.Name: Big Orange Fruit
Objects.Notes: A big orange fruit which can be eaten by Yoshi with a strong pull.

Objects.Name: Space Junk -- Yoshi Head Planet
Objects.Notes: The wooden Yoshi head planet from Space Junk Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Moving Wood Platform
Objects.Notes: A moving wood platform from Yoshi Star Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Fearsome Fleet -- First Checkpoint Planet
Objects.Notes: A set of two blue platforms which contain the first checkpoint before the Megahammer boss fight in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

Objects.Name: Yoshi Star -- Bridge-Pulling Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where Yoshi has to pull a small set of bridges with his tongue.

Objects.Name: Waving Yoshi Area
Objects.Notes: When the player dismounts Yoshi in this area, Yoshi waves them goodbye.

Objects.Name: Sorbetti
Objects.Notes: The rolling snow ball boss from Freezy Flake Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Freezy Flake -- Sorbetti Battle Planet
Objects.Notes: The planet where the boss fight against Sorbetti takes place.

Objects.Name: Sorbetti Snow Spike
Objects.Notes: A destroyable snow spike seen during Sorbetti's boss fight in Freezy Flake Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Freezy Flake -- Sorbetti-shaped Planet
Objects.Notes: A planet with the shape of the Sorbetti boss.

Objects.Name: Leafless Snowy Tree
Objects.Notes: A leafless snowy tree as seen on Sorbetti's battle planet in Freezy Flake Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Zero Gravity [Box Range]
Objects.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards collision triangles. This one has a box range.

Objects.Name: Zero Gravity [Cylinder Range]
Objects.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards collision triangles. This one has a cylindrical range.

Objects.Name: Slipsand -- 2D Underground Room
Objects.Notes: The 2D underground section from Slipsand Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Slipsand -- 2D Underground Rotating Stone
Objects.Notes: A rotating stone from the 2D underground section in Slipsand Galaxy.

Objects.Name: Zero Gravity [Sphere Range]
Objects.Notes: A gravity area that attracts objects towards collision triangles. This one has a spherical range.

Objects.Name: Cloudy Court -- Left Crushing Wall
Objects.Notes: The left half of a crushing wall from Cloudy Court Galaxy. The model has no back side.

Objects.Name: Cloudy Court -- Right Crushing Wall
Objects.Notes: The right half of a crushing wall from Cloudy Court Galaxy. The model has no back side.

Objects.Name: Blue Shine of Light
Objects.Notes: A decorative bright blue light, similar to the light used around Power Stars (PowerStarHalo).
